reviews.review:
We have ordered delivery several times via EAT24 and it is ridiculously fast!!!! Fresh, hot, and fast! 

Our favs are Pad Thai (no egg), Pad Kee Mao, and yellow curry. The crispy vegetable spring rolls we have also ordered before and they were yummy. Hot and crispy. 

The yellow potato curry is one of the best I have ever had. I love the way they cut the potatoes...big. 
It comes with steamed or brown rice. I love having the brown rice option! 

Pad Thai here is large and flavorful. We ask for no eggs and it comes with a large pile of sprouts and I love the ground peanuts and slice fresh lime.

The Pad Kee Mao (I get it medium and wow it's pretty spicy) is full of yummy Thai basil and big fresh flat noodles. 

The portions are big here and the prices are on target. 

We are fans of Komol but for different reasons. My husband said Weera's food is better...but I like Komol more because of their herbal salad. 

No mock meats here at Weera, just fresh Thai with the option of tofu. We get the extra veggie option instead of tofu.
The food is great the management here sucks. They need a lot of improvement in how they greet, sit, and serve customers.

This used to be royal Thai then they changed management. This is right across the street from our job and used to frequent here. Ever since the change they must've also changed the quality of the meat. One word: HORRIBLE!!!!!! We refuse to eat here anymore!!! We gave it the benefit of the doubt we all ordered at least twice, ugh gross. Go down the street to Thai express.

We ordered the pad see ew beef and green curry chicken for 23 on a Saturday afternoon. We used the 10 for 20 groupon. Each dish was 10 

- Only one promo at a time. They have a 10% facebook check-in.
- Free thai tea ad? haha. you pay 3.50 for the thai tea, then you get unlimited refills. 
- Lots of egg with pad see ew! Loved it. 
- Kale too hard. cook it more.
- Small portions. For 10, not a deal. Good thing there's the groupon. 
- Green curry was great! eggplants were soft and delicious. right mix of coconut milk for the curry. medium is a perfect blend. 
- Small portion of rice. Just one scoop. 
- total came out to 19.58 but the remaining credit from the 20 is voided. 
- Great place for a coupon, but to come without one, I'd reconsider.
Tried the fresh rolls with tofu(the sause was a delight) and pineapple fried rice. Excellent taste with good ambiance and service.

I've never sat down and ate here, but they deliver, and love ordering for lunch here my shop. The Pineapple Fried Rice with Chicken is my Favorite....always satisfied! and the Veggie Soup is the BOMB...

Disclosure- I go here like 2 times a week. It is good, it is not insane good and I'm still morning the loss of now closed Thai BBQ's Tiger's cry and crispy spicy catfish, but it is totally solid and perfect for lunch. The waitresses are always cool. All the curries are great. It is family friendly, but kind of boring. I'm glad they got rid of the old fake fishing rod decoration (which I now miss) but the new decor is not making me feel so homey and comfortable- its kind of sterile, but whatever, great food. its solid and never disappoints, just not amazing.
Great food, good prices, friendly service, nice Thai decor.

Love it here! Their panang curry is my favorite! Only thing I don't like is they don't do refills on plain hot coffee which they serve in a small tea cup to begin with, so 3 sips and you're done... I'd understand if it were a latte or thai tea but plain coffee? Hmmm
This place is awesome.  Great portion sizes.  Happy hour specials.  Level 5 spice was intense, I'm going to go for 4 next time.

I think this place is promising. Only tried two dishes with my friend, but I liked our duck order. We did manage to have some communication error (though I'm not sure on whose fault because it might be the lack of English skills on part of the waitress, but it doesn't matter at this time) with an order, but they fixed that for us.

We ordered L5. Pad Kee Mow with beef (flat wide rice noodles stir-fried w/ mint, chili, tomatoes, & Thai spices) and I liked the noodles. Eventually, I was just grabbing the noodles to eat. Beef was good, too.

Our second order was T2. Ped Nom Tok (sliced boneless roasted duck homemad w/ chili pastte, herbs, spices, & lime juice). I couldn't tell that it was duck but it was yummy in a weird way? It was the sauces and spice and everything nice on it, I suppose? Haha. I would order it again, at least :b.

I will definitely be back in on a future visit to try their other dishes. I would like to try some more of fellow yelpers' recommendations :).

The Weera Thai restaurant is a great find in Vegas. The restaurant is clean, inviting, the price is very reasonable and the service is excellent.

Our party ordered the following dishes and we all thought they were really terrific. The ones that were exceptional were the shrimp mango salad (spicy level 3 - ranges from 1 to 5 and 1 being the mild), Tom Yum soup, fried rice and the Thai nacho was interesting and rather tasty. 

Shrimp mango salad
Tom Yum Kung/Soup (Large)
Green curry with chicken
Salmon Panang
Thai combination fried rice
Nachos with larb and basil
Mango sticky rice
Beer - Heineken

We also got a complimentary ice cream sundae for checking in on Yelp!
It pays to be an Yelper!
I really have liked weera but lately something is a miss from service to the food.   I did share my concerns with the manager so let's hope they get back on track.

I have been to Weera a couple times now, first for the Yelp deal, and recently for a quick, cheap dinner. Their crab fried rice is excellent, uses real crab meat and is a large portion. Their orange chicken is great! It is crispy, orangey, and hot when it comes out. Spring rolls and peanut sauce were awesome as well. The rolls were nice, crispy, and very fresh. The sauce was flavorful and did not taste like it was previously stored. The only downside I see here is the pop background music, not a fan of listening to top 40's while I'm eating.
Food still excellent , Peter still gave us the warm greeting like always . Personal touch is alway appreciate . Thanks for give us a place to enjoy .

When my husband and I moved here we went to many Thai restaurants and this is our favorite. Their Thai Teas are great and the food has never let us down. We usually get the  Massa man Curry, Thai egg rolls, and Pad Prik King. The flavors are good, they are accommodating to personalization, prompt on checking on you, and super friendly.

We always had the same waitress at the beginning and she knew our order and the ladies there always would say hi and play with our young son if it wasn't crowded. I have taken friends there almost every time they come to town and they all enjoyed it too.

5 Stars. 

I would say, LOS is King of Thai food in Vegas (not anymore)
Weera Thai is the Queen.
Le Thai is a prodigal son.

I have eaten several times at Weera, and I have to admire them because;

1. portion is much bigger than LOS.
2. price is cheaper than LOS.
3. and best of all, they use really good vegetables. It doesn't simply mean it's fresh. They are tasty. Tomatoes, eggplants, etc etc,, Sweet and TASTY,,, I wonder where they get these veggies. Great that they don't overcook veggies, too.

Oh, yes, you gotta try their coconut ice cream. It's the best I have ever eaten.
Thai ice tea/coffee is dense and really good. 

Atmosphere and the location is not that great, but I don't care.

I will definitely go back.

As with most Asian places, we love to order family style, getting several great dishes to share, and sometimes, we order too much, but then we get to take home the left overs and get to enjoy them all over again.

Today, we share the pad prik king with beef.  The green beans are still slightly crisp and the red chile paste is spicy good.  Next we get the sweet and sour pork, with the veggies cut in decent size wedges covered in a tangy sauce.  We then got the spicy eggplant with pork.  I love sweet thai basil.  Finally we got the pad thai noodle.  This is always one of our favorites and this one is up there with some of the best.

The food was very good, the service was excellent, worth a return trip.

All around good Thai food. They have an extensive menu that could be compared with Lotus of Siam, just with better service and a lower price tag. The food has varied on my visits between outstanding and good. It's not always consistent, which is why it gets only 4 stars.

Do: Try the pineapple rice, it's so damn good!
Don't: Accidentally wander in to the shady looking massage parlor right next door. Weera is fairly nondescript, as is the massage parlor. I nearly ended up through that door by mistake on my first visit.

I love the food here. My favorite is the medium hot beef salad. I called one day to make an order for pick up because I was sick, so I ordered the usual beef salad but this time I also asked for a Thai iced tea and asked if I could put a little ice. He said he would have to charge me extra for less ice. So I told them to scratch the ice tea off. Then he says, "ok, so you don't want to order anything" ummm. No why would I not want my salad I love and get at least once a week?! The fuck! I thought to myself. I should of gone somewhere else but I was sick and Hungry. Also what do you expect from an Asian place. Most Asian are bad with customer service.
The best thai food I have ever had. Their fresh spring rolls are amazing and pineapple fried rice is a must try. Definitely recommend this to everyone.

As aficionados of Thai food around the country, and having given up on Archi's Thai in Las Vegas, we've been thrilled for the past year to frequent Weera Thai, and here is why:  The environment is charming & well designed, and the music is so unlike every other restaurant.  We can actually have a conversation!  The employees, from the chef to the wait staff, are wonderful people who truly care who came in to dine.  The menu is fantastic in its variety, and their specialty is duck.  For vegetarians, the tofu eggplant is divine & they will accommodate any appetite.  We love the chicken basil (or eggplant), Pad Thai shrimp, all of the curries, several duck specialties, mango salad & daily specials.  Weera also has happy hour 7 days a week which includes great drink prices & several appetizers.

BON APPETIT to you at Weera Thai!

K I K I

This quaint, clean, and casual eatery is my new go to place for my pad Thai, curry, or papaya salad cravings.  Plain simple folks serving and dishing out oh so flavorful lunch specials.  Here's to downhome Thai cooking!
Best fried chicken wontons, sweetest servers, decent prices, good portions. Used to eat here at least once as week. Had a few hiccups but overall a great place.

Popular business luncheon spot.

I ordered the wonton spinach soup (add glass noodle $2 extra) which had a rich broth and was plenty filling for lunch.  It came to about $15.50 which is a bit more expensive than the lunch specials ($9.99) and didn't have the $1.50 Thai Ice Tea deal.

It was my first time there and our food took a long time to be made, all 4 of us got food at different times.  The bill was wrong and took a few times to fix e.g. we ordered 3 Thai ice tea together and we were charged for 7, 3 of which with the $1.50 deal, and 4 more at full price which we didn't order or get.  My advice, check you bill!
Wow I'm so glad I came to this restaurant the food is amazing the place is nice and clean, just an amazing experience.

This is one of our favorite Thai restaurants in Vegas. Food is good, clean and fresh. Although it's in a strip mall, the inside ambiance is modern and clean.

The beef salad is delicious and the beef is nice and tender.

I just wish this place was near or house or it might be a weekly spot for us!
So happy to find Weera Thai! Delicious! The flavors are fantastic. Even the basic Pad Thai is great. I'm already craving my next visit.

Great service ! 

Great foood! 

Just found out they serve HAPPY HOUR! 
Can't wait to come back! 
Yum!
Nice decor, friendly staff. Very large menu. Full bar. Recommend the crispy duck panang curry. Lots of crispy duck! My friend ordered the panang curry with chicken. Oodles of chicken in his order.

We were staying at the MGM and getting tired of the strip food and the overpriced food.  My wife is Thai and she really wanted to eat.  Well this is the place.  The food is fresh and the prices are great.  We started with Thai Seafood Salad$12.95.  Jumbo Shrimp white fish and squid.  wow!!!  My wife ordered Issan sausage.  Very authentic.  And tasted great. I could go on forever. Let's just say the food is great.  Cab from MGM $20.00. Cheaper if your near downtown.   We ate at Seablue an Tao. The food here is 1/4 of the price. And 4x better.

yep - A-OK.  Heard about this from a friend, tried it this afternoon for lunch.  Pad Prik chicken, two scoop white rice, mix green salad, 1 egg roll, sweet sauce, thai tea, $10 something.  
Quick service, maybe 10% occupied.  Lunch prices till 3:30.  

Lunch sized entree, smallish egg roll.  I have a food allergy to onions, so the soup was suspect - when questioned, it was removed to be sure.    

Condiment jars: Thai "chilis" were jalapenos in vinegar, no peanuts, three versions of red sauce.  I prefer bird's eye that chili in fish sauce.  

Heat: Ordered a 4/5.  Nice glowing heat, but half the jar of vinegar jalapenos climbed it up to face sweat under the eyes.  Happy.    

In conclusion: reliable thai food, looked at what others ordered and wondered what it was as it looked very good.  My onion allergy limits my options, but always looking for good food.

Food: It's just okay if you like dry cardboard meat. 
We ordered stir fried rice noodles with beef ( beef is hard ).
Chicken green curry with chicken, chicken is hard too. 
Chef's special garlic spare ribs, dry again and lots of bones. 
Disappointed. 

Service: The waitress was just doing their job. Don't feel like welcoming. Also they rush to send us check, which I think it's kind of rude. 

Well not again for me!
The food taste and the services are consistent. A perfect spot for authentic Thai food!
Good value.  Great food.  Excellent Service!

Now I....
Had...
The Thai of my life...
And I never felt this way before...
Yes, I swear...
It's the truth...
And I owe it all to you...

OK- actually, I owe it all to my grimy friend who lives in Tucson, but knows Vegas about 10x better than most natives/locals ('cause he's one of those cool geeky kids who knows everything about anything).

Pardon the "Dirty Dancing" reference, and cast some stones this direction for getting that garbage song stuck in your head, but it really IS the truth.  Weera Thai is the best.

I'm not going to proclaim myself as some sort of expert on Thai cuisine, and especially if we break it down to Isaan-style Thai.  Hell, I don't know the names of regions of Thailand.  All I know is that the food coming out of this kitchen shames most of the places that I've had Thai food at before.

My improper experiences have led me to believe that Thai food is always heavy, almost too thick to enjoy.  Sauces that are so rich that you leave feeling bloated and bogged down.

That notion was not present here.  Everything, from the crab stick appetizers right on down to the wonderful curries, has a lightness and delicate nature to it.  Fresh.  Flavorful.  Complex.  Satisfying, yet leaving you wanting more.  More of the fantastic flavors of Thai food without that after-Thanksgiving-dinner feel to it.

Don't get me wrong, you will walk out of here full, but not over stuffed.

Another positive: service is friendly, attentive, dare I say sweet?

Do not be weary of Weera Thai.  After trying seven things on the menu, it is clear to me that they know how to serve up some amazing Thai dishes.

味道不错的说。。值得推荐。。比stripe上那些强太多，价格公道

其实这附近真的算是Hidden Gem，有很多reasonable priced restaurant。虽然味道不能跟LA or SF比，但是确实能找到很多惊喜

惊喜1. 这里有软壳蟹.. 虽然油了一点，但是别的地方很难找到
惊喜2. Thai Tea在Happy Hour有Special，Half Price
惊喜3. 五花肉真的不错

当然，作为一家Thai Restaurant缺点也很明显
总体过油.. 偏American化，但是在rating inflated的Vegas还是值得一去的。

Vegas不吃Buffet党的选择之一

I have been going to Weera for quite some time. So we decided why not dine in! When we first walked in, we were shock with the new interior of the restaurant. The interior is very inviting and you can just tell the employees love their job!! We decided to order the Penang crispy duck and crispy pork stir fry. Both were delicious. Those dishes are some of our go to dishes. If you download the app five stars, you accumulate points with Weera Thai. You can get free entrees, appetizers, etc. What's nice about Five Stars is that Weera noticed my birthday was coming up so they offered a complimentary dessert. You know I can't pass up dessert, so we decided to get the sticky rice with mango. :) soooo good!! And the portion was perfect!!! That was really cool!

The crispy duck salad is amazing! I have had this three times and they always put a lot of crispy duck that complements a tangy salad of greens, cherry tomatoes, Papaya, cashews and more. 

I have also had the pad sew eww which was great but I would have like more veggies, but the noodles and sauce are perfect- fresh and delicious.

One item that surprised me was the mango sticky rice. I typically don't indulge in these kind of desserts, but I was pregnant and it sounded good. Now it is a standard when I go here and I'm not even pregnant anymore! The sweet rice comes with a always ripe mango and a warm milky sauce. Delish!

Always great food and I have been and ordered delivery. Great service for both!
Went there for my sister in law's birthday. Always great service and great  food. Coconut ice cream with sticky rice was awesome!!!

We came here on a 30$ living socials deal and heard that this was reviewed as one of Las Vegas top 5 Thai restaurants. 

We Ordered the Duck Curry spicy #3 on a 1-5 spice scale and the crab fried rice. I love places like this that offer brown rice as an alternative and decided to substitute white for brown. The crab fried rice was full of flavor and tasted like they used fresh crab. The duck curry was awesome but was a little too spicy for a #3 but like most Thai places i always believe the number depends on the chef that day. 

For desert we decided on the durian sticky rice with coconut milk. Now for all of you that don't know what durian is its that infamous stinky fruit usually found in most Asian markets. At first I was hesitant to try the desert so I tasted the rice without the fruit and it was pretty good. I then tried it with the durian and it was like nothing I've tasted before and considered it one of the best deserts I've ever tasted. 

Good Thai food and really friendly staff and the best stinky sticky rice I've ever tasted.

IMO this is the best Thai restaurant in Las Vegas.  They have dishes here made for Thais and not just for Americans with Thai taste.  Try the khao soi, chicken leg with curry sauce over noodles, can't find that any where in LV or Hoy Tod, mussels in tapioca batter with vegetable and sauce (my girlfriend's favorite).  Take it from a Thai.

Careful, you might overlook it. It's kind of hidden with all the other shops in this packed strip mall on Sahara. But once in the restaurant, it's clean, cozy, well designed. The staff is extremely polite. I always gravitate back to my comfort food - Pad-Se-Ew. It met my expectations. Good sized portion, great taste. I loved it.

I've been here about 5-6 times and will continue coming.

In the mood for Thai our friend suggested this place I was up for trying a new spot.  After pulling in I started to question his choice but upon walking in, wow really nicely decorated and everything was sparkling clean!  

We came right before happy hour ended (it ends at 7pm) so we ordered a couple of half price apps to start.  We decide to eat family style and just try a bunch of new stuff.

Our appetizers included fried tofu, thai egg rolls.  Our dinner included the specialty that everyone who comes here seems to talk about fried papaya salad, amazing but eat it fast because after it cools not as good.  Pork Larb, a new dish for me it is a citrusy  mint meat dish, delish when eaten over rice and definite redo.  Panange chicken curry my boyfriends favorite dish quite good here.  Fried Mussels coated in egg batter, not my favorite dish seemed overly oily but the size of the mussels were large!  We finished with the sticky rice and mango, mango perfectly ripe and the creamy flavored rice do to perfection.

I tried a bit of everything then went back for seconds on the items I liked best which was everything except one so needless to say I was beyond stuffed.  I think this place is gonna give Lotus a run for it's money.  I will defiantly be back!

Best Thai meal I have ever had
I can't explain why. I have had Thai that I've liked, and even loved, before. Weera is located in an area with tons and tons of Asian restaurants, so I imagine competition is fierce. All I know is if you are in the area and you choose Weera, you won't be disappointed.

Delivery was fast and easy! Only ordered for our office because it was so close and easy for everyone to choose something. 
Food was just OK. Once you've had Le Thai- everything else sucks.

We ate there last week and we are still  raving  about the food. The restaurant  is on the opposite  side of town from where we live, but was well worth  the drive. Everything  we ordered  from appetizers  to desert  was excellent. I especially  liked  the fresh spring rolls  with peanut sauce.
Food is still good.  They renovated the restaurant and starting to put unknown charges on your bill.   Watch for this.

My family loves Weera Thai.  It's our go-to place.  I tried it out for the first time now about 1.5 years ago.  It's always really wonderful.  

We usually get the crab sticks, sometimes that large soup (I think they are all great) the papaya salad (the best!).  We love it all.  Haven't had anything there that wasn't hot and super yummy.  We have probably been there 15 times now.

The only deficit I would say is that once in a while, the service is a leetle bit lacking.  Nothing major though and the servers are very nice, always!  Would also love it if they'd install a soda machine.  Nothing like cold Coca Cola (with free refills)  to go with the hot and spicy food of Weera Thai.

After walking crazy at the International Business Show by chance I exceeded my daily goal of 10,000 steps by an additional 2,000. 12,000 baby hip hip Horray!!! Actually more like take me Back to the hotel. I'm hungry and sleepy at the same time I don't know what I wanna do first. (Dragging feet) 

As I lay in the hotel bed on my tummy browsing yelp for good yummy vegas eats. I couldn't decide between  between Thai food or indian food. Hmmm...which one? (Thinking mode) I called Weeras and placed an order over the phone. 1) Thai tea 2) Dessert: sticky rice with mango 3) Pad see ew 4) Mango shrimp salad. Order was successfully placed with a long 45 minute wait. Oh boy the nervousness kicked in..." I hope this food is good." 
 
I reminisced about my day at I.B.S. What a spectacular day it had been! My smile was quite frozen in place after meeting Ty Pennington. My 1st real up close celebrity meeting. My thoughts were eventually interupted by my 2 year old who called me from his ipad. My little precious nephew. Never fails to make me smile. He kept me busy until *ding dong* "Yesss" the food was here. With a quick bye I raced to the kitchen. 
Standing over the dining table. I reached into the double bagged goodness. Everything was wrapped great. Out came the Thai teas. It almost felt like xmas. Unwrapping all the goodness. I opened the sticky rice mango dessert. Yes!!! Im guilty. I had dessert with dinner. I couldn't get enough of the rice and coconut flavor with a bite of sweet ripe mango. I felt I had landed in tropical heaven. 
Just when things couldn't get better. I opened the shrimp mango salad. Tasted very similar to papaya salad. But with huggggggeee shrimp (which I didn't eat) and loads of cashews. The combinations were orgasmic. Ba baM! 
The pad see ew was yum. Only one bite. I was 2 busy drooling over the mango goodness. Taking one bite of salad and another Bite of sticky rice. It was a tie between both!!!! 
So with that said this place is a .....
Must Try!!!
-delivery charge $3 +tip 
-order placed with ease over phone. 
-food arrived in 30 min instead of 45min
-leftovers next day taste just as great.
Incredible!!  Fresh food.  Restaurant was spotless.  Including the restrooms.  Great service.   Highly recommend!
I love this place. One of my favorite Thai's restaurant. The food taste very original which were super delicious! Employees are very nice. Definitely will go back again!

Authentic Thai food! Tom Kha served in hotspot was outstanding...so was Pad Se Ew yellow curry. Excellent and efficient service - one superwoman of lady who took orders and served and brought our check and everything else!

Food was great!  Clean quiet place. Started with wonton soup....absolutely delicious!!  Then shared orange chicken and shrimp pad thai with cold thai tea!! Everything was great....will definitely come back.

Food is good. It's in an unassuming strip mall on Sahara so keep an eye out for it. Service is great and the lunch specials are even better. I've been here several times at this point. 

It's a good staple Thai place which I keep going back to if that's any indicator. 

I can't say there is one thing that  really stands out above the rest other than service, cleanliness, and overall price. But let's be honest, Thai food is the Mexican food of Asia. I love and crave them both...but it's really hard to differentiate oneself for any other restaurant.

It's worth the visit and the people are really nice. They have a decent beer and wine selection too.

I loved this place before it remodeled. SERVICE WAS HORRIBLE!!!!!! The only time I saw a waitress was when I sat. Waited for 10mins before they took my order and had to wave the waitress down for another drink. Order took 40mins!!!! Such horrible service. Then I had to get up and ask for my bill and to ask for to go containers. Just slow horrible service!!!!!

This restaurant was originally Royal Thai, but they recently changed owners and cooks. The decor was decent, with my only complaint being a few antique American posters around the room under all the Thai decorations. They do have excellent service as they are extremely attentive and polite. 

I think their specialty is duck items, and I do agree. Their Laab was tasty and savory without being too herby. 

We also had Pad Thai and Pad Se-ew, which was also also good without being too salty and too sweet (for the Pad Thai). 

We also ordered 2 Tom Yum dishes: (1) seafood (2) pork ribs(? - can't remember.. some type of pork bone). In terms of favorite dish, I would go with the pork ribs tom yum because I prefer my dishes sour and I don't really prefer tomatoes, which make soups slightly sweet. In fact, we liked the pork ribs tom yum so much, we ordered another! :D The seafood tom yum was still okay though, just not suited for my tastes. A fair warning though; the preparations are Thai in custom, so they leave inedible herbs in the soup to maintain authenticity. You will know they are inedible because they are really chewy; I would just scoop it out. 

The great thing is, they do allow you to change the level of spiciness. I believe there are 5 levels you can choose from, depending on how hot you can handle the food. 

Finally, the famous Thai tea. I have to say, it was fine to me, but I have a sweet tooth, so this tea may be too sweet for the average person. However, I've had teas that are just too strong in tea level, and this one was just fine.

All in all, great job so far. If I were them, I would make new take-out menus soon and change the front of the restaurant to get rid of the "Royal Thai" name and put in Weera Thai so people do not get confused.

We got delivery as it was very hot and I was very tired. What a great experience still. 
Started with the wonton soup which might be the best I've ever had. So flavorful!
Next was tofu spring rolls which were delicious. The peanut dipping sauce was so spot on. 
We ordered chicken in red curry sauce and Mongolian beef as our entrees. They were both so good, flavorful and well cooked and so not greasy. We also got pineapple fried rice which was excellent. 
Overall there's no wrong choices and this will be our new go to spot. Can't wait to try something new. :)

I can't say enough good things about this place. Owners are terrific and the staff is fantastic. The food is terrific and seriously the best Thai food I have found in Las Vegas. It doesn't matter what you order it will be great. If you want pad Thai it's stellar, curry is amazing (all of them), the crab sticks are really a perfect appetizer, the spicy fried rice is epic, and the pork dishes are all fantastic. No matter what you like, veggies, seafood, pork, chicken, or curry dishes it is really amazing. See you there I am there all the time!!
Very tasty...Rainbow fried rice was excellent...pineapple, avocado, peppers, cashews, onions. Thai Pumpkin Curry w/tofu was awesome!!! Definitely a good choice!!!
The food is good. They maintain a HOMELY environment. The waiters are very simple and honest. They are caring as well. The food wait time was in acceptable limit.

Today Weera has shown me that they are very interested in offering Las Vegas good, fairly authentic Thai food.  Every time I come here, the owner asks me if there is anything he can do better.  And every time I come here, the food gets better!  This is a respectful business that could easily turn into a regular spot for me.

Today I had the Rad Nah, the Pa Cha, and the Roast Duck with Weera sauce.  

The Rad Nah was spot on in the gravy department.  It was thick, tasty, and smokey.  The noodles were pretty good, and the pork was really well prepared.  I would say that Weera does a pretty good Rad Nah, and that makes me happy.  

The Roast Duck dish we had was really tasty.  It was just a bit plate of sliced duck, along with a sweeter sauce.  The duck was well prepared, not fatty or gristly.  Another solid dish for Weera.

The Pa Cha was really spot on.  The Pa Cha isn't as strong as the versions I have had at other Thai restaurants that make this wonderful Thai dish, but the fried catfish was really yummy. We ordered it a 5/5 spice level, and it was spot on with flavor and heat.  I really recommend this dish at Weera.  They do it well.

Due to the A+ service and the improved food here, I am happy to say that Weera has earned a star in my book.  I will definitely be returning more often.  I have yet to try the curries, but I believe that Weera's specialties will be the soups and the stir fry dishes.

OMG!!! this place is awesome. customer service is great and restaurant and bathroom is clean.....first and foremost i have never been a fan of crab Rangoon mostly being because its been ordered from fast food Chinese restaurants and is not homemade....well this place changed my mind...chunky fresh crab inside and thin homemade wanton YUM! the KHAO SOI soup was amazzzzzzzzzzzzzinnnnnngggggggg! had a duck dish in a traditional Thai sauce i am so sorry i forgot the name. but do not think twice about coming to this humble, cute little restaurant with amazing food

My family and I have been there twice already with a large party of about 9-11 and they always treated us with great service. No complains at all. Great food, great staff, and a VERY clean restaurant. Keep it up!
I recommend the catfish salad and shrimp pad thai
weera thai has great food and service!!

I'm not sure why this place gets such great reviews.  Perhaps we came on a bad day, but our meal was mediocre at best.  My shrimp massaman curry was flavourless, with a LOT of potato and very little of anything else.  My boyfriend got a meat dish and wasn't very happy with it either.  We were pretty disappointed.

This place is a beautiful hidden spot. The food tasted okay. Just ask the cooks or waiters if there are nuts in any of the dishes or if anything is made with peanut oil/sesame oil (for those who have peanut/nut/tree nut/etc. allergies). We were told there was none, but my boyfriend still had an allergic reaction to one of the dishes. Just be careful!
The best place to get some awesome thai food! Best service, their wontons are amazing! They have become are go to place for Thai food since Archi's kind of went down hill.

We were visiting Las Vegas and checked the Yelp reviews to find a good Thai restaurant.  The food was great and the service was very friendly and helpful.  The food can be very spicy, so keep that in mind when you order.  I had the duck curry and the sticky rice and they were both delicious. The prices were very reasonable.

Food was pretty good. A little further off the strip than I would like & with so many options near the strip although ill give food two thumbs up slight chance I wouldn't go out way to visit again. However if I'm in dying need of an Thai craving while in Vegas this would be the place 2 go. Friendly Staff

OK, this is a tough choice for star ratings. I've gone a couple times here, once for lunch and once for dinner (just missed happy hour by 4 minutes and didn't get the benefit of the doubt on pricing).  My Thai friend wanted to eat here because they featured an Issan menu which is where she is from. 

Why the dilemma in star rating? Well, the restaurant is clean, looks like its got new flooring, tables and chairs, and nicely decorated even though its in a run down strip mall just south of Decatur on Sahara. Parking can be kind of tight.

The service for our two visits was exceptional. Seated quickly, waters brought immediately, drink orders taken within 5 minutes. Food comes quickly too. 

Food, this is where is becomes a bit muddled for me. First time I had the Chicken Pad Thai lunch special ($7.95). Comes with a salad and soup. The presentation isn't as nice as Naga Thai in Henderson. The soup is nothing special at all and the salad basic but larger. The pad thai was delicious with plenty of peanuts off to the side along with other condiments. 4/5

For dinner I had Pork Pad See Ewe (sorry my spelling sucks). Good sized portion, but like only 3 mini stalks of chinese broccoli. Wasn't the best I've had and this is one of my staple thai orders so a little disappointed. 3/5
Crab rangoon appetisers were really good, loaded with cream cheese and not so much crab but the wrapper is light and crunchy. Very good 4.5/5

My Thai friend ordered Larb Ped and Papaya Salad at lunch, and Duck Bone Soup and Beef Stew Noodle Soup for dinner, She gave them medium reviews as they weren't spicy enough for her Issan tastebuds except the Papaya Salad. I sampled the Beef Stew Noodle soup and it tasted like Thai Pho, It was good for me because it wasn't spicy. The Duck Bone Soup fired me up with just a taste of the broth. I don't like spicy food though. 

Overall, somewhere around a 3.8 star rating. I'd go back for the service and cleanliness of the restaurant, just at happy hour to take advantage of some better pricing. Wednesdays from 4-10pm is Singha beer specials, one of my favorites.

Absolutely delicious Thai food!  We were in the mood for Thai food tonight and used Yelp as a guide to find a good place.  The reviews did not lie, as everything, including the superlative service, was awesome.  I ordered my Curry very hot (5, on their 1-5 scale), and although it was not as hot as I usually like, the heat/flavor balance was great.

Found this place on Yelp in the "nearby me" deals section.  

Great choice on our part! We got 3 entrees, a hot tea and an appetizer.  
-thick noodles, yellow curry and panag curry and fresh egg rolls....all were sooo yummy! We also got there at 9:30 which was perfect timing since they close at 10.  

With our deal from yelp the total was 22 dollars! so perfect and exactly what were were looking for.  The chicken is a much better option than the tofu.  We got the chicken with the yellow curry and tofu with panag....for some reason the yellow curry came out more like a stew and the tofu in the panag wasnt very juicy which was too bad.
It was my first time and surly not the last. I had the duck and it was outstanding, the red Carrie dish was very good and over all a great experience.

I was meaning to visit this place for quite some time and managed to take out some food from there on my last night at Vegas.
In one word- FABULOUS!
We had the Massumun Curry and the Thai Green Curry. We had also ordered a side of Fried Tofu. 
This was for two people. The portions are huge. One curry easily feeds 2-3 people. However, you may need to order an extra side of the steamed rice to suffice for both of you. Both curries were rich and flavorsome and you can choode how spicy you want it.
The fried tofu was not ny favorite but loved the sweet chilli dip that accompanied it.
Sooo stuffed and happy :D
Two entrees and a side+ a 5$ delivery charge works out to about 35$. A little pricey, but the tummy seems so happy, you won't feel guilty for too long!

Excellent food and service...I would suggest to anyone who enjoys Chinese food, to give Weera Thai Restaurant a try...You will be plesantly surprised....and the price is wonderful

I give this restaurant an A plus...

Came upon this place by looking for Thai food and could not be happier. Crab ragoons are amazing. The Pad Thai is the best we have had. Great overall experience and only a few minutes from the strip. We will be back.

Very authentic Thai. Hole on a wall joint, but once you step inside, you forget what it looked like on the outside. Sophisticated decor. Could be used for date nights and other special occasions.
Food was fresh and carefully prepared and presented.

This place would get 4-stars, if not for the service.  Their pad thai is some of the best I've ever had.  They have other solid menu items, and for a great price.

I have been here about 10 times.  On my last visit, I ordered a pad-thai with no spices (like I always do).  The dish came out very spicy, uneatable for me.  I told the waitress, who said that I couldn't send the dish back.  I told her to ask the manager, which she did, and was told I had to accept the dish.  I said it was too spicy, I don't eat spices and this wasn't what I ordered, so I wasn't paying for it.  She said okay, so I ate my other (I was really hungry) dishes and left for the Hawaiian place next door (which is amazing).

That was the most absurd experience I've ever had in a restaurant.  The management clearly didn't care that either their waitress (who barely spoke English) or their cook messed up my order and a repeat customer was unhappy.  With actions like that, I'm hard pressed to see how they will stay in business.

Had to review again!!!!!    Forgot how much I love the food.  Had the pineapple fried rice for the first time and it's and explosion of flavors, the crab sticks were crispy and delicious and the pad Thai and beef salad still are the best in Vegas.  I am just disappointed that I forgot to order the mango sticky rice.  The delivery guy was really sweet and I just have to add how much I love this place.

We ordered delivery from here twice while we were on vacation in Las Vegas. We were happy that they delivered to the Westgate Resort, though I had to meet them outside the hotel because they aren't allowed to deliver to the rooms apparently. They will instruct you to meet them at the valet parking (this is the main entrance to the hotel on the west side). However, it would be much smarter to meet guests either at the North Tower or East Tower entrance. It's less busy here and more convenient access from the guest rooms. Sometimes the valet/main entrance area has 50+ cars including buses and taxis moving in and out. Not to mention that it's a hike from here back to your room. The North or East Tower Entrances would be much more convenient for their customers, which should be the focus. However, delivery was quite fast and the food was great. 

During our two meals, we had the Mongolian beef, BBQ pork, beef stir fry with garlic pepper sauce (excellent), seafood soup w/shrimp, spicy pork, egg rolls, and papaya salad. Everything was very tasty, though my wife thought the papaya salad wasn't consistent with the Isaan-style papaya salad she's used to. And I wouldn't recommend the Mongolian beef as it is nowhere near as good as most Mongolian beef that I've had at Chinese restaurants. And that's probably the key - this is a Thai restaurant and the Mongolian beef is a Chinese (or Chinese-American) dish. The beef stir fry with garlic pepper sauce however was excellent. The Thai egg rolls also excellent. 

The total came to $50 on one occasion and $60 on the 2nd occasion. Which I think is a bit pricey for 2 entrees, 2 appetizers, and no drinks/desert. So minus -1 star for being a bit over priced.  Recommended.

So even though Yelp didn't show my first review, I still wanted to update this. My friend was really craving Thai food. I told her Weera had gone downhill but she wanted it anyway. I said fine. We ordered around 9:30 (they close at 10) for delivery. The guy delivers around 10, and when we get around to eating we see that they left out a thai tea. I paid for it, but they left it out, and they were already closed. Thank goodness I ordered from eat24 cuz the guy took it off for me. Fast forward to today and I really wanted thai food so I tried them one more time. Ordered online, and this time I decided to have my hubby pick it up. He got there and they asked him for his credit card. I already paid online. Basically I was charged twice. Is everyone over there new and they don't know to check if things have already been paid for? Why does the service suck so much these days? I used to love it but they just keep messing everything up.

The only reason I am giving Weera a 5 start rating is because Yelp doesn't give the option of 10 stars. We've been coming here for over a year now, and we adore it! Not only is their food amazingly cooked, their service is quick and clean, and their workers are hard working and so extremely nice, but they also give to the poor (what I witnessed today! I was so unbelievably proud to be eating there These people are angels!) NOW, the food... I have yet to not like anything on the menu. Everything is so good and cooked to perfection. One of the best thai restaurants with outstanding service and amazing food. ps: make sure you tell them you checked in they give you complementary ice cream! Love it here!

Foods was little on sweet side and too much fish sauce. After dinner we woke up at midnight to drink glass of water. 
Don't order their ice cream , it's makes from different ingredients,  after you ate. Got stomach ache. 
Service is average...

This was a recommendation from My and Thao T, and I think they got the recommend from Bobby and Misti... thank you guys!  This place is wonderful.

I asked the server what her favorite dish is, and she recommended the steamed sea bass.  This is what I recommend to all of you in yelp land, because my god it's so good and so unique (at least to a gringo like me).  I'm a huge fan of steamed fish in the first place because it's not greasy, but the bass is served on top of a a broth that is sweet with just a slight tang to it.  That was the first dish to go.

Side note, they have bottles of chinese wine on display. Go ahead and order one, they are not expensive at all and a great complement to the meal.

I also got the pad se ew (yes that can't be spelled correct) and the grilled beef salad.  No complaints.

Staff is so generous, place is really clean and quaint.
Authentic Is all I have to add. I love the dining experience. Reminded me of my moms cooking. Not to the T but still a hint of home :)
This place served a real authentic Thai food. reasonable price. Love it!!

I had the Chicken Panang curry, brown rice and some spring rolls to go.  The food was ready pretty quickly which is what I want when I'm hungry and driving home.  They gave me 10% off for Yelp which was cool even though it said "dine in" only.  There were a ton of spring rolls in the take out box and the peanut sauce was pretty yummy.  They asked me how spicy I wanted the curry so I said a "2" on a 1 to 5 scale.  2 was pretty spicy for this white girl but it wasn't too hot to eat.  I would definitely go back there.

TLDR: Excellent customer service, $7.99+ lunch specials from 11a-3:30p, FiveStars rewards program enabled, upscale ambiance, Thai Issan flavors for all  flavor palettes.

While no restaurant in the United States can ever be exactly like the flavors back in Thailand, this place comes really close! I actually came to eat here by happenstance. In what appears to be a sleazy strip mall, the diadem of Thai flavors is hidden amongst the now-gone seedy massage parlors. I walked into friendly greetings and a warm smile. As the years past, this restaurant has expanded into an upscale ambiance, where you can dine in dressed-up attire or gym clothes, as I have often done.

At first, I kept coming back due to their lunch specials. A heaping portion of THE BEST pad thai in the Western United States, a bowl of field greens salad, and a cup of soup de jour ranging from tom kha to tom yum to accompany the egg roll allowed this pescatarian to enjoy great food without having to pick out bits of chicken or beef or pork. I have tried other pad thai dishes in Nevada, California, and Arizona based on Yelpers in those regions and nothing has come close to the sweet and savory flavors in Weera Thai's pad thai.

Albeit the food warms the soul, I keep coming back due to the consistency that Weera Thai provides during lunch and dinner. Yeah you get the occasional heavy hand with the same spice level, but the food and customer service always remains top notch. Refills of water without asking, new silverware and plates between courses, and a rotating "specials" menu will have you asking how such a 5-star location continues growing its business off the Strip.

Chef Peter and Sasi is the duo you wish to grow up and emulate when you find that special someone. Their hearts are just as big as their creative ingenuity. You are always treated with the utmost respect from the staff, even the people that yell angry epithets at them for their food not coming out as quickly as fast food. They are always appreciative of your business, feedback, and happy demeanor after sharing a meal with them. Kudos to Weera Thai. You'll be sure to see me here at least once every week. :]

Located in an older strip mall, next to my family's favorite restaurant (Island Style), this place is a swan-- meaning you would never know how beautiful and elegantly casual it is in on the inside from the older, not-so-great strip mall exterior.  The service has always been average, but the food is worth the wait.  Their curries are delicious, and my husband is a big fan of their pad thai and thinks it's about the best in town.  They have a lunch special which is out of this world-- about 15 things to choose from, served with soup and an eggroll for about $10.  It's well worth it.  You will leave stuffed if not with a to-go box.  The food is outstanding!  It's a must-try.

This small wonderful place away from the Vegas strip has the best Chicken Curry I have ever had. I would recommend this place to Everybody and the workers are very nice too. Great price and that is all about that - go yellow chicken Curry :)

I absolutely love Weera Thai. There are SO many Thai restaurants all over & around Vegas, how do you know which one to go to?! Well, I suggest here!! 

Their lunch specials start when they open & end at 3:30 pm, & they have all their best entrees offered at this time. You get a soup, salad, & egg roll before your meal. Lots of food for the price! I've had a few different dishes here & I have not been disappointed once. Everything has so much flavor, is fresh, authentic, & just plain amazing. 

The interior is romantic & calm. The waiters & waitresses are friendly, polite, & fast. 

Their Thai tea is perfection. I can not have another Thai tea anywhere else without wishing it tasted more like Weera's. (Which is only $1.50 if you add it on to your lunch special!) 

I highly recommend giving this place a shot, it's not super busy like some of the other places & the food is always better here!

My mister and I were craving Thai and our family ended up here in Weera Thai. What a pleasant experience! 

At first I was a bit nervous because my mom and the my 3 yo aren't fans of spicy foods and Thai food in general so I was hoping there was something in the menu that would make them happy. I ordered vegetable fried rice and wonton soup. The fried rice is excellent; not overly greasy and enough egg with perfectly cooked veggies. The wonton soup was a hit too. The broth was delicious and flavorful. Took note that those 2 will be ordered again in the future. I had the shrimp pad thai and hubby got the green curry with beef, both spicy #3 (medium). Fantastic, as expected! 

The excellent service made the whole experience a 4 star. For a Friday night, we got seated right away, waited about 10 minutes for our orders, and our drinks were always filled. We were disappointed they didn't have the mango with sticky rice, but understood that it's seasonal so we got the coconut ice cream instead (also delicious and my 3 yo devoured it in minutes). 

Can't wait to go back and try their other entrees!

Dinner on Mother's Day was superb.  We were a large group and they handled our table really well. The workers are all genuinely friendly and seem glad to serve. And the food is always excellent.  From the outside, the restaurant doesn't look all that appealing. Once inside, the newly remodeled place changes the whole atmosphere from iffy to really quite nice.  The price is super reasonable.  Can't wait to go back!
Love the food! The duck curry is delicious.  Been going here for years. The service is good and the owner is friendly. Lunch specials are quick and easy too.

Wow wow weeeeee!!!! This is a great spot for some good authentic Thai food.  Service was amazing and food came out fast.  

Met the owner and thanked every table for coming in.  That is great service to me. 

Had the Thai basil chicken, spicy level 4.  It was soooo good and had me sweating.  (A good thing) They had a huge variety of lunch options and is great to take clients to or a great lunch spot for your lunch hour.  

Inside decor is very nice and comfortable.  

You will not be disappointed.  Best Thai food I have had in Las Vegas.

This is the best Thai restaurant in LV!! I used to live in Bangkok for three years. So this restaurant has genuine Thai foods. Actually I really love here because waitress is so friendly and kind and nice,they are always smiling brightly also. If I've the chance,I'd like to go to eat everyday:)

I fear I may be falling into a trend.  I have reviewed several other Thai restaurants and this will not be my last on the subject.  It turns out I happen to like Thai food.  Quite a lot in fact.  Weera Thai is one of my favorites.  The food here is more flavorful than that at Pad Thai restaurant.  Especially when it comes to spice.  Their spice level goes up to five though I am only willing to try a three at this point.  After that, it becomes too much for me.  Typically though, I order no spice.  I like to let the true flavor of the meal shine through and not be concealed by overbearing heat.  Some dishes just don't need the heat.  Like sweet and sour chicken.  Let the sweet and sour stand on its own.  The tempura is perfect thickness.  The sauce is tangy.  They vegetables are crisp and fresh.  No change necessary.  The pad thai here is some of the best I have had.  The rice noodles are chewy.  The flavors are intense.  The chicken is tender.  A great dish.  So far the only dish I have ordered that I did not enjoy is the pepper garlic chicken.  Actually, I ordered beef and received chicken.  I did not care for it at all.  First of all, I prefer white meat when eating chicken.  This was fatty dark meat.  Second, I was not expecting black pepper.  I thought it would be very garlicy with fresh chili peppers.  I don't care for the taste of massive amounts of black peppercorn.  I will not order that again.  

All of the lunch specials are served with steamed rice (unless noted otherwise), an egg roll and a small salad.  For a price ranging from $6.99 to $7.99, depending on your choice of protein, Weera Thai is a little higher priced than some other Thai options but the price shine through in the quality.  This is one of my go to places for Thai take-out in regular rotation.

Service is top-notch; always pleasant.  Foods are excellent.  Atmosphere is modern (and clean).  It's, unfortunately, located in the area not so pleasant.  But a real gem.  We go there at lease once a week.

This is a great place. I'm visiting from the SF Bay Area and it's as good as any Thai place there. The food came quickly, brought by an attentive waitress. Not only was she attentive, she made sure we got the right heat on our dishes. Between the two of us is we tried 4 entries and 8 apps.
I liked the food so much we were there twice. Don't miss this place!!

Found this place on a recent trip to Vegas. This place is one of the best Thai restaurants I visited in my 20 years in the USA from Thailand. This is the place for Isaan (northeast Thailand) dishes. My favorite is the Tom Saab-spicy and flavorful. Oh, the fried oyster is great, too. This is one of the dishes that not many places can do it well. But Weera Thai can make it so that I can say "wow!" after the first bite. The staff are very nice and friendly, too.

I saw a Groupon for dinner for 4 at Weera, checked it out on Yelp and decided to purchase said Groupon...glad I did!

We shared everything family style and the highlights of our meal were the Green Curry (Thanks Misti) and the Pad Kee Mao.  The green curry at Weera is one of the best in town!  We were all totally happy with it!  The pad kee mao was very good as well.

Nothing was bad here...the only thing that was just okay, run-of-the-mill-good, was the appetizer sampler.  There were four of us so we went with the normal app sampler that comes with 4 of everything instead of Weera app sampler that look a little more appealing but only came with 3 of each item...next time we will just draw knives to see who gets left out and go with the namesake! 

The prices are spot on here as well.

Would have been a 5 star experience if the app was better and if the atmosphere matched the quality of the food.  The service was friendly, but a little slow as well...I never like it when more than one person runs out of water at the same time.

Superb. Clean. The Take out containers are worthy of keeping and using again, amazing quality. Curry is hot ! Thanks - I don't dig mild curry. First hot curry I've had in the city. Excellent. Two thumbs up.

Been coming here for years, way back when it was still Royal Thai.  Incredible transformation after the expansion.  The sign outside tricks you into thinking you're about to pass up another cruddy strip-mall Asian restaurant.  If you haven't tried Weera lately you're missing out. 

Very rich Penang curry, noodle dishes (pad si ew) are savory, soups are steaming with fresh meats and vegetables.  

Definitely in the top 3 Thai in Vegas.

Very good food  super tasty the place has beautiful atmosphere and great service and super clean I forgot to mention the food was really fresh and so cute decorated we will be coming back again for sure

From the very first time I tried Weera, I knew I was hooked!  I love the selections on the menu because they offer both Thai traditional, and Issan cuisine. The service is fast, professional, and friendly, no matter how busy it is. And if they do fall behind on busy days, the managers-owners, aren't scared to come out and take orders. I love that! I don't think I've ever had an off day here, everything has been very consistent since day one!

We were in search of another Thai restaurant that was as good, if not better than, Archi's on Flamingo. Yelp reviews led us to this restaurant. I would have to say that this is an exceptional place for Northern Thai food! 

They have a happy hour from about 4-7pm, but they extended the offer until 9pm today. So, I tried their Crispy Papaya Salad with shrimp offered at $5.00. This was amazing! The dressing is a slightly sweet lime juice, which goes great with the julienned papaya, cut green beans, tomatoes, and peanuts. 

For an entree, I chose the Red Curry Pumpkin at spicy level of two. This Thai red curry has Thai spices, chilies, bamboo shoots & coconut milk, with your choice of meat. I selected the crab meat. It was served in a huge oblong bowl with brown rice on the side. The flavors were sublime! It was a generous portion for less than $15.00.

For dessert, I had to try the mango and sticky rice to compare to Archi's. Although it was a large portion with fresh ripe mangoes that were delectable, the sticky rice and coconut milk was a little too sweet for my liking. To avoid this in the future, I could order the coconut milk on the side.

I enjoyed their Jasmine hot tea with dinner and dessert. The china was beautiful. The service was excellent! The restaurant was super clean and nicely decorated, and the menu offers something for everyone.

Update:

Since my first review, I have been back to enjoy some of the same favorites with the same quality, presentation, and service as previously given - all excellent!

This time I tried a couple new appetizers like the crab rolls (pictured). They were really good! I also tried the beef jerky. This is another great appetizer (pictured).
I order for delivery to my hotel mgm grand.food coming fast less than 30 mins and very yummy thai food .

I would occasionally have intense cravings for Thai food. Today was definitely one of those days. Decided to see if Weera Thai could feed me delicious food and satisfy my taste buds. I rarely come to this area but it was worth the trip. 

Crab sticks- long thin deep fried rolls with crab meat inside served with a sweet sauce. Watch out! This one was pretty hot when it arrived at our table so wait a little for it to cool down. If your fingers find it hot, your tongue will hate you if you can't practice delayed gratification. It's delicious, with a crispy exterior and delicious crab meat inside. 

Pad See Ew with chicken- I thought this was decent. But then again, I don't know how you can screw up pad see ew. Or can you? Not bad although I've had better. No praises but also no complaints. 

Red Curry with Chicken- A tad watery for me but great flavor. I couldn't stop eating it. So good. Love the bamboo slices so much I almost neglected the chicken.

Thai iced tea here is super sweet. I always crave one when I'm eating at a Thai restuarant but I had to water it down to drink it. But then again, maybe it's me. My tolerance for sweets probably went down as I find a lot of things too sweet lately. 

Service here is friendly and attentive. They come by your table frequently to check on things. 

Would I come here again? Yes!

Lots of duck dishes offered here.  And, if you are brave, durian sticky rice.  It's actually pretty good.  The coconut tempers the durian flavor.  But later on you will realize that you ate durian.  Your breath will be horrible.  And if you don't know what durian is, don't try it.  You will regret it, eventually.  I'm apparently a glutton for punishment.

Service was good.  A little timid but good.  The servers hovered with concern a lot but ultimately knew when to come in and ask if we needed anything.

I recommend trying the pork jerky.  And let me know if you actually get anything spicy here.  We asked for food as spicy as possible and it came out not so spicy.  But maybe we did not look Thai enough?

Interesting variety of food and good service garners this establishment a "Yay!"

stop by at weera twice or more per week. this amazing Thai restaurant impresses me in any way, the food, service and the environmental. They keep the taste steady, never disappointed me every time I stop by. if you're looking for Thai/Issan food style. I suggest you must have to try out weera !
One of the best Thai places in Las Vegas. Ordering out is awesome, dining in is a bit cramped but worth it. Great lunch specials.
I will try Thai food later because I work seven day sweets hope. I bring my family to going to weed ra thai food one day
Big portions that are light on seafood or meat. Flavors ok, one dish was way too salty. Won't be back.

Are there any sucky Thai restaurants out there?  I'd be hard pressed to find one.  The small differences in flavor I believe are a matter of personal preference.  So it really boils down to the dining experience for me.  Weera is a low-key, intimate space with soft lighting and a conservative selection of sakes and wine.  When we went, there were couples on dates, families with kids, groups of friends and a table of 6-footer models.  I think anyone would be happy with this space and food.  Service was great but quite slow on a Friday night.  

The first bite we had of their pad thai was bit of a letdown, but the next few bites we took must've had some voodoo spice or spell because we were loving it more and more.  It was a dish that did not wow you with a punch, but the flavors crept up on you like the butler on Mr. Deeds... very very sneaky.  We also had the Thai chicken wings, sauce on the side for my little man.  Bad idea.  There wasn't any flavor on the naked wing.  The final order was Crispy Pork Basil.  I haven't heard my hubby say it in a long time but he muttered "Holy Lord God."  He was enamored.  To me, it was very good, close to perfection with its slightly sweet buttery sauce, the balance with crisp vegetables and the yummy fried pork (normally I like to keep the sauce off fried skin to keep it crisp).  Overall though, we were very happy with the food.  They even provide kiddie plates.  50 brownie points right there!

So many Thai options... but we would definitely go back to this one.  Wee heart you Weera!

We started out for a return visit to Baan Mae Toy.  When we got there they were preparing to close.  They would have served us, but we found out that, despite the long conversation we had with the owner the last time we were there, they still had only a very limited selection of wine, and nothing we'd drink.  The owner suggested we go to Weera Thai, just a few doors down.  Alas, he may regret his decision to send us there.

At nearly 10 p.m., unlike the empty restaurant we'd just left, Weera was hopping, and we got the only available table.  And they had the Riesling we like to drink.

We ordered soup, and when it was served, it wasn't the Tom Kah Kai we usually order, but the Tom Yum Kai.  It was my mistake, and the waitress (owner?) offered to change it, but we decided to keep it.  And it was beyond delicious!


We shared a Mussamun Curry with beef, and for once I gave in to hubby's Pad Thai request.  Both were excellent, and the Mussamun had the distinction of having much more "stuff" than the vacant bowl of sauce that we've experienced at too many other Thai restaurants.

Service was excellent, and we think we've found our new favorite Thai place.
I really love Larb Ped n Spicy Seafood Salad too much :) it's so yummy!!! This is the second times for us. We gonna come back n take our friends with us next time :).
Love there curry, spring rolls and sticky rice dessert was the best!! Great customer service and also very clean.

Delicious!!! Careful here. Food so good you will forget to stop eating.  Hahaha!! Seriously authentic taste, great service and priced right. Been here twice now and food is excellent. They have some great seafood dishes. Penang curry is awesome. Just be careful. 1-5 on the hot scale so it can sneak up on you. But still delicious. Papaya salad was smokin at number two. Might pay a little later but to good to stop now. Mmmmmm!

I dont know who thought this restaurant was one of the top 3 thai restaurants in las vegas, They definitely havent tried alot then. I could easily name 5 other thai places that blow this place out of the water. My wife and i went their because of a living social deal. And we ended up with food poisoning. The meat they served us was very questionable. I am pretty sure that beef that is white is not normal. I hope this is a good warning for people who want to try this place.

Big fan of Archi's now for the past few years. Tried this place on a Groupon deal. Pleasantly surprised. Excellent Pad Thai and Papaya salad. Less greasy than Archi's. I am wondering if I will go back to Archi's. Fabulous service as well.

My favorite Thai spot in town. I do wish they had stuffed wings, but the amazing peanut sauce they serve with the fresh spring rolls makes up for it. I love the pad Thai lunch special. You get tons of food for a measly $7. They also have $1 Thai tea during lunch. The service is always fast and the staff is friendly.

I'm excited to find another delicious thai spot in LV. Like I've said in my previous reviews, I'm picky about my thai food. Mainly because I come from Seattle where the thai food is top-notch. We ordered a few of their lunch special orders which included tofu phad thai, chicken phad thai, panang curry, and a gingered tilapia dish. Although the food did take a while to come out, it was VERY good. The phad thai was moist and tasty, and the panang was delish. The portions for lunch are fairly large too, had to take some home.

Simply amazing food the best Thai I ever had from mango salad papacy salad drunken noodle fried rice every single item we ordered was 10/10 I will decently come back every time I am in Vegas. Lastly best customer service.

The best... Yes, THE BEST THAI!! Every dish is consistently amazing. The waitresses are so friendly and cute. Their larb, Tom kha gai, pad ki mao, beef salad, papaya salad, etc melt my brain every time! I don't watch tv, but if you like to watch it, there's about 20 TVs packed into this tiny restaurant. The happy hour drink specials are great. If you don't like Weera Thai, I don't like you.
Large menu, multiple styles, great service and nice ambiance. Food is on point of course. Not as busy and crazy as the other Thai spot in town.  Happy hour specials also.
Fast service. Delicious food. Thai tea is not too sweet and tastes homemade. And free ice cream for check in.
Excellent food and great service. Delivery was here in 15 minutes. I'd love to see them keep a separate vegetarian menu. Lots of fresh veggies and tofu.

Small restaurant but amazing food! I had the tofu fresh spring rolls and they were the best I've ever had!! Hole in the wall but decently priced for Vegas and a great place to have a peaceful and quiet dinner away from all the crazy nightlife.
Good food and good service. I am glad to live somewhere with good Thai food options again.  Warning the spice is on the mild side I asked for 5 the spiciest and barely tasted the heat...

We really enjoyed this place!!! We found it through Yelp and the reviews were right on the money!!! The Pad Se Ew was off the hook and so was there Spicy Eggplant!!! Fresh ingredients and quality as well... Would highly recommend it too anyone!!!

So impressed with the renovation and the new style and concept. I have been here twice but a few years back, today was the first time trying this place after post renovation. 

Food has always been good but the place went from casual, quick food to more modern and have more unique items. The new design is very pretty, more modern, brighter, nice and clean. They also expanded so the restaurant is larger now, great for large and small parties. 

We were greeted immediately, water was brought out as soon as we sat down. Their Thai Tea is soooo good, you can clearly smell and taste the tea and not too sweet to where you get sick of it easily, plus the tea came in a large glass, definitely bigger than other places. Our waitress Arunothai was so nice, she made recommendations, answered questions and was so patient as we looked through our menu (their menu is huge! so many options!!).

They have the big menu and they have a smaller brown menu that you should definitely ask for, our waitress said the items on the brown menu are authentic Thai items. 

We ordered total of 7 items and the two that stood out were the Pork Liver Larb and the Fried Catfish Papaya Salad. The larb is cooked medium based on our server's reccomendation, and it was delicious, the liver was so soft, the sauce tasted amazing! This dish was gone pretty quickly! The catfish was very different, have never had something like this. The catfish is shredded and mixed with...something...then deep fried with papaya salad on top with salted duck egg and pork skin on the side. First of all this dish is HUGE, definitely can be shared. We love papaya salad, order it every time we go eat Thai, the catfish and the salted egg are nice addition of the traditional salad.  

The stir fried clams was also very good, lots of clams compared to other places where you get a bunch of empty shells. The sauce was amazing, sweet and salty, and a little spicy! We ordered 8 items but only 7 was brought out, which was fine since we were stuffed. 

We ordered 7 items, 2 extra rice bowls, a pot of tea, and a Thai tea and the check came out under $100. Not expensive at all, great price, great portion, good service, and good food. Will definitely come back for more.

I have had Weera for lunch on several occasions. They have yet to disappoint. They have an excellent lunch special. 8 bucks will get you a dish, jasmine rice, egg roll and a salad. I recommend the garlic pepper chicken or the pad Thai.

Okay, so we've been here twice. Once for dinner, which was amazing; once for lunch which was so-so. For dinner we had the massaman curry, pad thai, a duck dish, and the fresh veggie spring rolls. Everything was rich, flavorful, delicious, like no other Thai restaurant I've been to in Vegas! The flavors were delicious and unique. After coming here for dinner, I was sold on this place. Thinking of how delicious this place was for an entire week, we returned here again on a Sunday for a lunch special. We ordered the red curry lunch special and the black peppered chicken which comes with a fried spring roll, salad, and a little soup. We also ordered the fresh veggie spring rolls. I wasn't a fan of anything we ordered. Everything tasted light and watered down. The black peppered chicken was far from palatable. The fresh veggie spring rolls tasted ordinary. We were disappointed, but I am sure we will go back again and try this place again. (by "we", I am referring to my epicurious alter ego that lives within...or... more likely, my awesome foodie fiancée)

I love Thai food. I know it is not the healthiest type of food out there nor is it doing me any favors in my quest to lose the rest of the baby weight, but I love it nevertheless. We have been here on a number of occasions for lunch and I have been pleased with my dish and service on all of those occasions.

From the exterior it looks like a dumpy place next to a massage parlor on Sahara, but as usual the interior tells a different story. It is warm and inviting with elegant decor on the inside. The service has always been friendly and to the point.

We tried their special which was Red Snapper in Panang sauce, and wow! It was such a flavorful dish masterfully prepared. Beware though, it is a large portion and enough for both my husband and I to share. We have also tried their appetizer sampler and absolutely loved it. It is rare to order a sampler and love everything on the plate, but I did. It consisted of cream cheese ragoons, stuffed chicken wings, spring rolls with several types of sauce including peanut, and sweet and sour type varying in intensity. I also enjoyed their combination drunken noodles with a generous portion of meats and shrimp. I intend on sampling more of their menu, but it is also hard not to stick to the dishes I've already tried since they are so good!

I highly recommend this place!

The interior is nice. The menu looks impressive.  I bought the comb on yelp 8$ for 15$.. My favorite soup is Tom yum. I ordered that but they made the soup soo sweet n its no taste sour at all. I have to ask the waitress for couple lime n mix w the soup..

Great service.
Clean restaurant with nice decor.
We both had lunch specials. They came with soup, salad, AND spring rolls. So yummy and filling. So inexpensive. Highly recommend. 

My hubby had the red curry, I had spicy basil chicken. We would both recommend them and probably get them again.

Keep up the great work!

Clean, well taken care of spot that happens to deliver to my area so I am soooo lucky!
I am in love with their squid salad.
They love having kids at their restaurant too- with plates brought to the table especially for them. Excellent service!

Came here on a Saturday night thanks to groupon. Paid $12, but worth $25 at the restaurant. When we walked inside no one was eating and I thought it was kind of odd considering it was a Saturday night.  We immediately ordered our Thai Teas and since I have been craving curry for so long I ordered the yellow curry with chicken (yes, I know I like to play it safe). For our appetizer we had the fresh spring rolls with tofu. And when I took my first bite I tasted the rice noodles and something else almost like meat. But it was actually the tofu! The peanut sauce was also a nice compliment!  Very tasty and I recommend ordering this if you're contemplating on ordering an appetizer. The curry was pretty good hardly any spice at all because I requested for level 1 (their spice scale here is 1-5). The dish also had carrots and potatoes. Does this normally come with potatoes because I wasn't expecting it at all? The servers were very friendly and checked up on us regularly. They require a $15 minimum with card or they charge you a .25 cents fee, which is not bad at all. I don't think I'd be back here again, but worth going to if you're going to use a groupon, yelp deal, or living social coupon.

The food is top notch.  So is the service.  I have been to dozens of Thai restaurants in Las Vegas, and Weera Thai is one of the best if not THE best.  Quality is consistent, as is customer service, no matter how busy the restaurant is.  I just wish they were 24 hrs!  I'll be back very soon...

This restaurant has amazing, tasteful, and good Thai food. It has excellent authentic Thai food. The service is very friendly and kind. They have an assortment of curries that are very piquant and tasteful. Also the Thai tea is excellent and not too sweet with great flavor.

I have to revoke my previously placed 5 star review from a year ago. This place used to be AMAZING but unfortunately they seemed to have changed for dramatically for the worse. I ordered delivery tonight for a specific time. Unfortunately about an hour before the delivery was due I found out my husband had an accident and I had to rush off to go pick him up. I called the restaurant and asked them if they could just deliver 1 hour later. They told me they had already left with the food and couldn't do anything to help me. Uhm... what? You were going to be an hour early from our scheduled delivery time? I'm only 3 miles away. after some arguing they finally agreed to deliver my food at the requested time but said that since they had already made it that it would be cold. So you're telling me I just paid $15 per person for cold food? No. I don't want cold food. The girl on the phone said she would check with her manager and call me back. An hour later I hadn't received a call back so I called the company I ordered through who told me Weera rescheduled delivery for tomorrow at 8PM? What? So they called them again and Weera showed up 15 minutes later with their driver complaining to us about the delivery complication. Well I'm sorry I tried to give you pretty much an hour advance notice before the scheduled delivery time. The Thai Iced Teas were terrible and taste like old stale tea. All of the food was soggy and the vegetables weren't fresh at all. I'm positive that they did not prepare fresh food for us... this was a microwaved soggy mess version of what they used to be. 

We used to order from Weera at least once a week and have spent thousands of dollars at their restaurant and referred MANY people to them. I'm really disappointed in this entire experience particularly the lack of compassion and rude attitude I received from their employees when I had just explained that my husband was in an accident and I had to leave right away. I guess this is goodbye to Weera... it's been a nice run guys but as a formerly loyal customer I don't deserve that kind of treatment particularly when there are at least 5 other Thai restaurants in this area that deliver.

Been here long time ago, they renovated the place. Now it is very nice. The food is good pretty big portion and they have happy hour, the service is a bit slow, we need to asked few times for water refill and lemon. Their cocktail is pretty interesting, but the taste is only ok. I would not get it anymore. Would I come back here, possible. But not on top of my list

The food is great. But the DELIVERY service is HORRIBLE. I live fairly close to the restaurant, maybe a 5-7 minute drive. It usually gives me an estimated delivery of 45 mins from the time they receive and confirm the order. But it is never here within even 60 minutes, it's usually closer to 75-90 minutes. Always. And the order is wrong probably 25% of the time. And they NEVER even apologize, let alone offer to send me the correct order or give me some free egg rolls or something. That being said- the quality of food is still great.
I was very pleased with the food (quality and taste).good service as well. The atmosphere is quite relaxing. I like!

Weera Thai is a wonderful Thai restaurant located in a section of commercial strip malls on West Sahara Ave that have seen better days.  I have been to Weera Thai a few times in the past year for dinner and most recently for lunch.  After trying out their regular menu and also one of their lunch specials, I personally think that you get more value ordering from their non-lunch specials menu, even if it is before 3pm during their lunch special promotion hours.  

So don't be cheap and walk out becuase your party came in 2 minutes past the lunch specials promotion period. The $2-3 extra you pay for each entree will defintiely get you much more food, in spite of the trade off of not getting the cup of house soup, fried egg roll and a lunch side salad (all are rather unimpressive). 

The staff have always been friendly, and deliver the prepared dishes shortly after it was cooked with care in the kitchen.  Their Green Curry is bomb.  Their Spicy Glass Noodle Salad is healthy and delicious, and can easily substitute as an entree or be shared as an appetizer salad.  The Pad See Ew is one of the best I have tried in all of Las Vegas. If you enjoy having duck, their Slice Duck (Weera Thai Style) will not disappoint.  The Thai Fish Cakes appetizer is generous and good.   The Spicy Thai Sweet Basil made with Beef lunch special was just okay at best, maybe it is better prepared with anything but beef, but it was definitely my least favorite item that I have tried at this cool restaurant.
