If you have room in your tummy after your meal, consider getting their Durian over Warm Sticky Rice (assuming you do not have an Andrew Zimmern aversion to this pungent fruit).  Otherwise, get their Mango Sticky Rice during the summer, when mangos are in season.

After reading Yuhi K's review, I must remember to order the Coconut Water served in a young coconut, instead of the common Thai Iced Tea or Thai Iced Coffee, on my future visits.  And try one of the Steamed Sea Bass as recommended by Arvin when I am in the mode for fish.  When winter finally arrives, definitely going to have to try their Thai Beef Noodle Soup, the best of Las Vegas according to Theresa C.

Ambiance: 3.5/5.  Comfortable dining environment with Thai decorations and even a small television showing Thai programming featuring what appears to be a Thai food channel.  On the larger flat panel TV on the right side of the restaurant, it is usually on FoodTV or one of the professional sports games.  But the audio entertainment is provided by Sirius Radio's POP stations.

Service:  4/5.  Freindly, attentive. No complaints.

Food:  4/5.  Again, you pay slightly more but also get great value when ordering from their regular menu san the lunch specials.

Parking:  4/5.  Usually it is not a problem finding parking.

Location:  Fairly close to the Sahara exit on the I-15, so perfect if you are staying at Palace Station down the street.  Otherwise, easily accessible in a centrally convenient location for most resident of Las Vegas.

4 Stars. A no brainer.  

Side note:  The restaurant is aggressively promoting itself online, so you can usually find check-in offers (via Yelp get 10% off your bill), or promotions like Yelp Deals and occasional promotions from other competitors. Just tip on the pre-discounted price of your meal.

Wow, couldn't be more impressed! After trying to find a decent thai place on Yelp, we decided to go here.. and I absolutely love it! Located in a run down strip mall on Sahara, its always hard to venture off into some less lit parking lots. 

Great vibes from the moment you walk in, the decor makes it feel very home-y and authentic. 

I ordered the shrimp and mushroom Tom Yum soup, and with every bite it kept getting better and better. I should've ordered a large it was so good! 

Next you can never go wrong with some Thai Beef salad but this one was amazing. On their range of spicy-ness from 1-5, I ordered a 3 and it was perfect. Not too much spice you burn your mouth, just enough to enjoy the salad. 

Finally we asked the waitress what dessert she recommends, and she mentioned the Bua Lua (Taro) dish.. oh my.. what a way to top off the whole meal. Its a warm coconut milk with boba like texture balls..  definitely ordering that again! 

The whole spontaneous decision to find a thai restaurant was totally worth it after finding this place, my new go-to spot!

I checked this place out after a nearby specials search, and I saw that Misty had been and gave it high reviews. 
So I took advantage of the yelp deal, ($10 for $20 worth of food) there wasn't any problem at the restaurant using this deal. simple, no hassle. 
The food was amazing. We got three appetizers because there was a photo of happy hour specials for $3.33 between 5-8pm. The crab rangoon, crispy shrimp and dynamite chicken wings. all amazing and delicious. especially loved the crab Rangoon. 
for the entree we took misti's suggestion and decided to split green curry, and we got it with duck at a level 3 spiciness. It really wasn't spicy at all but it was SOOO good.  indeed the best green curry Ive had in Vegas, with huge chunks of eggplant and duck meat. mmm. I also had the Harney & Sons tea, it was very good. 
Everything was perfect except for the bill at the end of the meal. They did take off the $20 from the coupon, but the appetizers were not $3.33 each. When I asked the waitress about it she said that they no longer did happy hour. So I said to her, but I asked at the beginning of the meal if there was happy hour and you guys said there was...she looked confused and blank, and apologized that her English wasn't that good. I believe it was the drink waitress who said the deal was valid and the food waitress that said it wasn't but in the end, we paid $21 for appetizers instead of $10, which was really disappointing. 
Still, I'll go back, it was fun to discover a new place, (and there was a promising korean restaurant next door too!) I recommend you check it out too, but don't count on happy hour appetizer specials. at least, get it in writing first. :P

I've been to "weezy" a couple times and ordered delivery A LOT of times! 

First I had weezy was a lazy night, thanks to yelp's eat24 I found out about this gem, but I also found out it is cheaper to order from their own website. Hmmmm

Pretty much every fried rice they have is freakin amazing, they give you the option to add anything you want, as for me I always add mussels!
Teriyaki Chicken was also good, the sauce is not too thick and the chicken is cooked perfect.

The first time I've been to the restaurant I know at some point they need to renovate and make the place bigger which they did!
After a month of renovating, I came by to visit LOL of course I ate too! 
food is always great, though I noticed they are having issues with communication, I think everyone there asked to get our order. LOL
Fast service is always a win win for everyone!

Newly renovated weezy restaurant is much bigger and and it looks more fancy now! So Yes I highly recommend eating here!

Some of the best Thai food I've had in Las Vegas. Even though it took me YEARS to walk in the door.  The staff is very kind too. 

PROS: Mee krab
            Khao Soi (Northern Thai dish only available here and Lotus of Siam)
            Grilled ribeye Thai style
             Papaya Salad

CONS:  Fried Papaya salad

We found this place by mistake and thank you Lord! Everything was perfect. Had Tom yum soup, crap rolls, pepper chicken, and fried rice. 
A good sign was everyone in here was Thai. 
We only came in for a late lunch and 1 dish we ended up with all of the above. If you crave Thai try this and do not be afraid of where it is as it is in the middle of a strip mall with a few other restaurants. 
Give this gem a try you will not be disappointed.
OMG it was so authentic Thai food. I am a native Thai and know what good Thai food is like. I would recommend anyone to try.

hands down.?this is,the best thai restaurant in Las Vegas......do not even think,of going anywhere else if,you are a co issuer of thai food. Everything
We ordered,from this place was amazing.........we are back in Chicago dreaming about this place.....I would not recommend going to,any of the other supposed  highly rated thai restaurants k. Vegas especially if,you do.

Not want to,be loaded up.with MSG!    Trust me on this one..

This place is what I would call a pretty solid 3.5-4 star restaurant. Would I go there again? Maybe, if it was really located in another area. But Sahara is so out of the way for me that I don't go frequently pass by.

AMBIANCE: 3 - it's very cozy and has the feel of a Thai restaurant / diner. It's a small place, but the way their tables are placed, it doesn't feel small at all! 

SERVICE: 5 - Service was pretty excellent! The staff are fantastic and are constantly watching if there's someone they need to serve. The food comes out fast and hot. For a small restaurant, they're really efficient. 

FOOD: 4 - Yum. I mean, it was good and hit the spot for Thai food. I would suggest getting spicy level 2 in order for your food to be more flavorful. Their happy hour is from 4pm-7pm! 

Some of the foods that I recommend are: 

Fresh Tofu Spring rolls*
Pad See Ewe (could use more veggies though!)
Red Curry 

p.s. Skip the soft shell crab with garlic sauce. It's okay tasting, but it's not really worth that 23.99 life!

Some small changes over time begin to add or subtract from a great neighborhood restaurant.  Just so with Weera.
Originally a great spot for lunch, their lunch special began a lowering of quality by dropping the Tom Yum soup cup for a tofu soup.  Then, the pricing went up by a dollar for all lunch specials, and some that were a standard price went up another dollar.  
On my last visit, I ordered the red curry at spice level 5.  I got lukewarm red curry, with spice level 0.  In addition, the egg roll was still cold in the center.  
I'm going to find a new lunch spot.
Very good food and excellent service. Definitely a hidden gem in the city. I would absolutely recommend.
My favorite Thai restaurant in Las Vegas. Extremely clean and great food.

First thing I noticed was how clean the place was. Also (I know this is going to sound weird) but I really appreciated that the bathrooms were in the back and had a door separating them from the restaurant. The dining area is small, and I can't stand when you can see a bathroom from where you are eating, the last thing I want to hear is a toilet flushing while I'm eating. 

Onto the food. My friend I was with had never had a papaya salad before (one of my staples when I'm eating Thai) she doesn't like spicy food, so I had to tone it down for her, we ordered 2/5, it is true Thai Chili spice, so be careful when ordering. This was perfect. I ordered the Garlic Shrimp, this was the chef's special, it wasn't your typical garlic shrimp that I'm used to ordering. The shrimp are actually pan fried and served with the shells on. I was trying to be healthy, so I was a bit disappointed when I saw that it was pan fried, but it was really good. If you're not ok with eating the shells, I wouldn't bother ordering this dish. My friend had the Tofu Panang, she raved that it was the best she has ever had. 

Their menu is $3-4 higher on each dish than other Thai places in town. They do have a full Issan style menu.

I tried the duck for the second time, out of this world !
It was crispy and crunchy on the outside yet tender on the inside.

I love this place! Their portions are sooooooo big! And the food is great! It tasted like Thai food like I excepted although it's not like Thailand. But very close. I would come here again. And also their dark chocolate Thai tini. Was a great drink!

If it was not for the fact that it took about 15-20 mins for them to remember us after we were seated then I would have given them a higher rating. By this point, no one had came over to get our drink orders, but we were well prepared with both our drink and food orders by the time that they remembered us. During this time frame, we both tried to make eye contact with one of their 3 servers to no avail. 

Onto the food!

The Crab Rangoon was definitely packed in there and it had too much cream cheese for my taste, but my boyfriend loved it. Continuing my quest for my favorite panang curry in town, we ordered the Chicken Panang Curry at Weera. It was pretty good here with just the right kick of spice and there was a lot of chicken in the curry. We also ordered the Kao Moo Dang and Moo Grob and it was pretty tasty. It has BBQ Pork and Fried Pork Belly covered in sweet tamarind sauce and served with rice.

5 stars for the isaan sausages
5 stars for the Happy Hour Menu ($5 (some)appetizers 4-9pm)
5 stars for the catfish salad
5 stars for the Service

If you find yourself in the mood for some Thai food. You are in the right place. Love this place. The service in great the food amazing and to top it off they have happy hours. Great deals on appetizers drinks and Vine. Personally I love the yellow curry and the Thai tea.

I use to frequent this place for lunch but decided to come here for dinner a couple weeks ago.  Is it just me, or does this place take on a new atmosphere at night? Perhaps they redecorated. It's been a while so maybe I'm just imaging things. It seems a lot more warm and inviting. 

We had the papaya salad, beef larb, tom yum kung, red curry, pad see ewe, and pineapple fried rice. The spice level ranges from 1 to 5, so we ordered everything at spicy level 4. It was enough to make my nose runny but didn't overpower the food. Mind you, we love spicy. Everything was aromatic and full of flavor. I like that they don't use the small, cheap, flavorless shrimps. The shrimps were large, succulent, and perfectly cooked. It was so satisfying. 

Service was good as well. They were very accommodating and checked up on us regularly. We ended up with plenty of leftovers and they packaged it so nicely. 

Overall, the food, price, and portions were great. I'll be returning very soon!
Authentic Thai isann. A little expensive but not too bad. Try catfish salad, you will never want to eat catfish any other way ever again.

One of the good things about my job moving to the new office...we found this place. Their food is amazing! The shrimp (honestly any pad thai) is great there. I haven't been to the restaurant yet, but the delivery service is great. They are very friendly and apologetic if they run late. If you're looking for good spicy Thai give this place a try.

I always have green curry to every Thai Restaurant I go to plus other dishes. But definitely love the green curry with eggplant and bamboo shoot with tofu and spicy level of 2.5 here. So good! The curry size is pretty big and I can get lunch and dinner taken care of! But if I'm hungry, I eat the whole bowl and am full for a long while! Try Weera Thai! (I've seen monks eat here couple weeks ago!)

After searching for Thai food when I was in the area, I found this wonderful little Thai restaurant. We arrived and were seated quickly yet soon after it was packed with people waiting for a table. The menu is huge and has so many options that anyone could find something to eat here. We ordered the pad see ew, larb salad, Thai spring rolls, and red curry chicken. The minute my daughter tasted the red curry chicken she proclaimed "This is the best curry I've ever eaten." It was wonderful I'll admit. The Thai spring rolls were so fresh and crunchy that I only got to eat one as my 2 kids swarmed them. The pad see ew didn't disappoint as the Chinese broccoli was plentiful and the pork cooked to tender perfection. The larb I ordered with a spice level 3 and the flavor was amazing. What I love about Thai food is that unexpected matching of cool cucumbers with hearty ground chicken, spiced with peppers and cilantro. It's like comfort food with a kick. Don't let the exterior strip mall discourage you from trying this place. Once inside you'll find an upscale dining establishment with an attentive wait staff and insanely delicious food. The portions were huge and we enjoyed the leftovers for a few days after. If you like Thai food, you will love this place. I can't wait to go back and try the duck curry that our neighboring table raved about.

10/10 overall

Costumer service: Exceptional, sweet and great mannerisms. 

Cleanliness: Most cleanest restaurant I've been to in Southern Nevada.

Food: There food was amazing! I got the Lao papaya salad combination with barbaque chicken and cabbage. The papaya salad was more Amercanized then I expected. I was missing my mom's homemade Lao food and it wasn't close to authentic Lao papaya salad. I do admit I choose to get mild spice flavor and it tasted so much like something my mom or step dad would make for a toddler's version of papaya salad. The barbaque chicken was amazing out of the entire dish! My boyfriend got crab rangoon and the plain beef and cashew stir fry. The crab rangoon was very simple and wonderful. Crab rangoon should be simple and other restaurants add too many spices to out do other locations to get the American market. The plain beef and cashew stir fry was 10/10 since he ate the entire dish without sharing any with me. Haha. 

Weera Thai has became our Thai go to restaurant and we'll be back. A wonderful hole in the wall restaurant within a plaza with a lot of sketchiness.

I'm the pickiest person when it comes to thai because of a place back home I loved.  The coconut curry chicken is the best. E1 on the menu.  Add a little pineapple and cashews.  The sweet and the spice is perfect.

This is officially one of my top 3 favorite Thai restaurants here! 

We came here last night and ordered Beef Panang Curry, Rainbow Fried Rice, and Tom Yum Kai soup. The soup was super flavorful and had the perfect amount of spice. The thought of it makes my mouth water! The Rainbow rice was a little too sweet for me, but I could see it being a popular dish. My boyfriend liked it, but I liked it better without the pineapple bits. The Panang Curry was to die for!! After our first bite we both just stared at each other and said, "oh my god." I don't know what kind of coconut milk they used but it was probably the best Panang curry I've had here. We got it in a spice level 3 (out of 5), but I'd probably get it in a 4 next time because I think it'd be even more amazing with just a little more spice added. It came with a side if white rice, but after we ate all of it we ended up pouring it on top of the Rainbow rice which proved to be a good idea. 

Since we ate so much rice, we got full pretty fast and got a little of everything to go. Needless to say I'm pretty excited to eat leftovers tonight!

5 stars in my book


Bonus: they have drink happy hour from 4-8 (possibly 3-7, so you might want to verify)

Ordered the chicken pad Thai. Level 3 wasn't as hot as I would have liked but good flavor. The Thai tea was delicious. The salad dressing on the lunch special salad was awesome as well! Will definitely come again!

Truly disappointed !  The joint was nice but truly overrated by News 3 Wake up with the Wagners segment.  We asked for beef salad and squid salad. We were then asked by the server how hot 1 to 5 ( 1 being low. 5 being high). Well we asked for a 2   All the while , 2 customers sat after us and were served before us.  FAIL!!  When we got our order, the beef salad was perfect. The squid salad was at a 4 or 5 spicy level. We asked our server to take it back. She refused. Got stuck with it. No tip for her.  Will not be going back any time soon.

I actually live very close to this restaurant, close enough that I found their menu at my doorstep offering delivery. Being the cook that I'm not, I ordered food from them numerous times. With great prices and even better delivery time, I'm a fan of Weera.

I've eaten their green papaya salad many times. They always make it without shrimp as requested. My son likes their mixed vegetables with chicken and I've ordered their cashew nut dish with beef, too. Of course, sticky rice. Everything has always been good.

I've picked up food or had it delivered. The service has always been friendly and timely. I'll be ordering more again soon, especially since I've seen many deals going on now!

I will never be weera or weary of Thai food. Anyway, there is an explosion of Thai places in Vegas and this place is pretty good.

My friend Steven L took me here for lunch. I thoroughly enjoyed it.

Tom Kah Kai - Cocunut Soup with Shrimp, lemongrass and other stuff.  We ordered this 4 out of 5 spicy and it was very nice. We got the large in the tin hot pot and it was very subtle and very tasty.

Spicy Sea Bass - This dish is very, very good. Steamed sea bass served on bed of lettuce with the natural flavor of the steamed sea bass and liquid in the serving "boat" that it came in.  This was very tasty and one of the best type of steamed fish I have had outside of cantonese restaurants.  Again, very subtle and natural flavors. I did not see a fish tank, so I cannot tell HOW fresh the sea bass was, but it tasted very fresh to me.

I will come back and order other things in the future. I wanted to try other things with my friend here rather than the normal curry and pad thai and etc...

Service - Very nice and pleasant.

Prices - Very reasonable.

GK Says this is a great place to go!  Check it out!!!

PS for an asian place, this place had very, very clean toilets. That is an huge plus.  Come on, if you have been to Wo Fat, or some of the other places I have written about, you will know what I mean about the Asian Restaurant Toilet thing!!!

I have to admit I was pretty skeptical at first when my friend found this place. The parking lot seem a bit run down and space was limited. But the steller yelp reviews convinced me to give it a try.

We ordered the lunch special Chicken Pad Thai and Beef Pad Thai. The pad thai noodles is well-cooked. The flavor was on point and the dish was huge. It also come with a spring roll, salad and soup. I highly recommended the pad thai because the taste of the dish was really unique and amazing. We also ordered the Chicken Teriyaki and the serving was also huge. The chicken teriyaki has a lot of sauce but other will enjoy it.

This place is incredible! The food tasted so authentic that I can't wait to give it a 5-stars! The only reason that it loses a star is because the waiter seem to only be serving the large party and neglected the other tables. I will be back soon!
Very good Thai food!  The beef basil was really good and full of flavors.  They can make their foods very spicy as well.  Very good portions as well.

Terrible service!! But great food. Appetizers came after entrees. Asked to cancel it but they said no bc it was almost done. Charged me for it anyways. Ugh. Coulda been 5 star but put me in such a bad mood bc they didn't really seem remorseful after all their mistakes. Whatever. If you eat here order takeout.

I ordered take-out for my girlfriend and myself as this is one of her favorite restaurants. I'm very glad that I did, it is definitely one of the best Thai places I have tried in the valley. The food was delicious and fresh and the employees greeted me with a smile when I picked up the food. They even gave me free drinks! I'll definitely go again.

We came back from an 18 hour flight from Asia, hungry and tired. I had this groupon so we decided to check this place out. I was tired and did not want to get out of the car but the groupon does not allow for take out orders. So we went in. The food was so good it got me re-energized. I am glad we stopped by this place. It was busy but the servers were very attentive. Would definitely visit again.
Delicious. We had delivered. They were quick and friendly. Highly recommend the Pananag curry and the pad se ewe.

Drove out here because we wanted thai food badly but didn't want to pay $22 for a pad thai on the strip. It's not that far either.

Came right in time for happy hour. The thai ice teas were around $1.50-score! Great prices, and great portions. We ordered the duck pad thai, pad sew ew, and panang curry. The duck was kind of dry, and I wished there were more veggies in the curry (was literally all meat and sauce)- but other than that everything was great!

Would return again

I really like this place.   The service is genuine and fast.  They have a dynamic Happy Hour menu with reasonable regional drinks.  There were so many tantalizing item on the dinner menu, we ordered quite a few.  
Had the Green Curry - spicy but good.   Definitely worth a couple of visits.
Great Thai Food. My favorite dish is the drunken noodles with yellow curry-L7. My favorite appetizer is the chicken Satay. I recommend this place for anyone looking for Thai Food in Vegas

So we were visiting Vegas and we really wanted to stay away from the restaurants on the strip for some quiet time then I remembered, I got this Groupon deal online.  Since we have a rental car, it wasn't a big deal driving there.  The place is located in a quiet strip mall with tons of parking.

My husband was craving for some real coconut and being from the Philippine Island, we grew up eating this stuff.  I was really surprised that it tasted exactly like it was in the islands - fresh, sweet and refreshing.  If I didn't eat too much, I can probably finish another one.  So when you come, make sure you order that!

To eat, we had the Crispy Duck Salad and the Garlic SeaBass.  If you know me, crispy duck and sea bass are two of my favorite things!   They were wonderful.  The servings were enormous and can actually feed 4 people total.   We decided we didn't want to waste any food so we sat there for hours and savored our food down to the last morsel.  In the end, we had difficulty standing up and walking to our car but no regrets!  The best Thai food we ever had:))

And as a bonus, the staff are all very friendly and nice.  They never stopped checking on us and they're always smiling.  That's probably the reason why we ate so much!
Best Thai food! I ordered yellow curry fried rice and it was absolutely delicious. They are generous with food quantity and the price is reasonable too.
Favorite Thai food in town !! I'm very picky when it comes to Thai food since I'm from Thailand. Especially Issaan menu, papaya salad, sausages, catfish salad....Make me feel like home !

My girl friend moved to Henderson for medical school in 2012. Since we both love Thai food, we started exploring around Las Vegas area and came across Weera Thai restaurant. A couple of years ago, the restaurant wasn't THAT famous as it is now. The decor was simple and so was the menu. Now there are a lot more items on the menu and it looks more fancy! The food quality has been excellent so far and it is one my favorite Thai restaurants in the US. Whenever I visit Henderson, we try and eat at this place. The Tom Kah Kai soup is heavenly... Green/Yellow chicken curry, Pad see ewe, and papaya salad are my favorite! 

And now they have changed their hours and are open for service 7 days a week! Plus they deliver to the strip! Their happy hour is good and prices are very reasonable. If you love Thai food and are in the Vegas area, you MUST eat here!

This is truly a hidden gem. I have driven by here a million times....past the run down strip mall...even knowing of the great reviews I always tell myself...LATER...BUT finally I stopped in for lunch with a friend who works down the street and I was very very impressed. Fresh Thai food with an attention to detail that is a step above Le Thai downtown....and corkage is $10...what more do you want....

Entrance is a bit sketch but it's really nice inside with very welcoming staff. The food was amazing! I got the pad ka pow chicken. Very flavorful and not overly salty like other restruants. Was a great experience. They have lunch specials including egg roll and rice if it's not a biddle dish is 7.95.

First off...I don't like curry, so I don't often go to Thai restaurants. I got the groupon that was listed because my bf loves thai food. I ordered the wonton soup and kung pow chicken...it was so delicious! yum! My man ordered pad thai and some sort of curry tofu dish. I really liked the pad thai and my bf liked the curry dish. We're going back this weekend, I hope it's just as good!

WOW   best Thai food in vegas. I live here for 40 years and this restaurant is the one. I heard this is the place where Vegas thai chefs hang out.  Sea Bass dish is out of this world. Glass noodles salad is to die for. NO MSG thank you. NO dirty bent aluminum fire pot YESSS.
1000 percents improvement since opening. Congret Peter .....I like to see Jamine rice if possible
Foods incredible! Service is super friendly and very on top of things! If you are craving Thai, this is a must!

Classy joint, OK taste-wise, and service was not bad. The staples were ok, (I'm secretly on a world mission to try all the Tom Ka Kai from all the Thai restaurants around the world. The 4 stars reflect my impression of this)

The yelp deal brought the total price down to about 20 bucks, so expect about 30 if you're two guys whom are suffering from the First World ailment of overeating and gorging yourself.

You might be able to eat cheaper. 

I dare you.

I've come to Weera Thai several times since moving to Vegas. Their spring rolls are fantastic. The rest of the food is superb, and their service is pleasant. Our waitress Supachai was kind and informative and I would definitely recommend this place for a first date, birthday party, or gathering of close friends and good food.

Amazing place. I really enjoy the ambiance of the place- good music, good lighting, and clean. Was seated and served very quickly. Food came out fast and was delicious. I got the pepper garlic chicken and the flavors were mouthwatering.

Based on the reviews given, we decided to purchase a $30 Living Social deal.  The spicy scale level is from a 1-5.  We ordered the Duck Curry, Spicy level #3 and the crab fried rice.

After reading others review about how their spicy isn't really spicy, we expected just that.  To our surprise, the spicy 3 is quite spicy!  I love to drench my brown rice with the curry, but not for this meal. The crab fried rice was good.  There were chunks of real crab meat in this dish.  I really liked it.  We ended our meal with the durian on sticky rice.  I enjoyed it so much that we went to China town on Friday, picked up a durian and will try to duplicate that dessert today.  Yum.  But again, durian is an acquired test...

I come here about once a month for lunch. My favorite food item here is their Shrimp Pad Thai. Spice Level 4. I love it,but warning itll give you heartburn if you are not used to the spice! lol. Their spring roll it comes with is delicious as well. I need to try their other menu items as all the photos posted here on yelp look soo good!! Great place! Definitely Recommend!

We took a party of 28 to Weera Thai to celebrate multiple birthdays.  It was excellent!  The food rivals Lotus of Siam and the service was amazing. They went above and beyond making us feel special and making sure we all were taken care of properly!  We will be back!

Came here with a party of five close to closing time. The staff were very friendly and didn't seem too put out when we stayed a bit past closing. The food was all very good, especially the Green Curry. We all managed to scrape the plates clean and the bill for the five of us was $100 before our wondrous Groupon, which took off $40.  The neighborhood was kinda shady looking though.
My wife and I have visited this restaurant  twice and we love the food and service.  We are their customers for the foreseeable future unless a disaster occurs.

We decided to go here while visiting Las Vegas, after reading the reviews and hearing it was one of the top thai restaurants in the area. We ended up going here twice during our stay - everyone enjoyed it so much.  Loved the fresh coconut water...after drinking the water, they will cut it in half so you can scoop out the coconut meat also. Staff is friendly and food taste and portions are good.

As they say, don't judge a book by its cover. It may look ugly outside but it's a very cute & clean place. Very quiet in there, there was only 2 other people in there other than myself and my brother. We got greeted as we walked in, got our order pretty quickly. Our waiter was very friendly. Got our order quickly and received our food at a decent amount of time. Food quality is very good. We ordered crab sticks and omg it was delicious. I'll be back just for those. We also ordered pad see ew which is enough for up to two people. If you love Thai tea try theirs. It was very good I'll be back!

So far my favorite Thai! 

The outside doesn't look like much it's a few doors down from more Asian choices. You walk in to a small restaurant with a wine rack on the back wall. Went in around 3 had a choice of happy hour specials but I already had a game plan. I had take out once from here that a friend ordered and it was so good I wanted the flavors again. 

I was greeted when I walked in and told to sit anywhere. The nice lady came over brought me water. I ordered pineapple fried rice with chicken, pad see ew with beef and a Thai iced tea. 

The pineapple fried rice is amazing you have your choice of meat. The rice is cooked with yellow curry, big chunks of tomatoes, big chunks of pineapple, cashews and green onion. Huge serving. I chose chicken which was big chunks. 

Pad see ew is sooo good too! Be careful there are two one is made with curry. It is stated. This one is the regular you pick your choice of meat. Large flat noodles and bok choi in a brown sauce with you meat. I chose beef it compliments the everything very well. Huge servings.

I was going to order egg rolls but I forgot. I always order Thai iced tea it's always soooo good.  I took lots of left overs home but that was the plan. Both heat up nicely and gave me enough for 3 other meals. 

Price wise it averages about $10-$13 an entrée. The flavors and portions are worth the price. The staff is nice and attentive. My suggestion would be go in two or more and sample each other's orders or plan on a lot of leftovers.

I feel like I am always mentally juggling Thai restaurants, trying to declare one as my favorite. I usually use either Panang or Red Curry w/Tofu and a Tom Yum Soup w/Chicken as my lab standards. After 4 meals at Weera Thai over the past month, it has because obvious that Weera Thai is my (current) favorite!

Very generous portions and generous proteins in the portions. A large Tom Yum w/Chicken is easily a meal in itself, as is the Panang Curry w/Tofu. Flavor and thickness of curry is spot on, and the price is the best quality-to-value Thai in town. The Tom Yum broth is kept hot in a flame-pot. 

The restaurant is extremely clean, the waitstaff and chef are super nice, and their Sahara Avenue location has proven to be very convenient, inspiring some last-minute Weera Thai redirection when deciding where to eat. Cleanliness was the reason we dumped our old Thai restaurant crush in search of a new one. Weera in love!

I am so confident in Weera Thai that I took my visiting East Coast family (party of 12) there for dinner over the holidays. One of my sisters and brother-in-laws declared Weera's Tom Kha as the best they'd ever had in their lives. 

With the current Yelp Deals promotion ($10 for $20) you cannot afford not to try Weera. Weera is also doing a 10% off special when you check-in on the Yelp app. Yelp friendly indeed. Go tonight!
Great green curry with tofu, awesome spicy eggplant with beef; more food than the two of us could finish; and with (adult) beverages, tax and tip, still around $30.  We'll be back.

In October when I first found this place I was a little off put. It's in what seems like a run down strip mall on Sahara Ave. reluctantly we walked in and it was like going through the closet to Narnia. (Ok, I exaggerate, but it is much nicer than the outside portrays.)

We ordered fried tofu, tom kah Kai, and orange chicken. We were hooked. It was a lunch date with a co-worker and we have been here almost every other week since. I'm addicted to their chili basil chicken and they are the only Thai food place that has the really spicy chili oil. I mention this because perhaps you are a chili/spicy lover like I am. My co-worker loves their cashew chicken, so that also comes highly recommended. The service is great and you can sign up for rewards to earn points for free food on future visits.

This was the 3rd consecutive trip in which we dined at Weera so you know we are fans.  It is a small mom and pop restaurant that excels at dishes from the Issan region of Thailand, but everything we have tried has been good.  This time we shared orders of Pad Thai and kai soi with chicken.  The latter, also known as Chiangmai, is made with wide noodles, coconut milk, chili paste, fish sauce, ginger, curry powder and a touch of sugar.  Both were very good renditions of these popular entrees, as was the service.  Pricing is moderate and becomes a bargain with the Yelp deal.
Food is decent, but would like my food spicier. Great lunch specials. Not worth going out of your way for, but if you're in the area stop for a quick bite.
Love this place! The pad see ew is amazing. I've had many other dishes but they can be on the salty side. Lunch special cannot be beat with Thai tea for only $1.50.

This place has been on my radar for three months now. I finally made it for lunch a few days ago, and I have to say -it was a disappointing experience.

  I chose menu item F-6 (Spicy Thai Holy Basil with chicken) -which was stir fried chicken, onions, chili, and Thai holy basil leaves. The chicken itself was sliced -not ground and was a little tough and dry. The dish appeared to be swimming in grease -instead of a sauce. I didn't know sliced chicken could be greasy... 

The level 3 spice out of 5 barely registered as spicy, and as a result the food was bland. Why do most Thai places skimp on basil? I thought this was a dish that featured basil?  Instead, I found myself on the hunt looking for basil underneath the rubbery overcooked chicken. 

The restaurant itself is clean, quaint, and inviting. My order was done in 10 minutes which was nice considering I was on my lunch break. However, I would rather they took their time to make sure the dish actually tasted good. 

I won't come back as there are just too many good Thai places to choose from in Las Vegas.

Had yellow curry with tofu and pad see yew with tofu. 
Pad see yew was awesome
Yellow curry had really nice flavoring. My only complaint was the veggie to curry ratio was way off. I couldn't eat it with rice, otherwise the curry sauce would have been gone after 5 bites. 
Tofu was cooked nicely. 

Will still come back again.

OMG!! Hands down, this is officially theeeee best thai food place I've eaten at...EVER!! From the service to decor to the taste, everything was superb. 

It was late when my friend and I yelped this place. Pics were enticing and reviews were great. We had a little over an hour before closing and rushed over. It's off the strip in a neighborhood not too far from chinatown. 

Walked in, was immediately greeted with smiles and escorted to our table. Our waiter was the best! He was so attentive and helpful. He was patient even though we asked several questions about unfamiliar dishes. He offered honest suggestions and had a smile to go with each one. We were curious, indecisive, and wanted leftovers. We ordered yellow curry w/ shrimp, spicy basil fried rice w/ shrimp, crab rolls, chicken fried rice, chicken pad thai, mango sticky rice, and a few alcoholic beverages to go with our meals. Mmm...mmm...good is all we could say. Every forkful was flavorful. 

Curry was the right consistency. It was loaded with plump shrimp, potatoes, and carrots. The other noodle and rice dishes were full of fresh veggies and herbs. Portions were large and they did not skimp on meat. The crab rolls were like long egg rolls. They were a tiny bit fishy and may have been better if we ate them right away. Instead, my friend was busy sipping her wine and I, my special menu mojito with fresh chunks of mango. Yum...theee best!! The late night happy hour made them even better. We had plenty of leftovers to take back to the hotel. My friend's boys were still up and ready to eat when we returned. They had never eaten thai food, tried and liked everything. The next day, leftovers were devoured by all of us. 

As for the restaurant...decor was gorgeous and authentic. Lights were dim, service was quick. There was plenty of tables and the restaurant was clean. The menu is large!! There is lots to choose from. Excellent recommendation for locals. I will definitely return next time I visit Vegas.

Had a couple of very spotty lunch take out experiences here but the last dine in lunch was very good. 
Used the 20.00 for 10.00 through Yelp so that made the deal even better. Had the dynamite wings, pad Thai, & mixed vegetables. All very tasty. Would definitely go back regularly for the lunch deals.

This restaurant is AMAZING!  I have been here several times in the past two years, each time the meal is an experience in different flavors.  I've had the lunch special which is Mon.- Fri., 3 times, as well as eaten off the menu.  The eggplant with chicken is phenomenal!!

Can't say enough about this restaurant, I drive across town regularly to go here!  Give it a go...very worth every cent and time spent to get here!!
had dinner and place was nice, service is good. had a good dinner with my fave phad thai.

This place has great Thai food but the service is defiantly not the best. A new girl made my Thai tea with hella cream no tea. Shit was like drinking milk . After I ate my food, which was after happy hour! I told my server that the tea was horrible. They told me to remake it, it would be 3 dollars . I spend at least 30 or 50 dollars here every other week. This is so messed up on many levels ! I will be complaining to owner ...if not resolved I will never ever return .
Come here during happy hour which is 4-8! Their food is awesome and the price isn't bad either. Our server, Tanita was awesome as well. Great food and great service. Definitely coming back

Supachai was awesome. Very knowledgeable and our service was great. I love the team efforts when cleaning tables and checking on guests. As a server that speaks volumes for this company! Our food was phenomenal and oh so tastey! We will be back!!! LOOOOVED IT!
They have lunch special come with salads and soup with good price. PadThai not as good as Malaysia style. The place is nice and neat.

They were quick on delivery.. Good taste
Will definitely come back here.. Portions were pretty good..
I love this place. Me and my coworkers always order at this restaurant. Very good food. I recommend this to everyone.

Weera Thai is simply "Amazing".  I dine there for dinner with increasing frequency.  The food from the extensive menu is consistently outstanding; it never disappoints.  It's fresh, well prepared, flavorful, and offers a complexity that most mortals (including some of the top chefs in Vegas who go there) simply cannot prepare at home.   It is clear that the Weera Thai owners and staff actually care, want your dining experience to be positive, and value your business.  Care is taken to keep the restaurant very clean, and the relaxed, casual, atmosphere is great for conversation.  The service is polite, efficient, friendly and attentive, never intrusive.  I've tried most Thai restaurants in Las Vegas, the extensive menu (including Issan) differentiates itself from others. It has rave reviews from a number of  food critics;  A recent Desert Companion review of Thai Restaurants in Las Vegas claimed it "Best Thai Food in the Universe" and "Mind-blowing".  The portions are ample and the pricing is very reasonable.  

Reading the other reviews, ..I've not been there during peak lunch hours.  Keep in mind that it is a small establishment and being way from China Town and the Strip, in a small strip mall, means that it really has to deliver to draw customer in order to offer the more extensive menu; if they are out of eggs rolls...there are so many interesting excellent choices not offered elsewhere.  The Pad Kee Mow (Drunken Noodle),  is outstanding, (I think the owner said that they get the noodles fresh daily!) - I'll take freshness, at the expense of their being out of something on occasion, but personally I've not experienced that.   As of late, I ask the waitresses to select something for me that I haven't tried before - not something I'd not do in many restaurants.  

There are times where it can be a bit busy in the evening if a number of tables show up at the same time, and there are large groups.  My suggestions is go with friends, or a date and enjoy the dining experience, and the environment that allows for conversation.  I dine out often with friends, and am not a stranger to fine dining, and worked in the restaurant industry myself for many years when younger.
I was in Las Vegas for Christmas, and went there both Eve and Day with friends (who are from Asia, live in Las Vegas and are knowledgeble and selective about their restaurants, and fine dining).  They loved it.

Some ideas in addition to Specials there: Panang Curry, Pinapple Fried Rice (hint of curry) combination , Tom Yum or Tom Kha Gai, Crab Fried Rice, (can't recall the name...but there's a duck sausage) I finally tried the Papaya Salad (a bit sweet for my taste, and a bit heavy on the dressing for my liking).  I'd order it again, but ask for less dressing and spicer heat level).  I've had the Spicy Thai Holy Basil with Chicken - mentioned by another reviewer -no complaints.

I just ordered delivery food through Yelp eat24. I love how I can track what my status of food is at  I ordered papaya salad, tom yum soup, and pad thai which is bomb!!! Must try if you love Thai food!!

Pro: Food is good.  This is my 2nd favorite Thai restaurant in town.  
Cons: Employees looked serious every time.
(1 young man with eye glasses is the only one that always has smile on his face all the time) ****Wish they don't add MSG.**** Some ppl get headache and thirsty after meal. 

Please  please don't use MSG.

Overall I would recommend. I also like their rewards program.
Ok my friend and i went again, this time grabbing another friend and we LOVED it. Even with my 2 lil boys we all ate a whole lot and i love the fresh vegetables. Can't wait to try something else new.
This place is very authentic... I like their larb phet, gang sap, and the service is is nice.

Giving this place 5 stars cuz they deserve it!! Good food good service, and they give you generous potions. 
This place is the number 1 on my list according to Thai food, even thought I don't live in Vegas anymore.. Thumbs up !! Weera team !!

Service is slacking. Very nice staff, but servers should AT LEAST try to accommodate the guests request. There were 2 head tilting experiences but I'll go ahead and skip the first experience because there isn't enough characters on yelp to thoroughly convey what just happened. When there are paying guests, denying or making excuses for a simple request is a poor business move, especially if it's not compromising the integrity of the establishment or of the food. Anyhow, moving on...

Tom yum Kung: 3/5 stars. Good flavor. 

Spicy fried rice: 3/5 stars! we had the soup brought out to us first at a level 2 like the server suggested even after I told her that I can eat really spicy foods. Wasn't spicy enough so I had her tell the kitchen to make the rest of the order a level 3/5. Her response, "well they already made the fried rice, but I can tell them to make your pad see ew spicier." 

Hm...so then I have to add the Sambal and other spices by myself? But then it won't taste the same. Irritating.

Pad see ew: 2.5/5 stars. Bland! 

Mango sticky rice (sauce on side) : 5/5 stars! Bomb! Rice came out fresh and warm, mangos were also fresh with great flavor! 

Servers were sweet and attentive. I just wished they accommodated what I asked! It's not difficult to re toss the fried rice in more spice even AFTER it was done.
Favorite Thai place! Pad Thai is great. The duck curry is the best in town! The owner and his family are very nice and humble. Love that! Lunch special is quick and easy. Very spice!
They have the best green curry. I will always order green curry and pad thai from this place.

I love Weera! A friend introduced me about a year ago and I have brought my family and other friends to try since. I tend to stick to the same things (tofu spring rolls and tom ka gai (coconut soup), but they have an excellent selection of appetizers, noodles, and curry too. During my last visit, I wasn't feeling that great so when staff attempted to sit us close to the door, I quickly requested another seat to avoid the draft. We were quickly accommodated and served hot tea, which made me feel really great. I will definitely be back in the future!

Been going here for many years   best shrimp pineapple rice , and roasted BBQ pork are delicious. 

Good service , good admosphe , I tried most Thai in town this is my favorite. EM
If you love Thai Food you gotta come here.  Chef specials are great.  Presentation is beautiful.  Decor is gorgeous.  Their sauce is the boss.  Weera Thai is the bomb .com y'all.  Come enjoy.

Where do I start? When we got in we were seated at our table and was given our menus! Then the chick brought us our water! Not a min later asked us if we were ready to order after barley looking at the menus! We told her we weren't.There was a group that came in and was seated right behind us! After waiting about 20 mins for her to come back which she never did! While watching the whole time that waitress taking that groups order and one by one bringing them their food! After about 35mins my sister went up to the other guy waitress and told him we were ready to order and asked if our waitress had taken our order he was nice apologizing! After we were done and was about to pay never asked us how the food was but asked us how the service was! He knew we were pissed! We never got our water refilled and also had to catch the guy to ask for more water!My sister told him this is the worst service I've ever had! Mind you she's not a very picky person! I gotta give them props their food its on point! But seriously!

The food is really good here.  I can sense that the owner really cares about the quality of the food. It's the only place so far that has my favorite dessert, Sweet sticky rice with durian.  Other restaurant won't serve it bc of their infamous fragrance...oh well.  All I can say to my fellow Thai food eaters is this...PLEASE DO NOT SMELL THE FOOD, JUST PUT IT IN YOUR MOUTH AND SAVOR THE FLAVOR.  I found that sometimes food that smells good, does not necessary taste good.  In our culture, THE STINKIER, THE BETTER!!!

I had high hopes for this place, especially since it is closer to me and less crowded than Lotus of Siam. Slowly my hope faded away.  We got seated right away and served glasses of water, but it took fifteen minutes before our order was taken...and we had our menus closed for about 12 of those minutes.  My waitress was not familiar with the wines they were serving and more importantly the food that they were serving. I do not eat any sugar, so I asked about the duck salad warning her I can only eat very little sugar.  I asked her what was in it, she couldn't tell me specifically, just said  vegetables and duck.  I asked her about the sauce, she said it was not sweet, I asked her if the sauce could be put on the side, she said, "No."  However, she came with the alternative that the chef prepare the Duck salad without using sugar. I accepted and ordered the duck salad with 3 star spice.  I then asked about the wines, she knew nothing about wines (fine, I understand not everyone drinks) and quietly flipped over the menu that showed "Pairings".  My husband ordered the Tom Yum Kai and Pork Ka Pow , without any modifications other than 3 star spice.  We shared the soup and agreed that if was mostly a premade soup base, which they used too much of.  The broth was too intense, yet not what I would think was 3 star spiciness.   His Ka Pow was very bland and had no resemblance to the Ka Pows we've ordered at other places or made at home.  We had to ask for the chili condiment kit to adjust the spice.  My duck salad was very disappointing given the price and alterations she said they could do...Very little duck, atleast a half mango (she didn't mention there was fruit- again I can't eat sugar including sweet fruit, and then the salad was dressed in a very sweet sauce...even my husband who is sugar tolerant said it was too sweet).  Needless to say, it was disappointing...my Thai craving is still craving.

***First I want to start this review by saying this is one of my fav Thai spots in town. I use their delivery service all the time!  The food is always, hot and delicious, and they even use great little cardboard Togo boxes. This review is long overdue!***

Experience:  I came in for lunch after one of my chef friends told me to try the Crispy Duck Salad. I've tried many things here, but this is my first time trying this dish. 

Facility:  it's located in a tiny strip mall along Sahara.  It's pretty small, but it has booths, tables and chairs and even a few bar seats.  It's a quaint little place that has a small diner like feel. 

Service:  They sat me immediately in a small booth in the back. Perfect because I'm rollin solo today and prefer not to sit in the middle of the room looking lonely. 

Food:  love that they have Coke products!!!!  
Crispy Duck Salad - (5/5) wow!  He was right!  I don't think they make anything bad here. The duck is crispy and amazing!  The greens, carrots, and tomatoes are fresh and tossed with a sweet and sour type dressing with garlic and cilantro. I ordered it spicy, which adds the perfect balance of heat to the sweetness of the fresh mango!  It also has cashews that add slight decadence and nice crunch to the salad. Great dish!

Overall:  love this place! The worse part about eating here is deciding which dish to order and which dish to forego. I use them regularly to deliver food and stop in from time to time for some eats too.
Until someone shows me different...this is my number 1 Thai restaurant!

Tasty curry.  Great service.  Clean restaurant.

The co-workers and I placed an online order for pickup after a recommendation from one of them.  We arrived about 15 min after the orders went in and the meals were waiting for us upon arrival.  Although we did not eat there, I will say the restaurant was extremely clean from what I saw.

I ordered the red curry lunch special.  Great option with a lot of food for only $11.  Everything had so much flavor, it was amazing!

Will definitely be going back again!

We used to frequent Le Thai and became discouraged at their lack of customer service, especially towards locals and regulars. We found this place and have never thought of going anywhere else since. The food is superb, quality is far above all others, presentation is so impressive, and the staff is sooooo friendly. Their Happy Hour specials are unlike anything we've seen. We used to get our favorite sake for $18 at Le Thai ($14 at Itsy Bitsy,) and the same exact sake is $6 (!!!!!) at Weera. Unbelievable...in every single way!

I liked the place. Nice upscale ambience. Loved their food. BUT was upset with the rude servers. I been to many Thai restaurants & they have turned out to be with the worst customer service so far. I apologize for being rude but definitely wouldn't recommend dining in.  I tried panang curry (Nice thick curry with peanut flavor with tender chicken was served in a nice bowl) & mastmann curry (my dad loved it) along with coconut juice (It was cold but was sweet) & veggie egg roll (Decent size veggies didn't look stale so probably fresh).

I'm a big fan of this place, we always frequent here when we get a chance to go. I know before they weren't open on Sundays but I'm glad they are now because we are able to go have lunch. I pretty much like everything they have, especially offering Thai-Issan food. My favorite I like to order is the beef nam tok (medium) with sticky rice and it does come out pretty spicy for me but it's good.

We've tried a lot of the soups and they are very good too. I would totally recommend this place to everyone I know because I thought I've had real Thai food in Vegas until I came upon this place. The staff is very nice and gotta love the Thai Tea :)

Weera Thai has been a great place to dine as long as my experience goes. The food is great and the thai ladies working there are nice.

So, for the 4th of July weekend my family planned to go there for dinner. When we arrived, we noticed that they have renovated the place and it was a much bigger than what I used to know. It was busy, but we cared to wait since we wanted to eat some of our usual dishes again. When we got our table, it was a bit awkward because it was squashed between two other tables and one of our chairs was blocking the path to the restrooms which created unwanted passing through by other people and disturbing our dinner. Then, we have this nice thai lady taking order from us. However, she wasn't taking down any notes. Instead, she was memorizing my orders, so seems like she was pretty good at it. Until, we noticed that we made the order before a couple arrived next to us. But, that couple got their food first and one of the waitress accidentally brought the couple's food to our table. We ordered the same type of dish and when the waitress realized she made a mistake, she was confused and took the food back.That is when I realized the lady who took our order made a grave mistake. We ordered the eggplant dish with beef, but it arrived with chicken and as soon as I saw my favorite dish of crispy pork and vegetables, i realized the portion was smaller than before and the quality dropped just by looking at it. Usually I finish the whole plate but this time I cannot chew some of the pieces, the skin felt like rubber. I can sense that the chefs are out of their breath and exhausted from cooking over and over again at a very busy time. Overall, we didn't get to enjoy our dinner fully. I didn't complain because we are already tired and hungry and we don't feel like bringing up these issues. However, the thai lady who took our order was very nice to bring a coloring paper and crayons for my son to keep himself busy.

I worked at as a Server for an Authentic Thai restaurant back in Seattle for 4 years so I am super picky on my expectations of Phad Thai to be particular, but this is the 5th Thai place I've tried here and I must say the Phad Thai is great! I came to meet a friend for their lunch special and find it nice to have the salad and soup as a starter which comes with it! Also the soup was their Tom yum so that is nice because I had the chance to taste it for future reference and I would be in favor of it as well. Great portion for a special. This was my first visit which was recommended by my friend so as far as consistency, I will update in the future. I know how much they make you walk past your tables to check on the guest but that would be the only thing I would say that was a little annoying. Only because there were only two tables in the restaurant and I had a small 1 yr old and a 2 year old who were frigidity but not anywhere else but the table. That can feel unwelcoming if I cant dine comfortably without feeling like I'm being watched every 3 minutes or so. I am not exaggerating, and I know this because there was one lady coming to fill our waters but the guy was pacing back and forth looking at our table. When it came time for the check he didn't come back which was also annoying because you would assume he would be on top of it as many times as he passed through. We had to go to the register. All in all, still a great place, maybe just a little space for the customer to not feel like they can't eat in peace.

We ordered the Chicken tofu panang curry, a deep fried duck dish, and the appetizer shrimp cold rolls.  

The chicken tofu panang curry is to die for.  Both my GF and I loved it.  It was thick, sweet, tasty, spicy, all that a Thai dish should be.  I think we both rated it the best from the thai restaurants we've been.  The cold rolls in rice sheets were also super good, but what made it great was that warm peanut sauce that came with it.  It was peanut creamy, sweet and rich tasting.  Also a high ranker.

The duck dish was the only thing I thought was OK.  They really tried to pad their pricing by including duck dishes and Sea bass.  There's really no reason to order the duck dish, since it wasn't really very good anyways.  It was a mix of really heavy tasting thai spices, and it was too much for my senses or distinguish any kind of flavor.  Just too strong in my opinion.

Weera makes me a fan.  Also I really enjoyed the way the restaurant looked and how the walls were decorated.  It's pretty nice ambiance for a date.

Edit: 4/16 
Were Back again!  During lunch this time.  Unfortunately lunch was a big dissapointment.  The portion of the lunch specials was half the dinner portion.  To compensate they include fillers, a salad, a spring roll, a bowl of watered down tom yum soup.  Biggest issue, was the food Must have been cooked by the sous chef.  The red curry was super watery and the  fresh spring rolls that we loved so much last time, the peanut sauce was watered down and full of starch and not rich peanut flavored.  Was 100% different and not remotely good.  i probably wont come here during lunch time.  Ill try this place at dinner again to see if its a consistency issue
Like the atmosphere for a simple Thai place. Had cashew chicken spicy. Was solid. Will return.

I am a fan of this small but nicely decorated Thai restaurant.  I was there for the first time--certainly not the last time--Saturday night.  I had the Yelp deal and it worked beautifully.

I started with the crab stick appetizer.  Here's how the menu describes it:  Deep fried rice paper wrapped with mix crab meat & cream sauce, served with homemade plum sauce.  When I saw 6 sticks, I thought there was no way I could eat all of them and have room for dinner.  Wrong!  They were so very tasty you could never leave one to be taken away.  The plum sauce was good, and my server brought me the hot spice holder and I used some chili paste to spice up some of the sticks.

For the main course, I ordered from the Issan (northern Thailand area) part of the menu which offers foods with more spice kick.  I got the Ped Nom Tok, and the menu describes it like this:  Sliced boneless roasted duck home made with chili paste, herbs, spices & lime juice.  I asked for a spicy level of 4 out of 5.  It was spicy, but from my little array of spices, I added some extra red pepper flakes.  The dish was superb!  The mint that garnished the dish and the raw cabbage gave you something to cool your palate when the red pepper heat got to be a bit much.

Time for dessert.  I had two things in mind.  Durian sticky rice or coconut ice cream.  I had been warned that the durian would cause horrendous breath.  Anthony Bourdain describes durian this way.  "...Your breath will smell as if you'd been French-kissing your dead grandmother."  Since I was going to a show after dinner, I opted for the coconut ice cream.  It was the safer choice, and it was very good with some small chunks of coconut mixed in.

I started dinner with a Thai iced coffee and I had an order of sticky rice.

The service was fantastic.  There were three ladies who were very attentive and answered a couple of questions I had.  I thought the one was going to say "chicken" when I opted out of the durian sticky rice dessert.  

The Yelp deal worked fine.  I paid $10 and received credit for $20 from Weera.  She took the code off my iPhone and asked me to mark the deal used which I did.

As I said before, this won't be a one time visit.  It is good, and I am a fan!!  Thanks to my fellow Yelpers for letting me know this place exists.

I've been wanting to come to Weera for a while and found a opportunity today to pop in for their lunch specials (available everyday 11am-4pm). 

We decided to share chicken panang and tofu pad thai. 

All entrees come with soup which I was pleased that it was tom yum broth with mushrooms. the salad is standard iceburg mix, but the sesame peanutty dressing on it was better than most offer. Eggroll was standard, but decent. 

The panang was good. I like the lime shreds on top for some aromatics and the curry sauce is thick and rich. If you like a more coconut creamy panang base then you'll probably enjoy the way they style the curry here. I like all kinds, depending on my mood and today the creamy style was agreeing with me.

Tofu pad thai had decent flavor, but it was too saucy. It had a mouthfeel closer to carbonara than stir fried noodles and neither of us were fans of it. Don't know if this is just the style they do or if it was a mishap. 

The portion sizes, specially considering these are lunch specials, were very generous and come at a great price since lunch specials are $7-8. 

Thai ice tea was a good sweetness to tea ratio. Best of all, during lunch they're only $1 as well as thai ice coffee and soda. They also have a happy hour for drinks and appetizers though I missed what time that was at.

I can see potential in the food, but since one of our entrees was just alright, I think maybe a 4 is high. I will be back though as the dinner menu had some interesting Issan regional dishes and I can always be into curry!

If you love duck, thai basil, and curry, get the duck with the green curry and mixed vegetables. I took Misti's advice and ate the most delicious curry of my life. Duck is one of my favorite proteins, so you don't like duck, you can skip the rest of my review, but for those duck lovers out there, they keep the crispy skin on, and then pour delicious green curry all over it!! The mixed vegetables are the way to go as it makes the dish taste more fresh than a bunch of eggplant. We got everything at level 4 (out of 5) spice and it was very modest compared to other Thai restaurants in town. 

We also ordered tom yum soup (first time trying it), and pad see ew. Tom yum is an interesting soup being sour (really sour. I was puckering at almost every bite) but I don't like spitting out all the random things in the soup that look innocent, but end up being crunchy (lemongrass?). It was listed at #8 on CNN's list of 100 foods to try before you die. I've tried it, and now I'll know not to order it again. Pad see ew was standard and mango sticky rice had a pretty sour mango for a $6 dessert, although the rice was cute in the shape of a heart. Service was sweet and they made sure to ask if we had any coupons before getting our bill so as not to waste time. 

In summary: duck lovers, do NOT pass up the green curry with duck and mixed vegetables.
This place is really good and staff is extremely friendly. Food is always fresh and the presentation is beautiful and you can't beat their happy hour!

After dining here a couple of times, it was time for a review. A small little thai joint that serves solid food. Some dishes are better than others so I'm just going to list which ones I've had.

Sample Appetizer Plate (Deep fried tofu, fried wontons, Thai egg rolls & chicken pot stickers) - I would not order this again. Everything was blah and not a lot of flavor.
Duck Bone Soup - As stated in the name, it's mainly a lot of duck bones with broth. The soup itself tasted good but not enough meat for my tastes. I might try the pork rib soup once it's wintertime.
Nom Tok Moo - The pork is grilled but they let meat cool down to room temp before its served. Seasoned with rice powder, spices, lime juice and chili makes for a very tasty dish.
Kana Moo Krob - Basically, fried pork belly with chinese broccoli and oyster sauce. My favorite dish here especially since the pork belly was cooked to perfection. There's also another pork belly dish called Ka Pow Moo Krob which I can't wait to try.
Green Curry - It was wonderful but the best part of the dish is the eggplant!
Pad Kee Mow (Drunken Noodles) - Well executed ... no complaints here.
Crab Fried Rice - Absolutely, not one piece or smidgen of crab in it. I should've sent it back.

According to one of my friends, she thought the neighborhood is kinda sketchy but I have no problems returning especially if they are still serving the fried pork belly entrees!

Love the atmosphere of the restaurant!  I had some kind of seafood green curry.  It was my first time trying green curry, I'm still not sure if I like it.  I am looking forward to going back for date night as the atmosphere is so nice but also cozy.  I will try something I am more accustomed to like yellow curry, or noodles.  I would also like to try the soups.  Service was great!

great option for eating off-the-strip, especially since it seems there's a thai restaurant on every block around here. i used the eat24 app to place a to-go order because I wasn't sure if they delivered to the hotel or not. at any rate, we were greeted warmly as soon as we entered the restaurant - surprised at how quiet and pleasant it was inside considering its location. tastefully decorated, too. 

we ordered the chicken satay (our three-year-old's favorite), fresh spring rolls with shrimp (large portion, couldn't finish it! very fresh, nice ratio of veggies to shrimp), pad thai with tofu (medium spicy was just right; lots of tofu pieces, too), and house fried rice with chicken. it was too much food; i felt bad we couldn't eat it all. will probably order the satay, rolls, and pad thai again especially since we're in vegas for another two days. it's so nice to find places off-the-strip with great food, value, and service!

not a fan.  the food was meh, the service was horrible.  went there for lunch today with a small group, ordered an appetizer for all to share and each ordered an individual dish.  i also ordered an ice tea - they were out.  i believe this has to be a first for a thai place.  

one of our dishes came out about 15 minutes of waiting, still no appetizer.  finally after about  30-40 minutes the appetizer came out followed by the other two dishes spaced out about 5 minutes apart.  ???  lunch took  about 1 1/2 hours and the taste wasn't worth the time it would take at panda.  f this place.  don't go.

Great Thai food! we used the yelp groupon and overall it was a great value. My pad thai was good, not the best I've ever had but good enough to make me happy. My husband ordered garlic shrimp and that was delicious. We plan on going again soon.

Lunch special - $7.99!  I tried the red curry with tofu lunch special.  It came with the tom yum soup and a salad.  The curry was very good, not too sweet.  The lunch also came with an egg roll, and I was pleasantly surprised.  It was perfectly fried with the perfect crunch.  The sweet sauce they give you to dip the egg roll in was also perfect, not too sweet. 

I love the decor inside; it gives a more-than-usual modern feel to most Thai restaurants in town.  They also have a bar, which looks like a full bar.  The service was also great.  I am definitely coming back!
Extremely slow service. I ordered just a regular entry and my friend also ordered similar.  I sat there for 20min and after he finished his food I was served.

One of my fave Thai places. Always consistent in food quality and the staff is great. Sometimes the restaurant is jam packed, but it is with good reason!! Join their rewards program. Lunch specials are a great value.
I would rather eat cardboard than the Pad Seu and the complimentary wings did not make the delivery. The white rice was delicious, but then my 4 year old neice can make white rice.

We broke up.

This place is heaven. The food is unparalleled. I can barely enjoy Thai food elsewhere, even in other states, including LA. I've been eating here since like 2010.

But last time I called to order (which is like once a week if you know my love of Thai food), I was disclosed that many options I long consumed under the title of "vegetarian" weren't & couldn't be made specially for me, either, because of shrimp paste, fish sauce, chicken stock, etc. that were already added beforehand.

Just heartbreaking.

Glad they were honest, but wish I'd known sooner.

Please fix your veg menu & be able to accommodate! I miss your food dearly. It wouldn't take much to carry veggie stock for your soups, to reserve a portion of pad thai base without fish sauce/add it to the portion itself instead, and to have at least ONE CURRY without shrimp paste for your vegs! Please!

This is the second time that I have been to Weera Thai Restaurant and both were for lunch.  The place sits in a run down strip mall, but that should not be a deterrent from visiting.  The place is very clean inside and the service that you get is second to none.

Within seconds of entering the place you're greeted by the staff and they ask you to make yourself comfortable.  You're imediately given menu's and drink orders are taken.  From that time on, your drinks are never left to go empty.

The menu is pretty good and has a vast array of options to choose from, as well as the typical adjustments for spiciness, if that's your thing.  I've ordered the Shrimp Pad Thai, Cashew Chicken and Garlic Chicken and I have yet to have a bad meal.  The food is fresh and very tasty and as authentic as anything else served up in Vegas.

The price point for the meals are usually set well, not to cheap and not overly exorbant either.  Service is perfect and the environment is always pleasant.  I would recommend this place for a good thai meal.

Oh, and the Thai Iced Tea is absolutely delicious!
Went here for a friend's birthday- the food was good and the cocktails were creative. I would go back but not my very first choice.

FANTASTIC!!!!
These guys know the basics about customer service infused with super-flavorful thai food. We've been coming here for a year (about 8 times). Friendly, fast, clean and fresh tasting thai food. I'd give it 10 stars if I could. Not in a fancy big box stand alone building but clean and worth the visit. You won't go wrong I promise. Try the Pad Thai, Deep Fried Tofu and 'F5" Spicy Thai Basil. Fresh and mouthwatering. Oh and the price ... very affordable. ENJOY this GEM!!!!
My husband, daughter and I had lunch here today before flying out from the Las Vegas airport. Their lunch specials were excellent - great flavor and great value.

Good Thai food and definitely 5 stars for convenience. 

We arrived to Vegas tired and hungry. Got to our hotel and ordered delivery for the Pineapple fried rice, Pork green curry and pad see ew. $5 charge to have hot tasty food delivered to us was an amazing relief. 

There wasn't much traffic on the strip so it took about 20 minutes to arrive after ordering. Thank you!! So much better than room service :)

Have to say I am so impressed with this place. The food was great and the service are awesome. I'm from Florida and we have some authentic Thai restaurant but this place is out of ordinary ... Thank you Yelp for leading us to this great restaurant ... We salute you ...

Amazing Customer Service! They Are Really Attentive To See If You Need Anything Else. There Food Is Delicious, Recommend The Chicken Pad Thai/ Chicken Fried Rice & Tom Yum Sea Food Soup Its Amazing. Overall Great Quality In Food
Excellent service! Food has great flavors. Portion sizes are good. The outside appearance is completely day and night.

This place has that old school Thai restaurant vibe. The servers were very nice and helpful. The food here was really good, I ordered your typical Tom yum Kung, red Penang curry, and curry fried rice. Everything was very good, full of flavor and  the spiciness didn't over power the other ingredients. The menu also has a good size Isaan section for you Laos people out there. I will definitely be back.

I've been going to or ordering from Weera for the past year. The service and the food have slowly, but surely gone down hill. I ordered squid salad that was obscenely rank and when I told the server she rolled her eyes and snatched the plate away without replacing it. We were still charged. I have ordered take out for both lunch and dinner a few times a month for the past 3 months. Every single time, and I do mean every single time, they leave something off my order. It's frustrating that Weera has become such a disappointment.
I think very good for thai people and if you visiting Las vegas u need go to try here

This is my go to spot when I come Vegas! However this time around I was very disappointed. We ordered 6 entree ( for two people, I know we are pigs lol). First off customer service was soooo bad. I asked for my coffee because my thai coffee had to much creamer. I literally had to ask 5 times. And when they finally brought it we were done eating and waiting on our check. Our table next to us was complaining on how long they have been waiting for a waitress to bring them there bill. At this time there is approximately 5 tables and 4 waitresses.

The tom yum chicken was really good! ANgel wings, Papaya salad, nam KAO, pork sausage and basil stir fry chicken was not all that great. Everything is sour and the basil stir fry is an authentic Thai dish and I would have thought that would have more flavors. 

It gets worse *sigh* as the waitress was bringing our meal she pours the rice all over me!!! And breaks the bowl right next to me. Could you imagine if it was my soup? I didn't get an apology however what I did get was "I didn't mean to do that". I had rice on the side of my hair, on my pants and on my shoes. At this moment after waiting for some time, I became very frustrated. 

Overall customer service is very poor. Food quality is OK. However decor is very nice. 

I'm hoping when I do go back and give them one last try it will be better.

I almost passed on Weera, ironically, because it was offering a Yelp Deal. I assumed any business promoting itself so enthusiastically can't be that great. But then I drove past and saw that it serves Issan food and I though hmm, got to check it out.

As a lone diner I had just two dishes, the Issan green papaya salad (on the Issan menu, not to be confused with the "regular" papaya salad; the difference is extra fish sauce and an additional level of heat) and the Ped Nom Tak (duck.)  I asked for 4 of 5 on the spiciness scale and the chile in the papaya had me acting like a rat in a lab experiment, shocking myself again and again because I was so desperate for another bite. It was also a great value at $6.95 and I finished every last sliver.

The duck was the opposite, thank god, unctuous fork size bits of breast in a mysterious brown gravy. There was mint and garlic and what looked like ground rice but must have been crack, it was that good. Again, this lone diner finished the whole thing. Both the salad and the duck had a stack of squares of cabbage leaf in the corner of the plate, I assumed to use as a serving implement, but I needed something to soak up the heat and sop up the duck gravy so I ordered the sticky rice, a nice accompaniment.

This is a simple but pleasantly decorated restaurant with tablecloths under glass like a hundred other mom-and-pop Asian places you have visited. The service was attentive and friendly (though they had some trouble with the Yelp coupon, so pay attention to the bill). I was lucky enough to talk to the owner afterward and told him how happy he had made me. He was interested that I was in town for CES and hoped to get some more show-goers down his way. Since this was the last night of this year's show, he will have to wait for another day. I thought about those folks waiting 2 hours for a table down the street at Lotus. Their loss.

UPDATE: Yelp contacted me asking me to specifically write about my experience with the Yelp deal. It was okay. I have the Yelp app on my Droid X and was able to access the deal there and show it to the server. She copied down the code number and asked me to mark the deal as "used" while she was watching which I did. Then the $20 discount initially did not show up on my tab and they had to rerun it which they did... simple miscommunication at the cash register. Bottom line, I think the Yelp deal worked fine and I'd happily use one again.

Okay I've been to Thailand,  cooked Thai food 
Professionally and eaten  since 1985... This place rocks. Great Tom ka gai,  and some of the more unique Thai dishes. Very much worth it.

Weera Thai is by far my most favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas.  The ambiance and decor is far from your standard Thai restaurant experience on Spring Mountain.  Sure, the prices are a little higher than others on Spring Mountain... but not by much.  Service here is on point.  We had two waitresses for our party of five and they did an incredible job of catering to our needs.  As for the food?  Money...
