Sea Bass, Crab Fried Rice, Larb Chicken, Thai Beef Salad, Pad Thai, etc.  We shared the dishes amongst our table and and I will confidently say that everything was delicious.  The portions are a generous size and the dishes appear to be prepared  very cleanly (healthy) with little oil, etc.  I'm a fan and will be back again.

This is my second time at Weera Thai. I came here because of Groupon, but that did not input my review. The food is bursting with flavor and has a true Thai heat to it. They do have promotions once in a while for free Tahi Tea refills. I has the Pad Prik King with chicken and shrimp. It's was an exceptional meal. Oh yes the fried chicken dumpling was exceptional. For being deep fried it had nearly no grease and was very light. The overall food portions were just right. 

It also help that they deliver to the Las Vegas Strip. I will be dining here more often as well as utilizing the deliver option.
They deliver, which rocks! We have tried 6 or 7 things on the menu and are always very happy with the quality of the food and great tastes!

We came in as a group and had dinner here. We ordered the pad thai, duck salad, fried rice, pad see ew, tom yum soup, fried ribs.

The pad thai was 4 stars. The noodle was perfectly cooked but lack of flavor.

The duck salad was very good but next time I'll ask for minus the ground rice seasoning which made it very gritty.

The fried rice was okay. I didn't taste any flavor to it other than plain rice that was fried up.

Pad see ew was delicious and not dry with plenty of flavor.

The tom yum soup was traditional tom yum flavor with lots of mushrooms and peppers only a few shrimps. 

The ribs were very tasty chopped into tiny bits. If only they were chopped bigger so that you can actually taste the meat verses a bunch of bones. There wasn't that many pieces of ribs on that tiny plate full of garnishes. 

Each plate varied apprx. $10+ dollars which didn't include rice.  They charge $1 per person for rice which adds up if you go with a large party.

I saw their special on Groupon, and since I love Thai food and have never been to this place, I bought the coupon.
We have a mixed review on the quality of food and service. First we order chicken potstickers. For $5 we got 8 pieces, I was impressed because none of the other Thai restaurants would give you that many potstickers in an order. It was a bit salty but tasted pretty good. For the main dish we ordered chicken teriyaki and chicken fried rice. The food came out really fast since they weren't really busy. They put a lot of rice on the plate. I was happy this far until I got a bite of the chicken teriyaki. First of all there's not much you can do to ruin a teriyaki dish. It wasn't the flavor of the sauce that made me upset, but the fact that the chicken taste like spoiled meat. I made a complain to the waitress about the weird taste of the chicken. And she said that it was just different style of that region. Helloooo, do you think I'm stupid. I know that different region cooks the same food different way hence the different flavors. But no, the sauce taste just like plain teriyaki sauce, and that's not what I tasted on the chicken. I'm Asian and I crave for  good Asian food all the time. I'm not picky but bad Asian food just turns me off. As far as my husband, he's a white guy but an extremely good cook and cook many asian dishes better than most. He took one bite and pushed the food away. He knew the meat was rancid and ate no more. So when the waitress came back he told her that the meat was bad, and she said ok thank you. 

So when I asked a different waitress to box my fried rice, I told her about the bad teriyaki chicken that we didn't touch, she told us she would check with the kitchen and the owner. After several minutes of waiting, we decided just to leave the cash on the table and don't even bother. As we were walking outside the restaurant, the first waitress came and asked us if we want thai tea to go for screwing up the order. My husband told her he's never coming back to the restaurant again, and her comment was ok thank you very much.  I told her I don't want any thai tea and how upset I was that she tried to convince me again about the different style. Come on! I could understand if maybe I didn't like the flavor, but Bad Meat is Bad Meat. Period. The fact that the owner keep defending the flavor of what I know is the weird taste of bad meat just pissed me off more than the food itself.

We eat out quite often. I give praise where it's due and complaints where it's due.

So will I ever come back here again? Absolutely not! There's so many good Thai restaurants in Vegas, and I wouldn't even consider this place as one of them.

Enjoyed the food and atmosphere. Had the chicken larb, chow mein, fresh shrimp spring rolls, and spicy fried rice. All of the dishes were very tasty, not overly sauced, and fresh. Would definitely recommend trying them out. When in the parking lot keep your eyes open otherwise you'll pass their store front!

Yesterday, we went to this Thai restaurant which the location was not that great but the food was delicious.  We started out with Tod Mun Pla (Thai Fish Cake) and it was very good and not hard like other Thai Restaurant. We also had the Larb Duck which the flavor was awesome. Then we proceed with the Kana Moo Krob (Crispy Pork Belly with Chinese Broccoli) and Tom Sab which is like the Isarn soup with a little spice and tangy flavor both of it was very flavorful.  If you are out of town try this little joint and you won't be disappointed.

My wife and I come here about twice a month and always enjoy it.  The staff is always smiling and friendly.  The food is very good, especially the Tom yum soup!!! The fresh spring rolls are a great appetizer!!

We typically stay within the strip area when we visit Las Vegas. This time we decided to expand our horizon and see and experience other parts of Vegas. After reading so many positive reviews, we decided to try Weera Thai one day. 

Food at this place is better than any Thai restaurants that I have ever tried. Mind you, living in LA and being an avid fan of Thai food, I have dined at a substantial number of Thai restaurants. 

We went there for lunch and the restaurant was pretty busy. There were two female servers and they both were very nice and friendly. We typically don't see such friendly and attentive service in LA area. The lunch specials are simply great deals with salad, soup and entrée - all with very good quantity. 

The food and service was so good that we ended up going there the second day as well. Anytime we visit Vegas again, we will come here to dine.

I love Weera.. my go-to thai place when I'm at work. The restaurant has been recently remodeled, really nice inside. Bigger space, too. I like that they have Isaan food, they have tons of stuff you can't get at other thai places. Place is always busy now during lunch time, be prepared for a long wait.

The food here is really delicious, pretty pricey but the portions are big enough to feed 2-3 people. BBQ Beef there is really good, how they cook it varies, I had a few slices that were medium rare and well done, but still very good.

When I think Thai food.. I say Weera Thai! This one of my favorite places to dine in with family and friends. The selections of appetizers, soups, noodles and the main entrees make it difficult to decide :)
Papaya salad with shrimp had the perfect crunch paired with a dressing that has a nice blend of sweetness and acidity. The Tom Kah Kung coconut soup with shrimp and mushroom is a family favorite. The broth is so flavorful with fresh lemon grass, cilantro and kaffir leaves surely revive my senses! The pad see ewe with beef never disappoint. The sauce is not to sweet or salty. It always has a good portion of meat, noodles and Chinese broccoli.
The Happy Hour menu is another added bonus! The service is outstanding and always open to accommodation. Take advantage and call ahead since this place can get super busy! This place is overdue. You've earned my 5 stars!

Looking at Weera Thai Restaurant from the outside you'd probably think it was a little divey but it's not. The interior is comfortable, clean and not shabby at all. We ordered the Panang and Massuman curries and they were quite tasty and seemed a bit creamier than usual. The portions are huge and two people could share one curry and be full afterwards. A nice little Thai place just a couple miles off the strip.

Food was very good. Started with hot tea (they charged us $3 but we didn't mind since everything was so reasonable) and crab rangoon. Was my hubby's first time trying it, he's skeptical of seafood, but he loved it. Says it is his all-time favorite appetizer now. I ordered the Panang beef and it was yummy. Ordered it 5 out of 5 and it came out spicy though, honestly, I expected it to be a little spicier. Still good with fresh ingredients and nicely cut beef. Hubby got pork pad thai and it was also really good. Noodles were a good texture, sauce was perfect, veggies were crisp and pork was tender. We'll be back. If only they delivered further than 1 mile!
we love the Thai food at Weera, can't wait to come back! the fried papaya salad is a gem, so is the happy hour. all the sauces and flavors are top notch. we are regulars now

Stopped by because a friend recommending it, I had the sweet and sour chicken and shared some soup a friend. Both were very good, the service was fast and the Tom ka gai was amazing. Looking forward to going back and trying the curry!

We're from out of town and had no idea where to go. So we did like a lot of out-of-towners do and looked on Yelp. The food here is very good the restaurant very clean and the staff is very friendly. We ordered pad thai for lunch that came with a bowl of soup and a nice fresh salad all very good

Weera Thai is a solid restaurant. Fully packed around lunch time, has some good food.

- Lunch combo
- Yellow curry
- Crispy chicken

And finally, received a check-in bonus vanilla ice cream as a dessert. Pretty good.

Best Thai food in Vegas, we always come and get the same thing. Not too adventurous, but it's not a bad thing, everything we get has so much flavor and just perfect. For an appetizer we get the Tom Kah Kai soup with chicken (a medium heat). For the main entrees we do the pineapple fried rice is absolutely spectacular, my favorite thing here personally) also one of the best Panang curries in Vegas for sure. Then on to the pad Thai also just as amazing. We usually go with my entire family which is a party of 6, and if you order full entrees and feeds all of us. Staff is super friendly, just a nice place to eat for either lunch or dinner.

5 stars for the service! Super friendly. Ive heard about this place for awhile and decided to give it a try today, we got curry puff, beef jerky, crab rangoon, sticky rice, wonton soup, mongolian beef and crispy duck panang curry. I have to say I'm not a fan of the food unfortunately. Just my taste? The crispy duck is the only thing that I loved.

Seabass and pad thai with grass noodle are the best
This is my second visit. I will definitely visit again if i go to vegas.
I got good deal on yelp which was $20 for $10
Server was friendly

So many great dishes here (especially Issan delicacies). Hidden Vegas gem: Laos-style som tom/papaya salad (with delicious pungent preserved crab), but get it on the Laos platter... pickled cabbage, pork nem sausage, pork jerky, rice noodles, crispy pork skin chicharron, bean sprouts, bamboo and pork loaf.
Omg this is crazy good!!!!!!!! Nice portions and so on point. This just isn't right  I think I may have died

This place deserves six stars. Excellent portions, prices, and food variety. The staff is friendly and very attentive. The outside of the store is completely different in comparison to the inside. I stepped inside and was immediately impressed. Also, they have five star rewards which is a total plus! Definitely coming back for more :)

I am usually not a big Thai food gal.
I will say it: I take Vietnamese over Thai any day of the week. Not even looking back, asking questions or wondering what I missed.
Because in my experience - I never really missed much.

Don't get me wrong; I enjoy pads, tom kah kai, curries and papaya salad once in a while, and really, nothing is wrong with them. They are even quite good, most of the time. But what makes me really sad is that I KNOW that they are only the tip of the iceberg, and that there are many, many other treasures to be found. Well, eaten. But most places don't bother, or choose to "hide" these culinary pearls in secret menus that I am too scared to request upon ordering after being told once that they don't exist.

Bummer.

Now you can lure me in anyway. And Weera Thai did just that, with the promise of Issan food. Northern Thai Issan cuisine is more sour and spicy than Central Thai food and is cooked in hot chili peppers, rice powder, served with sticky rice. The result? My nom tok which was thinly sliced grilled beef with rice powder, spices, lime juice and chili. Just to die for, and accompanied by the best tamarind-based sauce ever. There are a whole variety of similar dishes using beef, pork, duck and fish.

Not in the mood for Issan?
What about crispy pilot fish stir fried with Thai holy basil? Or ground pork stir fried with Thai holy basil & preserved duck egg? Or squid sauteed in a garlic, cilantro and pepper sauce?

And for the least adventurous, Weeara does classics as well, and perfectly so. The simple spring rolls and the crab sticks we ordered were by far the best I have ever had. Fresh and vibrant - they redefined what they could be in the best of worlds. Wide rice noodles had just the right bite, and the green curry of my friend was outstanding.

Skip Lotus of Siam, and come here. To top it all, service is absolutely darling!

This is a must to try. The food is absolutely Scrumptious.  We had been going to another place which I wont name but now we will only come here.
The Panang Crisy Chicken was incredible. Simply an Authentic Place. So glad we were told about this place.
Just Amazing Flavors all put together Perfectly.
Great food at a reasonable price. Will definitely return to this place on my next trip.

My mum and I came here with a Living Social coupon.  Our experience probably would have been better if I didn't have such high expectations, but it was still pretty good.  
The crab sticks ($8) we ordered didn't taste all that crabby.  The texture didn't resemble crab at all, and they had a pretty fishy flavor.  I would not order them again.
Beef Pad See Ew ($9)  was pretty standard.  I forgot to ask them to make it without sugar (most Thai places go overboard), and was pleasantly surprised when it came out just the right amount of sweet.  
What I really wanted to try here was the steamed sea bass, and that was actually better than I expected.  They have 3 varieties ($16 each).  1. Rice powder/chili/lime 2. Spicy sauce 3. Ginger.  The server recommended the spicy sauce one, so we went for it.  It came out in a soup bowl.  There was a very generous amount of broth, veggies, and the bass fillet on top.  The fish was super juicy, and flaky.  The broth was really tart, and delicious.  Perfect over rice.  
There was a lot of confusion when the check came.  That was a little annoying, especially since the restaurant was nearly empty.  The girl that brought the check forgot that we had a coupon, as did the girl we initially gave it to.  They reprinted it, but the amount was still wrong.  They reprinted it again, and we were finally able to pay.  
A-ok just about sums up the experience in general, but I will be back for more sea bass.

If you're in the mood for authentic Thai food, this is the place to go. Even though we had a large party, they were very accommodating. We had the catfish salad, the vegetable hot pot soup, the Thai pumpkin and tofu curry, the pineapple fried rice, and the duck pad Thai. Everything was so flavorful and delicious! I also recommend trying the Palms Drink Coconut Nectar. 

The restaurant is small and cozy and the staff super friendly.  Easy 5 stars from me.

The best and most original Thai food in Vegas. Seriously! I love Thai food when it is authentic - which means full of flavor - and Weera is the real thing.

We ordered Kao Soy, Kaprow Mookob, and an appetizer of spicy chicken wings. Also had Som Tum, a salad.

The Kao Soy is a Northern Thai soup with thin noodles, and when done well, is a spicy warm delight.

Weera is about a 10 minute drive North of Aria.

Next time we are in Vegas, we will return! I highly recommend.

This place is by far the best Thai restaurant I've ever been in the States! And I'm the kind of person who always makes it a priority to visit at least one Thai restaurant every time I visit any city. If you are looking for authentic Thai food, you will not be disappointed. The place is very clean and well appointed with a  relaxed ambience. The owner and his staff are very friendly. That's always a great quality for the Thai restaurant. Even though this place is not in downtown but with only 10 mins cab ride, you will be at one of the best Thai restaurant in the country! Try Larb Duck and Tom Yum Pork spare ribs. They are just the best.

If it wasn't 7 am right now, I'd be writing this from at table in the dining room here.

Don't even remember what I had, only that it was really good!
best effen thai i've had in vegas!!! pad thai, curry, fried rice, thai ice tea all amazing!!!

My coworkers picked Werra Thai for lunch.  I had yellow curry with beef off the lunch menu and had a water to drink.  I think it was $8.95 plus tax.  Great meal for a reasonable price.  There were four of us.  Each dish came out as it was ready instead of waiting to serve everyone at the same time.  A little awkward for some to people to eat while other wait, but not really a big deal.  It came with salad, soup, egg roll, rice, and the curry.  I really enjoyed it.  Very flavorful.  My coworkers complained that it was too spicy.  They ordered zero or one on a zero to ten scale.  Perhaps a one to a Thai person is an eight to an American.  he he he.  I recommend Weera Thai.

Yo soy clienta de weera thai desde hace 2 años es mi lugar thailandes favorito.me encanta la comida siempre caliente y con el mejor savor q he provado me encanta la tom yum soup chickenchicken phad thai and egg rolls riquisimos !!el mejor lunch menu de cualquier restaurant thailandes acompañado con un plato de ensalada y un plato de sopa yumiyummi!!!he conocido muchos aqui en las vegas.se los recomiendo.

Delicious Thai Tea and free refills really put a smile on my face while eating here but sadly that was the highlight of the meal. I ordered the Pad Thai and much to my surprise it was bland. I've had better at Pei Wei to be honest. I also had some orange chicken and it seemed to taste like a jello packet mixed with warm water drizzled over some chicken that was severely over fried. No heat from either of the dishes and what seemed to me at least to be very small portions. Based off how other people feel about this place I have to assume their real chef took a day off and some waiter was the one cooking. 

Thai Tea was truly amazing, the food was not.

Came in on 7:30 on a Saturday night to a nearly empty place, was briefly worried. The very pleasant waitress made me feel like I was back in Thailand, and brought me a Singha beer. The green curry was VERY GOOD and VERY BIG with a mountain of eggplant! This is easily the biggest $9 curry I have ever had, and also one of the best. Any future trips to Vegas will include a trip to Weera Thai!

The service was nice, the food was mediocre, and the Thai tea... TERRIBLE. I love Thai tea and I base my reviews on Thai restaurants around them. I was expecting a great deal from this place considering the reviews said "Great Authentic Thai food!' I think the reviews led me to expect too much.

This thai place blew me away. The food was so delicious. 

We ordered for starter, the glass noodle salad with shrimp, which was the BOMB!! So citrusy and refreshing with two large juicy shrimp, ground meat and red onion was on point and a great combination. My new favorite thai salad from now on. 

The next starter we ordered was the bbq chicken with chili sauce. This was ok and tasty. We won't order this next time. 

For our entrees, of course you can't eat Thai without ordering Tom Yum soup,  we ordered with shrimp only. By god, the shrimp in this soup are ginormous! I think there were 9 or 10 total. Each shrimp was like 3 mouthfuls. I have never went to a thai place that served shrimp this large anywhere! They were plump and juicy. The soup was level 3, it was super sour and spicy, just the way its supposed to be...I'm drooling again just thinking about it.

We ordered the red curry with tofu. This was mouthwatering. I absolutely loved the wide slices of bamboo and basil leaves, soo good. The tofu was plentiful and large as well. The curry was the perfect sweetness and the right amount of spice (level 2). Other places I've been to, were overly sweet with coconut, and was downright sickening sometimes. But they got it just right to balance with the other spicy foods we had.

And last of all, we ordered the sliced beef salad. Compared to the glass noodle salad, this was just not as good in terms of citrus. It was a bit spicy because we ordered level 3. It kind of reminded me of Vietnamese banh mi pickled veggies. So we won't order this next time.

But I have to say overall, this experience was top notch. Believe it or not, this was all for only two people for around 50 bucks. Thats not bad for 5 dishes. Given, that the starters were 6 bucks each, a really good deal. Back in LA its 50 bucks for 3 dishes, and you don't get nearly as much food. We will definitely come here again for our Thai cravings :D

Been here several times but today we decided to celebrate my son's birthday here! Absolutely AMAZING! Really nice people and their food...DELICIOUS! The price is fair and food presentation is always wonderful.

People gave this place great reviews but I just don't see it? Came in during happy hour which had plenty of choices for cheap like the Papaya salad for $6. Not bad at all. Our orders were just the usual orders so we weren't blown away. Everything was good except the Pad Thai noodle seemed to be over cooked ? The texture of the noodle was like melting already in your mouth, meaning it wasnt thick. Gladly the Crab fried rice wasn't bad, I enjoyed that entree. 

The dining area is very clean and the bathrooms as well so that's a good sign. Lastly the service needs some work. The guy server was doing a great job, but the ladies weren't. I shouldn't have to say "Thank you" while leaving the restaurant when you are staring at us, and not say it back.

I only gave this place 1 stars because the staff is so friendly. However my husband and and I ordered 2 orders of Basil chicken and the chicken was tough, the sauce was extremely liquidy, and it didn't come with much meat. We wish we would have stuck with our Thai place Thai St Cafe which has fresh delicious food and you get a great amount. Sad to say we won't be back here.

We have had delivery from here oh like 15 times now over the last 2 months since we moved in the neighborhood.  We LOVE it!!! Every meal has been amazing.  Couple tips - stir fried clams amazing!!!  Seafood sauce is a great hot sauce on the side with amazing flavor.  Super solid food.  Today I stopped in for a takeout order and saw the restaurant in person for the first time..cute!  Never would guess it was stylish from the outside.

My wife and I went for lunch and we received terrible service. Her order came out 20 minutes before mine. I ordered the catfish with lemongrass and vegetables and it was simply not edible. It was awful. I asked for it to be a 2 out of 5 on the 'spicy scale", and after about three bites I couldn't eat any more it was so hot. The lemongrass tasted old and gave the whole dish a chemical taste. I would have sent it back, but we had been there for almost an hour and the two tattoo guys who were swearing in the table next to my 5 year old. Overall, it was just a bad experience with bad service and bad food.
Spicy Thai basil dish is good. I like the sauce a lot. Eggplant is good too.

We must've ordered the wrong things off the menu because the food isn't as great as everyone said. The Massaman curry was very liquidy and doesn't have half the flavor as the authentic curry I've had. But I do have to say their service is nice and quick.

I probably won't be coming back for the food considering the flood of Thai restaurants in Vegas.

Great little hidden spot for some great authentic Thai food. Good lunch special for I believe 7.95 or 8.95... I get the red curry chicken ( really good and a nice big portion). Located in a strip mall - this place is lean and nice inside with good service!!

I'm Thai.  I was born in Thailand, I grew up on Thai food, and I cook Thai food myself.  When it comes to Thai restaurants, I am extremely critical of the food and I hate it when Thai food is Americanized. Well, I can tell you that this place is authentic. The food is absolutely delicious...better than a lot of places I've eaten in Thailand! I travel all over the US and the world for work...and this little gem is the only Thai restaurant that has driven me to write a review.  

Even the service was good (not usual for an Oriental restaurants).

Don't miss an opportunity to visit if you like truly authentic Thai food.  Recommended items that I liked:  Laab ped (duck), ka pow moo krob, tom saab pork, ba mee hang, pad see ew, spicy clam with basil, and papaya salad (som tum). Yes, if I stayed in Vegas more than 3 days, I probably would've listed the whole menu :) oh, and my husband thought the mango and sticky rice was the best he's ever had outside of Thailand.

I came across a few awesome reviews of Weera Thai as well as read John Curtas  Eating Las Vegas's review in LV Weekly. Lots of stars and praise meant Weera Thai was a must try. 

The service was impeccable! Our server was very kind and quite attentive. Good service is hard to come by in Asian restaurants.

The food however, I was a bit under enthused over. Perhaps we didn't order the "right" things on the menu? I normally can't pass up my favorite Pad Prik King, but I chose the Spicy Beef Holy Basil dish--good but not satisfying. A first-time Thai food newb, my friend ordered the Chicken Pad Thai which of course was delicious--a fool-proof dish. At our table, we also had Yellow Curry & a COLD beef salad which had a lot of flavor-similarities to Papaya Salad. The Yellow Curry was good but tasted almost like packaged Korean curry mix. And the cold beef salad had a dash too much of fish sauce.

Wasn't bad food, just not as good as I was expecting. I'll stick with my usual Thai place. But I may give Weera Thai another try in the future.

POSITIVES: Coconut Water (straight out of a real coconut)--you can scrape the meat out to eat when you're done!

Great waitresses. They always check in on you, always smiling, have good recommendation. 
Food= tasty.
Affordable. 
Clean restaurant. 
Try their Palms coconut nectar!

A great Thai place!
Good service and friendly staff helped make dinner pleasant. 

Food was on point, spiced right (for us anyway) and it all came out fairly quick. 

Pad Woon Sen with combo meat was a hit for me...
Garlic chicken was flavorful
Pad Thai with combo meat was delicious as well. 
We started off with the chicken potstickers...good presentation, tasted good, standard dish...

A definite option to consider in my future visits to Vegas
very good thai style dishes - excellent customer service and a very good Yelp deal =] strongly recommended

My wife and I are visiting from Khon Kaen, Thailand.  Everywhere she goes, she HAS to find Thai food!  We THOROUGHLY enjoyed the food and atmosphere of Weera.  VERY authentic and presented rather nicely.  The menu is HUGE and includes specialties from the Issan region of Thailand.  The lunch special is priced nicely as well.  So, stop reading this, and get on down to Weera.  You won't be disappointed!

the worse customer service ever , they're my neighbor and i order almost everyday and they never give me  a complimentary or free stuff , they have lunch special everyday from 11 am to 4 pm i called 5 times before 4 pm they didn't  answer the phone until the special is over and when they answered and i told them the situation they said nothing they can do,  as always , never go to that place anymore  my message to them is that customers always right so u can have successful business .

We came for lunch today and ordered from the Lunch Specials menu.  They had 9 entrees to choose from which included Tom Yum soup, salad, and fried egg roll.  The Thai Tea was only $1 at lunch.  They were located in a small strip mall on W Sahara Ave/S Valley View Blvd in Las Vegas. 

The Tom Yum soup and the salad came out at the same time.  The soup was warm and was served in a tea cup.  The salad was of good size and had a ginger dressing.

I ordered the Pepper Garlic Sauce Shrimp Thai Hot.  It came out at least 10 minutes before my friend's entree.  Awkward.  There were 6 shrimp with the tails on with carrots, mushrooms, green bell peppers, scallions.  There was no spice at all.  I had  to ask for a spicy tray.  The vegetarian egg roll was bland.  The amount of sauce with it was sparse and watery.

My friend ordered the Yellow Chicken Curry.  She ordered it mild and wished she had ordered it medium.  She took half of it home.  The server boxed the leftovers.  

I wish I had ordered one of the curries, because it looked good.  I really enjoyed my Spicy Shrimp Salad that I ordered last time.  It had the appropriate amount of heat. I would not order the Pepper Garlic Sauce Shrimp again.

I will give them another try.

Great food and very friendly people! One of our fave Thai restaurants here in Vegas along with Lotus (cheaper prices here though!)

Get their coconut shrimp salad!!! It's very spicy so ask about that before you order. Their panang curry is delicious too! 

Not too busy on a Friday night... It was perfect! I noticed they get a lot of takeout orders so I'm sure they deliver.

Yay for authentic thai food in Vegas!

My cousins were visiting from Thailand and we decided to go off the strip to find dinner that would make my cousins feel right at home. And we found it! I thought the prices were quite reasonable for a thai food place, especially in Vegas but of course my mom and cousins thought it was a bit expensive because they're use to good cheap thai food. Sorry guys. We ordered soup to share which was really good but my cousin said a little bit spicy and it wasn't spicy at all, cream cheese wontons, chicken wings with sauce on the side, and other stuff I can't quite remember but everything was really good and had a great taste to it. 

My favorite was the mussel cake or hoi todd which I thought was cooked perfectly. Not too crispy, not gooey at all, perfect texture, perfect sauce. I really enjoyed it and felt like it really hit close to home. 

Overall I would definitely suggest Weera Thai if I'm back in Vegas and my friends are craving authentic thai food.

We went here because of a Living Social and man was it worth it!  We ordered two wonderful soups, Tom Kha Gai and another soup with shrimp in it.  Delicious.  The papaya salad was beautiful, but my favorite was the Pineapple Fried Rice, a must try.  We also had a seafood dish with various seafood, salmon, shrimp, mussels in a wonderful broth.  We will be back and we are fans!  The waitresses were very sweet and extremely polite which isn't a regular thing in LV.  Namaste Weera Thai!

I found an online deal for this place the last time my husband and I were in Vegas and thought that it would be fun to give it a try( we find that the restaurants on the strip are over rated) 

This place was just hat we needed! It was empty when we arrived, but everything came out of the kitchen fresh and favorful. The staff was also very accommodating(my husband and I are vegetarian...so they were great about not including any fish sauce, etc. in the curries that we ordered.)

My husband had the red curry with tofu, which was yummy and I had the spicy eggplant with tofu. Both dishes were piping hot and served with rather large portions. We asked for both to be medium spicy and the spice was just right. The red curry had great cocounut flavor(wasn't overpowered by the coconut milk). Both dishes were served with rice. We had little doggy bags to take home because we coudn't eat anymore!

I'm glad I found this place and it definitely satisfied our Thai craving.

perfect thai restaurant in las vegas. if u missed thai food, u should go try it. u will not regret. friendly. good food. reasonable price. except one thing. thai tea is not refillable.  means they charge every order. if a lady asks u, "more tea?" u know what you have to do.

Was delicious food!

We ordered shrimp Tom yum soup, chef's choice: soft shell crab w panang curry, and beef pad seew. Yum yum yum. 

I would go there again.

Awesome food and great quantity with excellent flavors..

Problem is its in a dingy stripy mall. seating is limited. Service was okay. But food was excellent..

Will definitely visit again for the excellent food.
Yum! Delicious and extremely reasonable prices, great service. I would recommend the pad thai and the spicy basil chicken, very flavorful!

Great lunch specials hat include a drink for 8 dollars! Their shrimp spring rolls are  delicious but the peanut sauce is a little bit sweeter than I prefer.  Small dining area that recently expanded to accommodate more guests.  Fairly fast service.  It's a very popular place for my coworkers.  The lunch special comes with soup and includes your drink I believe.
My wife and I will be here at least once a week. It was amazing.    Great service as well.

What an amazing gem in a multi decade old strip mall. Weera Thai's service, food quality, and ambiance is spot on! Our family ordered a few Happy Hour items like the delicious chicken wings complimented with a Thai sweet chili sauce-DIVINE!! The Glass noodle salad was perfectly flavored. The wok heat infused fried rice was amazing---everyone competed for the last grain. The Red Curry was creamy and smooth. Prices are unbeatable for the authentic flavored!!
I'm from Thailand, and I can say that "Weera Thai Restaurant" is one of the best and most authentic Thai restaurants in the US!! Believe me! My Thai friends and family love this restaurant too.

The food here is great! Almost everything I order here I enjoyed very much. From the sausage, larb fish, beef broccoli(ka na moo gob)larb beef and tom yum. But the service here is average.. We use to love coming here with the family cause the gentleman that owns this place is very nice. He would alwayse ask us about the food, if we enjoyed it or not. But the wife on the other hand would never smile at us alwayse seems like she did not appreciate our business, maybe because we were thai lolz and probably think we don't tip well "WRONG". . Anywayse,if you like good food , veera thai is a good choice.

GREAT place for a little get together or so large portion Thai food. The steam clams are to die for and they give you ALOT! Parking is easy to find and they take credit cards. Average food wait is 8 minutes. Clean and remodeled.

Great food but better if you eat in.  The portions can be a little smaller when you order to-go.  I would have given them a 5-star but my husband ordered a full fish and asked for it be wrapped up.  It was a $40 item and did not get included in the doggy bags.  Service is generally great and very friendly.

Oh My!! talk about delicious food. For Thai food this place is the best i come here every time I'm in the mood for Thai. The service is great as well. If you go you must try there mango sticky rice for dessert. I highly recommend it to anyone. The best.
Great authentic thai food and exceptional service!

Omg! Spicy beef salad is the Bomb! 
First time for delivery, took an hour on Saturday night, but worth the wait! Delivery man was super nice and polite
Now I'm going to try the duck curry and finish up my review in a bit! 
Delicious!!!!

I really, really enjoyed this place.

Having been to another small Thai restaurant just a minute down the street (also delightful) I wanted to give this place a try, so I met up with a good friend of mine and we tried a few dishes family style.

Great crab fried rice, everything else was also delicious. Our server tolerated my rusty Thai speaking abilities, and in we had some left-overs which were still delicious the next day (Thai food does tend to stand up in the 'fridge).

Definitely up at the top of the list of Thai places in this area, and I always like small business, family-owned, traditional... great place, definitely check it out.

Oh goodness this Thai restaurant was unexpected! Don't let the outside fool you! The inside is nicely decorated and this place has a great ambiance. We were greeted and seated. There were a lot of choices and we went during lunch so they had their lunch specials. Ordered the Panang Curry and it was sooooooo yummy!!! The wait time for the food was a little overdue but food was really great. My boyfriend got their green curry too and rated the spiciness level as Thai spicy. We also got their mangoes with sticky rice and it was fresh. If I'm coming to Vegas again I'll visit here!

Love this place! The coconut milk soup us THE BOMB! It'll bring you back from death! And the green curry to die for. Excellent taste, very intense and fragrant and although the space is small, it's still not crowded and rather comfortable. 

I wish the waiters spoke a little more clear, but I guess that's what makes this place truly Thai!

Yelp convinced me to try it.  Just as good as the Noodle House and more decorated.  Pad See Ew noodles were best entree we had.  Not all thai restaurants have green papaya salad so this suggests more authentic cuisine...the papaya salad was good too.  Ultimate test though was that both of my kids liked the food!

After two nights in Vegas, we were at the point where stepping out of our hotel room seemed like a chore and I was craving something other than buffet food. Luckily Weera Thai delivered, both literally and figuratively. Granted, there is a 5 dollar surcharge for the service, but at least we didn't need to step into the cold. The food was reasonable priced and plentiful. The chicken green curry came in one of those quart sized containers and was the perfect balance of coconut milk and spice. We also got a salmon red curry which was less successful but still delicious. The salmon was slightly overcooked and the portion was not as plentiful at the green curry. All in all, it was a welcome respite from the crab legs.

If you like fllavorless food and bland Thai food, Weera is your restaurant. We ordered fried rice, sliced duck, chicken satay, and drunken noodles. Not one of these dishes was tasty or appealing. I would have appreciated salty, spicy, or anything to hit my tastebuds but there was simply NO FLAVOR in the food. Don't waste your money at Weera Thai, there are a dozen better Thai restaraunts in Las Vegas, Weera is at the bottom of the list.
I absolutely love this place!!! When I'm in the mood for inexpensive Thai food this is where I go!!

Ordered delivery from Weera on a Monday night. Our food came within an hour and was delicious. Large portions and fantastic flavors! I would definitely order from here again. Also, so happy they deliver to the Vdara. If you stay here, your dining options are slightly limited unless you're willing to walk pretty far. It was nice to try something new and be able to easily pick it up right outside the lobby of the hotel.

It is a nice ,clean place unfortunately located between 2 massage businesses. Its street location is not the best either. HOWEVER, the food was good. So was the service. To compare, I would say that it is as good as the CURRENT Lotus of Siam but not as good as the Lotus before its expansion and opening in NYC. The service is definitely BETTER than Lotus of Siam. We had the crispy shrimps and spring rolls for appetizers and would give a 4.5 to the spring rolls but a 4 to the shrimps. The seabass with garlic sauce was just right. The pangnan beef was good. So was the groundpork basil stirfry. It is a good solid 4+ Thai restaurant that appears to need a little help to stay around because of factors other that food and service. Best of luck. I definitely would return.

Great authentic Thai food. Highly recommended by a thai friend. 
Tom kak kai (coconut milk chicken soup) was delicious. Will definitely be a regular.

As to me, this is the best Thai restaurant in Vegas.

I like the rainbow fried rice and pineapple fried rice the most~!!!! 

Also the mango with sweet rice as a dessert~~~Perfect~!!!!

My wife and I love to try  new Thai restuarant anywhere we travel. We had the $20 for $10 deal from yelp so we thought we give it a try. It was a Monday night and we were the only one there.  Sometime it is a good thing if you are in a hurry. We usually compare all thai places by the way they make papaya salad. and it was delicious.  We had the crab stick appetizer and it also was really good.  Everything we had was delicious. Service was great and we recommend this to all Thai food lover.  I know with  all the buffets and different places to choose from in Vegas, it may be difficult to try this place out, but if you can find the time, try this place out, you won't be disappointed.
The roast duck pad thai is amazing. Start with the pork jerky appetizer, and try the roast duck with a small side of extra peanut sauce.

My wife and I come here all the time.  We sit in our booth against the way.  We know the owners when the place was still called royal thai.  Greatest locals restaurant and down right good food.  We're there usually once if not twice a week.  Good price, good food, and most importantly, good customer service.

I thought I would never find a place where I can get $1 Thai tea.

Location/Decoration/Atmosphere: Came here for lunch with a couple of friends. I was in awed at the place. The restaurant itself is located in a very shady looking plaza but in the interior of the restaurant is very beautiful!

Menu: wide selection! you can definitely find your go-to Thai dishes as well as the specialty items. My sole purpose of coming here was to get the Laos style papaya salad with blue crap. I wasn't disappointed!

Overall, I am planning on coming back. The server was kind enough to give me a rewards card (stamp card basically). I've never seen a Thai restaurant utilizing this!
I love thai food and Weera Thai is about as good as it gets in Las Vegas.  I always come here for at least one dinner. Phase Thai is my favorite. I even walked over a mile to get here.
Food is so so, order super spicy. It's the weakest I've eaten in my life, as if they did not add any chile to it at all.

Thank you Yelp for helping me find this gem! I was browsing through Yelp and they had a deal $10 for $20. The reviews were good, so I bought the deal. I am glad I did. I have been to Thailand and love Thai food. This place had Kana (Chinese broccoli), it wasn't listed as a side, but I requested a plate of it and they delivered. It was good. 
The best part of the meal was the Tom Yum Kai. It was like what I had when visiting Thailand. The lemongrass really shined in this soup. I loved it.
This establishment offers Issan style food, which is a great benefit and sometimes hard to find. Duck is all over the menu, which is a bonus as well. 
Everything we had was delicious and we will definitely be back.

A friend and i were in Vegas for a quick trip and looking for a place that would either deliver to the hotel or had a free shuttle to the restaurant. 

We found this place on a Las Vegas restaurant site; called and asked for the shuttle and the guy came right on time.
We got to the restaurant and noticed they had some regional Thai specialties so we ordered some, got the yelp deal on a smart  phone while waiting and enjoyed the great meal. 

Yelp deal was used easily, no hassles, then we asked for the shuttle to take us back to the hotel. Imagine my mortification when we were told the "shuttle driver" would be with us shortly because he was also the chef!!! He came out, told us not to worry about it and give him a couple minutes and then got us back to our hotel in no time after a short wait!

4 stars for the food
5 stars for the service!

WOW!!! We just happened to have stumbled on this place one day after receiving a flyer in the mail. What an amazing surprise!!  I am so addicted to their curry, the taste of everything we had tried is so authentic and yummy!!! It is now one of our favorite places to go!!  They have Happy Hour specials that are amazing!!!  They also offer Take-Out!!  and Delivery!!!!!
Service sucks plus they charge you for easy ice! Wtf?????? They took forever with the food and the check. Food it's just ok

I'm so happy to discover this place! I order green curry and it was the best green curry I ever try! And I've been in many Thai places all over the states cause it's my favorite cuisine. Very clean, beautiful place and friendly service. I wish they had a brown rice.

The best Thai Food in Las Vegas. Well, that's just my opinion, but I've eaten a lot of Thai Food. 
The Duck Spring Roll was unbelievably good. Huge portions and so fresh. My Pad See Ew was perfect. Noodles were really soft and the flavors were spot on. Sticky Rice with mango excellent as well. 
They also have a happy hour starting at 6 pm which I would also recommend checking out. There is a huge difference in quality of the Thai food restaurant to restaurant here in Las Vegas and I would put this place as the Golden Standard.

This is a less known thai place in Vegas. It is about 15 minute drive from the strip. 

The food was awesome. Just what you expect at a thai restaurant. The service was quick. I called them and reserved  a table in advance; hence the wait time was minimal. Even otherwise, there was no much crowd here (visited this place on a saturday night).

The next time I am in Vegas, I am sure I will visit this place again. 

I tried Spicy chicken fried rice and veggie fried rice. Both were excellent.

Not fancy just plain good. I felt that this is one of the better Green Curry dishes out in the land of Thai food. Appreciated the mix of red and green peppers in the sauce as well as eggplant. It was a nice change from a massive amount of green beans. 

There is a discount for patrons if you go on FB and like their page. 

Service was excellent. The restaurant was empty but it was close to closing time also.

The mango salad is delicious and fresh.the chicken larb is very flavorful and has alot of texture to it. I love their thai tea and the crab sticks are the best I have ever had. They are crunchy on the outside with a delicious flavor of crab inside. The plum sauce if fresh and compliments them well.

We came to eat here many times . And i finally have time to rate 5 star for one of my favorite thai place . We love all of their menu even appetizer, entree , desert and the chef's recommend. Their food are delicious . Service is great .

I'm a fan. Lunch specials every day -- that includes weekends -- are from 11am - 3pm. Each item includes soup, egg roll, salad, and rice. And they don't skimp on portion size. Chance are you'll leave satisfied. The yellow curry was awesome, although could have had a little more chicken. Pad Thai and the cashew nut chicken were excellent too. Service was friendly and quick and prices are inexpensive.

Still a solid choice.  Came here after seeing The Book of Mormon for a late lunch, dined on their larb again, chicken panang and some other items.  All was excellent, except the BBQ pork was on the fatty side.  Servers here are always super friendly.

I'm totally in love w/ Weera Thai, 2yrs ago my department decided to try something new for lunch. So we ordered from Were a Thai for the 1st time: GREAT lunch special, a entree, salad, egg roll AND soup. Yessssssss, all for $8.50 I was hooked. 

To us born Americans Thai for is well known for PAD THAI and Weera Thai does not disappoint. Noodles are aldente, veggies are crisp, meat juicy and tender and peanuts on top CRUNCHY. We eat w/ our eyes right? The plate is very colorful, it's so fresh looking, steam rising from your pile of noodles, I wanted t dive in head first. Be careful when you order HEAT aka "SpicYness", I'm all about spicy food and then I met my match. I asked for a level of 5, thinking that it was going to be some type of mediocre heat, baaaaaaaaby I couldn't finished my food was so hot. My eyes got watery, nose started dripping and I started sweating. BUT I couldn't stop eating it was so good. 

If you find yourself on Sahara/Valley View try out Weera Thai, if you are in fear of paying full price for something you may not like then go at lunchtime (you get a lot of food w/ the lunch special) or grab the Groupon or Yelp deal. If you are a foodie, you will definitely enjoy Weera Thai's food. By that's only my opinion, try it out yourself and see if your opinion about this place matches my opinion about this place.

4.7989999534 stars

Oh emm gee. Oh. Em. Gee. 
They deliver....P. T. L. ..I am the luckiest gurl in da' world....tonight...I surely am. 

By the purest eerie glow of the talking box...as I lift clenched chopsticks to my lips and my dazzled tongue...decadence. Yup ..fully flushed out thoughts I am sure will follow soon, but I am...otherwise occupied at the moment. 
Eggyplant....with swine, I apologize upfront...required commie card chickie pad thai...crispy duck ka pow... Ohhhh crispy crispy yumms. Dyn-O-mite...wings...suck on this JJ. 

oh holy hallelujah...tonight I am ...happy to be me...

Cannot wait for the next time...cannot wait until tomorrow's leftover goodies.

Yum... Wish it was open late night... That being said there papaya salad is fantastic they have fresh spring rolls that are delicious with shrimp or tofu...and there Tom Yum soup is outstanding.  Any time I visit my Nana or I am on this side of town, I always order Thai from Weera.  They also take American Express #bonus

Our experience on the first visit was way better than the second time with regard to taste and portion. I thought I was the only one who noticed but my husband did too. Tom Yung Shrimp was way too salty and the portion of the Pad Thai was cut in half for some reason. Anyway, will still be back and give it one more chance.

I use to eat here up to 3 times a week when I first head of this place. It's close enough that it delivers to my job and in the same plaza as my hair salon so it was a must every time I was nearby. A little overpriced for the kind of food that it is but it sooo delicious.

my favorites are the fried crab rice, the yellow curry, their eggrolls, and their Thai tea.

very quick delivery

Have to try the green curry it's so good. Didn't have time to take pictures. My wife and kids just couldn't wait. Also ordered the tom yum, chili Mint chicken and are pretty comparable to most Thai joints in town. The ISSAN dishes are also flavorful. We will definitely come back. Just to add, they have a stamp card. One stamp for every $25.
The food was affordable and staff was very friendly. I'm vegan and they were nice about making changes to the dishes on the menu for me.

Recommended by a friend and finally decided to try it. I had the fried tofu appetizer which was amazing, very crisp outside and soft inside. The sweet sauce that accompanied was delicious. Entree was vegetable fried rice. Great flavor no need for additional soy sauce which was rare for me. Had plenty of fast and the rice was cooked perfect.
Lunch special only  till 4 pm . $7.99. Okay food nothing special that would make me want to come back. Service was just OK. Overall, I have had way better thai food else where .
Yummy loas/thai food! friendly service! I love their duck nam tok (duck salad) soooo good. Would recommend this place!

Was ok the spring roll was pretty good... Can't say too much about the seafood soup..... Wayyyy tooooo salty.... The service got better at the end but it should always be consistent... Took too long to place my order... They need a little more staff. Very pleased about the Thai rice... I gave 3 stars due to lack of service and salty soup....

First time here. Place very unassuming. Utter ugliness on the outside but beautiful inside. Came here for lunch. Quick service. Food is very good. Our waitress is friendly. Nice decor, nice plates, big serving. Allowed us to take out our Thai tea as we were too stuffed without charging us extra, against their policy. Got free ice cream for checking in on yelp. Will come back again. They have a stamp card.

Good place to get good food, it's that simple. You'll get what you want and you'll probably like it. No drama. Just leftovers.

Portions are good, and since you're in vegas, that's saying something. It's clean and the servers are friendly and attentive. Heck, they even have a yelp deal, what more could you want in a restaurant?
I've been here a few times now. Their food and service have been consistently good and they have the best fresh spring rolls! Even my picky boyfriend left happy!

This place was recommended to us by a friend. Definitely worth the drive off the stripe for such great food, great service. Will be back for more next time I'm in town. Dreaming of it now that I'm home.

I Wasn't pleased with the service and the food is slowly losing the charm and great taste. One of the example; the clams with garlic is painful to eat..why? Well because the shells are breaking into small peaces when (not carefully cooked) that can be mixed with the clam meat and when you chew it, it can really break your tooth. It happened to me with the whole serving and was truly disappointed because it was one of my most favorite food. Pad Thai is also going down the drain..
The older waitress with shoulder length haired has some kind of issue ether with me or she's just a b rude individual. She made me and my husband feel so uncomfortable when waiting to be seated which it takes a whiled, plus we have to always stand and look awkward when people are eating, just watching us stand there waiting for someone to appear and hopefully to help us. We are always so kind to all, and love the waitress with the short/short hair she's always kind and helpful beside the other one mentioned above. 
We found this place a long time ago before any upgrades were ever made. It's unfortunate that the small, cozy, great food, and great customer service is diminishing by the minute. 
My disappointment is so greatly and so upsetting to have been placed in such uncomfortable place due to the waitress that it's disgusting and needs to be taken cared of that issue. If she can't handle a busy place she needs to be out! 
We will never be back to Weera:(

A good place to go to get some good quality Thai food.

I generally get their green curry, and I always tell them to add extra eggplant. The subtle sweetness, creaminess, and spice is a good combination of flavors that always leaves me wanting more. Other notably good items is their satay, pad thai, and fried rice.

Where this place shines is their lunch special. A good selection of dishes for under 10 bucks. They also toss in a salad, soup, egg roll, and a side of rice. Even though its under 10 bucks, the entree portion is always filling, and it always has the taste of being made fresh. 

Service is always good and the staff goes out of their way to make sure you are enjoying yourself and the food is good.

My only occasional problem with the place is that the meat that comes in the curry is sometimes overcooked and chewy.  But it doesn't happen often, and even when it does, the curry as a whole is still awesome, and the hot(temp) curry sauce helps soften up the meat.

I have been going to this place for years, and I always look forward to going back. This place is always a good spot to go to while on or off a budget, with a wide selection of food to please everyone's pallet.
Weera has expanded and remodeled!! Well done and the food is still on point. Many papaya salads now. I enjoy my staple pad seew.

I rarely give 5 stars but this restaurant deserves it!  This has become a regular place for me to eat at when I visit Las Vegas.  It's not too far off the strip and it's got ah-mazing food!! The service is good and the servers are friendly.  

Location itself doesn't light up at night but who cares! If you're eating, you want to go for the food!! We ordered ourselves to death this evening.  Celebrating my birthday with childhood friends of 30 years!! 

They have happy hour from 7 to 9pm and let me tell you, most of the dishes we ordered that night was off the HH menu for $5 bucks and it made all our tummies smile!  We always get the papaya salad (super spicy), one of the soups, this time Tum Yum with shrimp, glass noodle salad with shrimp $5 dollars, deep fried port ribs $5 bucks, Pad See Ew, Red curry, and chicken wings $5dollars (two orders).  Yeah we practically turned into pigs... 

Please is clean and bathroom is clean! Go eat here! You won't regret it.  Much better than the popular thai place most wait in long lines to get into.  

Happy Eating!

My favorite Thai place to come to. Their food is so delicious & they have a great lunch special! Their service varies ... Like my first time there the waitress told us not to get a plate because it gave another person an upset stomach ...... Awkward ..... But that was just one waitress. Their quality of food is exceptional however and I like how you can make it extremely spicy!

This place is fantastic. Great prices too & amazing food. We're obviously from out of town, so I was craving Thai food like crazy. My mom & I shared the mixed veggies with chicken & got pork fried rice. One of the best rices I've ever had! Awesome customer service too. :)

My friend ordered take out from here, I didn't expect to eat anything but I did taste their shrimp spring rolls and crab sticks - which were actually really good! Taking a look at their take out menu they have decent prices and the average Thai specials. My favorite thing about this place is there very obvious name:
"WE-R- Thai" hahahaha good one.
This is now my favorite Thai restaurant.  Have been there about 6 times now, and each dish was Great!  Whoever the chef is,  they know what they are doing!

weera Thai , I can never say no to! They have great lunch specials , great food, place was just remodeled and it's a beautiful place for dine in , the service never disappoints and to top it off they deliver as well which is awesome. Anywho my FAVORITE plate is the pad Thai which is a must try.
The crispy papaya salad is my favourite, and they have good dessert, i almost like all the food here except the angel wings taste so baddd.

I had never heard of this place before and was just looking for Thai food that was in the area on Yelp. I placed an order thru the Yelp app for pick up. (First time doing that. So easy. Definitely doing that again!) Walked in to pick up our order and we were greeted warmly. We ordered Pad Thai with Chicken, Mongolian Beef and Crab Rangoon. First off, that Crab Rangoon...just wow. Tons of filling with REAL crab - not a ton but it's tasty. Yes, it is a little pricey but I say worth it. The Mongolian Beef was really good. No issue with dry meat. Veggies were fresh. And the Pad Thai was good too. All in all, I'm looking forward to trying this place again and actually dining there.

This is our second time visiting vegas and we decided to try thai place other than Lotus of Siam. With good reviews, we decided to give this place a try. And we loved the experience!!! 

The servers were all welcoming and foods were amazing. We ordered crab rangoon, tom yun kung, duck pad thai, and red curry. All were delicious!! Crab rangoon was loaded with fillings inside with very thin wrap. Tom yum was great. Im not a huge fan of duck but since my fiance likes it we ordered pad thai with duck (which was listed as their specialty). Duck was really good! It didnt have strong duck smell and it was cooked perfectly. Very well done!!!!! Red curry was little too aqueous (i would have liked it little thicker) but it tasted really good. 

They have spicyness rating from 1-5 and i ordered 3 on all of mine and his was 4. If you love spicy foods then i think u can go for 5. Im not a big spicy handler but 4 was manageable to me. Definitely likes this place better than Lotus of Siam. I do feel Lotus of Siam may be more authentic and has more menus but Weera thai had plenty of menus to choose from with great atmosphere and friendly staff. And no waiting!!! We will definitely visit this place again
really good thai food..big serving and the best part is the service very nice and attentive waiters..will be coming back for sure

I stop in with my fiancee for a nice lunch. Unfortunately the service was so slow, we are very close to leaving. When it comes to lunch service, food have to be quick and on the ball so people that have lunch break can go in and out fairly quick.

Unfortunately if you decided to dine in here at lunch time. Tough luck. Food are so so, very slow service. It takes them 10 minutes to take our order, another 5 minutes for drinks and we spend almost an hour for lunch. 

So if you decided to stop in for a quick lunch, better make sure your office time is sufficient!

Quite good. I usually frequent a different Thai food restaurant and my first time here was yesterday. As I dine on leftovers, i give this place three stars in comparison to my normal. Maybe...2 months ago, I ate Thai food in Pinetop AZ...MOUNTAIN TOWN PINETOP, ARIZONA...I would give that place 3.7 stars (Not quite 4...). I expected more in comparison to what else is in close proximity to this place but I do love Thai food in all forms so it's not bad but I've had better.

I'm giving the restaurant 5 stars for serving great food but nothing for customer service. The waitress started to get our order but as soon as another guests came in, she told us that she has to seat them first. Then, she ignored us a lot of times when we were trying to get her attention to order more rice. She finally came, took the order and forgot about us again.  We had to ask another person for it. That was just so rude of her. It also seems like she panics when she sees guests coming in the restaurant and tries to multi-task thus neglecting the service she's giving to the other guests.

Aroy Maaak! (that means HELLA DELISH!)  

The Tom Yum was REALLY good, and I highly recommend the Larb Ped (Duck Salad)  I will be coming back again, and again, and again.  The cook is really nice too, he came out and personally checked up on us.  Great guy...

Weera is a bit of a drive for my husband and me, but we heard lots of good stuff, so we made the journey down Sahara.  

When I walked in, I stepped on a piece of gum on the carpet.  Hm.
We were shown to our booth, which are in desperate need of restuffing.  I literally sank into a hole. Hmm.
I ordered pad kea mow and my husband ordered a garlic shrimp type dish.  In both of our dishes, the vegetables were still raw.  My pad kea mow was bland.  Hmmm.

Considering that Weera is pretty far from us, and there are places like Archi's or Pan Asian closer...I don't think I'll visit this place again.

From service, to the quality and flavor or the food, both my wife and I were extremely impressed.   Pricing is great and lower than similar restaurants of the same caliber.    We will definitely return and will tell our friends about our experience !

This is , hopefully, a one time review. I have been there many times, and, until the latest review, it was my favorite. The last visit was woeful. Jungle Curry, had only string beans and carrots in it, and was unpalatable hotness at only a 3. I really should have not accepted it but was not willing to wait another 20 min.They were crowded and I hope  that was the reason it was bad, no 
excuse though. I will give it one more try and be more demanding to get what I want, and deserve, as a frequent customer.

My boyfriend used to LOVE this restaurant. The experience would have continued to be 5/5 for us, given that the food is delicious and the waiters were once very kind, helpful, and sincerely nice. However, our experiences since their renovation have been disappointing, and recently, incredibly frustrating due to the bad attitude and lack of customer service of the rude, curt female manager working. Our waitress was very sweet but did not speak English, so there was confusion when she asked if we wanted brown rice, despite the fact that they did not have any at the time. This was no problem when we received only white rice, because as two laid back people, we understand stuff happens. When taking our order, the waitress did great by asking what level of heat and what type of meat we wanted. However, she did not ask what type of tofu I wanted, like they had during previous visits, and I had not thought to tell her because it honestly had spaced my mind. This should have been a simple, easy fix, but the manager made sure that not only was I not going to get steamed tofu, but that she was going to berate and belittle me in front of my boyfriend and the other patrons of the restaurant by spitefully lecturing me at our table about the fact that I needed to specify, or else they are going to make me whatever they want. I have never been so rudely treated and embarrassed in my life. We were so disgusted by this woman at this point, having barely touched our food, that we requested to have our food to go. Instead of letting us pack our own food, the waitress took it all to the back. Upon arriving home, much later than we had intended on having a nice, relaxing meal, as if to add insult to injury, our packed meal had about 20% of the curry that we paid for in the small containers, which made the meal not even worth eating. I called and complained, to which naturally I was combated with lame excuses for their terrible actions. We will never go back there again. If I find out the name of said manager, I will edit and place her name so that you can request not to have her have any part of your dining experience.
Favorite thai restaurant:) they have awesome pad thai! It is my go to place to take my friends to! worth the drive from summerlin:):)

The best curry in Vegas. 

I've tried the red, green, yellow and panang - all delicious. Service here is great and the people are so friendly. Noodle dishes are done well too. We like the pad see ew, pad thai, and drunken noodles. From the outside this place doesn't look appealing but the inside is actually really nice. Small bar, lots of TV's and dark lighting. The tom yum soup is also really delicious. Give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

I finally broke down and ordered lunch from here with my co-workers--what a pleasant surprise! I had the broccoli with oyster sauce. The portions were perfect and it was very flavorful! I will def order again.

The food was delicious!  This was our first time here and we were not disappointed.  Great food, cute little restaurant and great staff!  The shrimp with glass noodle salad was very refreshing and the deep fried pork with basil was very flavorful.

It was a last minute search to find a Thai restaurant nearby and I was so glad to have found this one!!! The Pad Thai was absolutely delicious and spring rolls as well. Definitely coming back to try out other things on the menu next time!
Authentic Thai food .. Good service . My favorite place to eat . The staffs are very friendly and the price is very affordable

Superb Thai food!!  Came to Vegas for a conference and I'm glad we stumbled into this restaurant. 

We came for lunch and ordered Thai sweet basil, Fried rice , and Tom Yum Kung (shrimp soup).  This is easily the best Thai I've tasted in a while and definitely one of the best.  The food came early, cooked fresh and flavorful!  Highly recommended!!

Consistently delicious.  I frequent this place about once a week.  I have not had a bad dish yet.  My favorites are beef jerky, red curry, massaman curry, curry fried rice, and spicy eggplant.  Their heat scale is 1-5.  I usually stick with a two.  Anything more and I will go through a gallon of water.

There is nothing better on a Tuesday evening than sitting down with your MOBILE device and OPENING your appropriate APPLICATION and ORDERING FOOD TO BE DELIVERED TO YOU.

Weera Thai is part of this VAST ECOSYSTEM and thank goodness for that!  When I have a hankering for delicious food delivered to me in a reasonable amount of time at a temperature that will please me, and I do not want to drive across the street to Commercial Center. WEERA THAI fits the *BILL*. 

My regards to Bill by the way- Delivery charges I guess are just a part of life now, and there is no exception here... however once the bags are in my hot or COLD little hands I don't care that they charged me $4, or that I got to choose my tip online vs. handing cash.

The CURRY IN A HURRY is a good way to go.
The PAD THAI is full of THAIAMIN and Riboflavin to help you sleep.
Everyone in the house can be satisfied with the lack of heat if you ask for no spice- to burn your TUCHAS off HOT HOT HOT.

I enjoy everything I order UP TO and INCLUDING the STICKY RICE (a favorite of mine) and I LOVE that it is not tied to a dessert, it is it's own sticky side.

I just might miss my just in THAIme delivery when I am on the other side of town.

Stay WEERD WEERA Thai!

A small simply decorated place that has one of the best pad thai I've had. The tom yum goong was spicy and fragrant, but didn't have much shrimp flavor. The thai tea was very good and refreshing. The sweet rice and durian was very unique. Sweet and salty with lots of coconut cream and served hot. Great solid authentic Thai food.

Fast delivery, predictable quality; that's all I ask for when in couch potato mode and too lazy to even walk across the street for dinner.  Over the course of about a dozen home deliveries, I've only been disappointed once and that was due to a forgotten item; oh well, life goes on, Corky.  Delivery to the door is usually less than 30 minutes, sometimes as quick as it takes to travel down the elevator and walk the dog.  The food always, without fail, arrives piping hot...they either have really insulated containers or travel at the speed of sound.  I have tried everything from their curry meals to all the other usual Thai dishes that the white man enjoys; all taste good to me, delivered on time with a smile.  Hay! I'm a fan!

When we stopped in for a late lunch, we were pleased to see the customers were mainly Thais.  We ordered Pad Thai from the Luncheon menu as it is the dish we normally order to compare Thai restaurants.  It was some of the best Pad Thai we've had.  We were pleasantly surprised when our server brought us a starter of salad, egg roll and cup of Tom Yum soup since the menu didn't mention the dish came with sides.  These were also excellent and we will certainly eat here again on our next trip to Las Vegas.
The food is great! And love their soup. So tasty! The price match the quantity. Comes with lots of food. Would like to come back again!
This is a great location for Thai Thursdays. All the food is flavourful. Sasi is wonderful

Food is amazing place is beautiful!! but the service was HORRIBLE! I seriously wanted to get up and leave!! Yes we had two little kids, my baby nephew dropped his water on the floor by accident , we were very embarrassed by it, And we were apologizing.  But the waitress just came and dumped a lot of napkins on the table so we could clean it ourselves! WOW you would think they would have someone else come and mop it up. It was just water.  My sister in law whom is 9 months pregnant had to clean up.  We don't mind picking up after kids but never have I been to a F$&@ed up place like this that didn't care if it was a safety hazard for their other waiters!  Their staff were just terrible.  Even when we walked in Not a smile, we were seated quickly but waited like 10 mins before they took our order!  They need to have happier people working there seriously!! Ugh I will never go back.

I think I've been here maybe 30 times ( maybe more) even though I've only checked in 17 times.. Regardless, I think it's time for a review! 

I believe I found this place after searching for "best thai food in vegas." It was listed among the top three along with Lotus of Siam & Komol so I had to give it a try after already trying the latter two restaurants. I am sooo glad I did because this has become one of my regulars/to go restraurants when I'm not sure what I'm really craving.

YUM I don't think there is a single item on this menu that I don't like. I used to order the same items every time I came.. so much that when I forgot what it was, the waitresses would finish my order for me! Some of my favorites here are: the panang curry, the green curry, crab fried rice, and garlic squid. I won't get into each thing individually because I just don't feel that any words can do it justice, but will note that everything is always fresh and PACKED with flavor. Just think of a regular thai place and multiply the flavor by 5. So. Good. 

I also liked the pad thai. Normally, I don't like pad thai because I find it to be waaay too sweet or saucy, but this is really good. I've ordered it a few times for delivery to school and never had any complaints. Speaking of delivery-- they deliver to a pretty wide area including the strip! woohoo.

My all time favorite thing though would have to be the thai iced tea.. yes.. a drink! It tastes significantly different than thai iced tea from other places (other places tend to have a slight chocolate-y flavor which I'm not a huge fan of). It's hard to explain the exact taste... just trust me & try it! After all it is $1 or 50% off during lunch/happy hour I believe. 

The service here is amazing. Everyone is very friendly. My only minor complaint is that the parking lot outside gets extremely full sometimes!

Do not judge by location or outside appearance.... simply get yourself inside, meet the wonderfully friendly staff and eat some outstanding Thai! Start with the Crab Rangoon, it melts in your mouth, then move to the Coconut mushroom soup.... amazing! I finished with the Tofu Pad Thai (not a vegetarian by the way, just LOVE Tofu when it's cooked well). At the end of the night, for two.... WITH two glasses of wine and my partner had an entree as well (we split the "Small" soup that was huge) our bill was $35!! Yeah, that's right..... get there!

Best Thai in town! The staff is great, fast service, great for big groups, good alcohol selection, and the food is to die for! The catfish salad has the best crunch with a fresh Apple, cilantro, onion, and peanut dressing it is the best pairing for any meal!
This place is AWESOME!!! Excellent Thai food, service, and atmosphere! I started coming here recently and it's now my favorite Thai food place in town. Eat here, you won't be disappointed!

I went her Friday June 30th. Been to a few Thai restaurants but this was the best I've ever had. Went with my parents, Aunt and Uncle (he is from Thailand) who helped us order. Loved the mango and sticky rice dessert. Tried my aunts kao soy with beef it was awesome.
I come here a lot with my family. We always receive great service and the food is good. Prices are okay. Nice and clean restaurant.

Tom Kah Kai was amazing!  Pepper Garlic chicken, Ginger chicken...drool.  First experience with this place and we were all thoroughly impressed.  We ordered late night takeout just before midnight.   Everything was nicely packed in a brown bag and all the entrees were individually wrapped with plastic bags outside their respective containers.

  Guy with an apron greeted me outside when I arrived and said they were waiting for me, then he opened the door for me.  On my wait out I asked the guy if he made the food and he said "yeah, we make", then I pointed at him and said "did you make it?" And he said "Yeah, we make."  I thanked him, smiled and drove away.

This review is long overdue, my apologies!! If you're looking for authentic Thai food this is the place to go! Typical Asian restaurants have subpar customer service but the ladies here are awesome! I've dined here numerous times, with girlfriends, with family, for business.. And the times we've brought our children here, anyone with kids know how hard it is to keep them quiet and their dining area as clean as possible but at times this is impossible. The ladies here still smiled, still serviced us like they did on every occasion, now that's excellent customer service! 

Just a warning on the Thai Chile, they're spicy!
Great food, great portions, THE best thai iced coffee, friendly service! WHat more could you ask for? Don't let the slightly sketchy location fool you, this place is VERY good!

Weera Thai is a cute space in a rather dingy strip mall.  My brother and I stopped in for lunch. We took advantage of the lunch specials ordering the Chicken Pad Thai ($7.99) and Mongolian Beef ($7.99). Both come with salad, soup, rice and egg roll. I enjoyed the Pad Thai, it was a good sized portion and a great value. My brother didn't like the Mongolian beef enough to order it again, but left satisfied. Unfortunately, service was sluggish. They had a full dining room so it's understandable. It just rules it out as a lunch spot, since we need to be in & out in under an hour. I would like to return to try items beyond the lunch menu selection; the Issan items piqued my attention.

The food is good, though rather pricy for what is essentially rice. If there were more veggies I wouldn't mind so much. But the taste is there. One thing I don't like is that when ordering online from eat24 they won't honor the coupons. I got a call saying that it they wouldn't give the free ice tea with the purchase. How about taking the coupon off the system then?

Amazing food!! The chicken panang curry is good it's not too runny or too thick and so flavorful. The mango sticky rice dessert is a must try also. The mangoes are fresh and its almost a whole mango that comes with it.
Most of dishes are tasty and reasonable. Also service is good. We live in Henderson.Only problem is too far away.
Great, authentic Northeastern Thai Food! Careful on the spiciness! Yes, they do have a great Khao Soi!

The portions here were huge! Came here for a bachelorette dinner! Staff was friendly and food was quick. Curry and Pad See Ewe was amazing!!! When I am back in vegas I will definitely come here again. Food was priced just right also. I loved it.

We just had the lunch special here. I had Mongolian beef, and my son had pad Thai. The flavors are really wonderful. The  spicy food is spicy or you can order less spicy too. Lunch specials a very reasonable price too. Try it, you'll enjoy it!
I hesitate to review because i cant get in here for lunch these days as it is packed. But the food here is so good. The furnishings are modest, the food is fit for Thai royalty.
Honestly one of the best Thai food places I have ever ate at.   If I could give more stars I would. ..

BF and I had a god-awful thai experience at Pam Real Thai recently, but were still craving a good Thai meal. A friend recommended Weera, and in we went on a Thursday evening.
