Happy Hour menu of apps and half price drinks from 6:00-9:45PM, we opted for the fresh duck spring rolls ($8)- a huge portion served with a tasty marmalade-like dipping sauce. The rolls were packed with duck and fresh herbs, most notably the flavorful mint that other places skimp on or leave out all together. Definitely a dish I'd order again.

Next we shared a hot pot of tom kha kai, which was delicious and boiling hot, packed with tons of chicken, cilantro, mushrooms, and ginger. Very flavorful, really hit the spot.

BF chose the beef pad se ew entree, at the recommendation of our super-sweet server- and we were not disappointed. The noodles were super fresh and chewy, great texture that was almost like velvet. I haven't had fresher noodles since we were in Chinatown in the Bay area.

Last, we opted to box up our entree leftovers and share a dessert: mango and sticky rice. It was plated beautifully, and the flavors were spot-on: mango was perfectly ripe, rice was warm and had the perfect texture, and the sweetness was not too overwhelming. 

Service from both of the ladies working throughout our visit was top notch: drinks were refilled before they even got half empty, we were checked on repeatedly between courses, and they had radiant smiles on their faces every second. I've received lesser service at five-star with much higher price tags (and expectations). The service here was genuinely the absolute best I've had in recent memory- and their food was top of the line, too. Food is priced well: for all of the above, our bill was under $40 before tip. This is definitely a place we'll be back.

Just had potentially the best Spicy Basil with Chicken Lunch special I've ever had.  This might not be a big deal to you, but this is MY ORDER at Thai restaurants.  It's the first thing I usually go for at a new place.  

Spiced 4 out of 5, it had the perfect amount of kick that I like without leaving me in tears.  

The best part of it goes along with something I mentioned in the previous review, with the chicken being of the sliced variety and not ground up like I'm used to.  Even though I love the version of this dish at Archis and Pin Kaow who do it ground up, I always wanted to find a place who did it well with nicely sliced pieces of chicken.  Many times the restaurants that attempt it leave you with chunks of fat on the chicken still intact, or the slicing job looks more like Leatherface from Texas Chainsaw got a hold of it and not the fine carving skills of Michael Myers.  To summarize:  THIS CHICKEN WAS RIGHT!

And I finally remembered to order brown rice!   Oh and the Egg Roll was fantastic.  

Hoping they can keep this up, they really earned this 5 stars today.

We went with a group of 6. There were maybe three other tables occupied when we arrived. It took her a while for the server to take our drink order and another long while for her to deliver the drinks. The server did not speak very good English (or pretended not to). Her facial expressions were not good. She seemed short tempered and irritated. She never once was pleasant as a server should be. The food was really good. Portions were good.

Delicious! We eat here every time we're in LV. Try the fresh springs rolls and the Pad Thai Woon sen. 
It's location is an unassuming strip center west of the Strip, but it's a very nice inside.

After me and my wife decided to try something different. We checked this place out our initial impressions was it looked like a small hole in the wall kinda place however upon opening the door we we're pleasantly surprised with a super clean sleek looking place and friendly staff. To top it all the food was superb
Came here on a business trip, looking for authentic Thai food. Found this place on Yelp. All dishes are very authentic and tasty. Strongly recommended!

My fiance and I are locals and love trying new food places especially Thai food. We should know better by now that it is not easy to find a place that is better than the Archi's on Rainbow and 215. 


First off Weera's service is terrible. They had us sit, did not take drink orders, I had to ask for my drink then at that they did not ask my fiance for his drink order, they acted like he was non existent. Once our server came back for the third time we ordered our food and his drink.

We love thai food and always over order due to how the food becomes more flavorful the next day. We ordered:

Pad prik king level 4, my fiances favorite (usually) he liked it, said it had a good flavor but could have got level 5. 

Panang curry level 4, my favorite (usually) I could have got a 5 as well. It had good flavor and since this place is close to my work and Archi's is not, I will order it for lunch one day. 

Pad thai level 4, recived level 0. Enough said. 

Shrimp fried rice, it was good, you really have to be terrible to screw that up. 

Fried wings, they were cripsy and the sauce was really good, oh and it was more spicy than our other dishes.

Thai tea, was delish and it would have been nice if the fiance had the option of a refill. 

We waited and waited to be aknowledged for our check. 

There are better places for Thai food here in vegas. But this is just my opinion.

I've been here maybe 4-5 times and I must say the quality seems to have gone downhill. I always order the pineapple fried rice and this time it tasted blah and they added carrots to it and I'm not sure why... Messed up on our second 2nd order (which should have been sea bass in garlic sauce, which the first time we ordered it was a very small plate for $17) in which we didn't try. Kinda wish we did because our 3rd order came out cold (spicy duck) so we sent it back and decided to stick with the pineapple fried rice.

Good thing I suppose because I had planned on using a $30 living social deal, but my friends used a groupon now deal and they refused to let us use both, even though it was separate checks and my friends came in and ordered way before we got there. They told us we could sit elsewhere and they would take it, otherwise the "big man upstairs" was watching and they would get in trouble if they took both. They were nice though and even asked if we wanted to still ordered which obviously we did, but it just turned into a big disappointment.

Last visit we had similar issues (cold food that was overly salty which they tried to fix, but ended up tasting even worse, but they took it off the bill at least) and while the sea bass in garlic sauce was really good, the portion size and sticker price left us feeling like we should have just ordered more pineapple fried rice.

Unfortunately I probably won't be coming back here if I can get a refund on my livingsocial coupon, otherwise it'll probably be the last time and I'll be just going to Pin Kaow from now on.
This place has yet to disappoint and always hits the spot. The yellow curry is excellent.
Food was delish. Servers were professional . The inside looks better than the outside.

It was my first time there. Have mango salad, papaya salad, tom-yum noodle soup etc. i love my tom-yum noodle soup. Definitely coming back! The only thing that held me back is the price. Kinda expensive compare to other thai res.

so good! Delicious food, attentive, friendly service and low prices.

the room is beautiful but I hardly looked up from my plate because I enjoyed the food so much.

so this is an update to my first review and same order. I had ordered the sticky rice as well and when I was eating it, I found a straight white hair in the middle of the sticky rice. I know its not mine or anyone who lives here because it was straight stuck in the middle like it was cooked into it. so gross!

Excellent. Very clean inside and very large portions of good food. The price to portion ratio is excellent. The pad see ew sauteed in curry sauce was something I had never seen before and was delicious. The Chiang Mai sausage and yellow curry I had were also very good. Overall, excellent flavor, huge portions, reasonable price, lots of other good looking things on the menu. An excellent choice for Thai.

Great service and great food! Always look forward to coming here whenever I am in Vegas.
Love the gingered seabass, a little pricey for the portion size but well worth splurging for.

We stay at hotel n have it be delivered directly to hotel. On time n excellent delivery. 

The food's so delicious and very good choice for lunch. We are 2 people, totally full with chicken panang curry,pad thai combination n crispy duck salad. The pad thai is new to me. It's ok. Not so impression. But the crispy duck salad is so so good. I'm addicted to it. Still want to eat it more even now so full. I ordered spicy level 8 for panang curry hwever it's still medium for my indian bf. next time I should make it level 10. Lolz.!!! 

Thank for the free Thai Ice Tea. It's so sweet to me but very nice after having full lunch. 

I'll come here for next time visit Las Vegas.

Updates: Weera Thai will be closed for a couple of weeks from 2/29/2016 - 3/15/2016. They are renovating and making the restaurant bigger. Congratulations Weera! 

As my friends and I visited again a couple of days ago, customers came in nonstop. Every time we come to Vegas...we always have to stop at Weera for some awesome Thai food. 

They have this awesome happy menu (every night), that has cheap beer and appetizers. The Issan (Northeastern Thai) food is so good. If you like it hot and spicy...make sure you let them know. 

Never a disappointing stop. Weera is 3 miles or so from the strip. See you on my next trip back to Vegas from LA. Love your service as well....

Just got back from my first experience at Weera Thai and I am very excited. This place has really good Thai food for reasonable prices. The lunch special was $7 and  is the best Thai food I have had.  This place will be a regular spot for me and I will definitely be taking my friends and family there when they come to visit.

Great restaurant with excellent service. I went in for lunch with my boyfriend and we loved our food! I got the green curry with Tofu and some vegetables. Since i ordered a lunch special, we also got roll and salad. Salad was very basic and sauce was okay but things were delicious after that. 

I also ordered a coconut drink on the side and display was amazing. :) Overall, i loved this place and the service. Check them out
Excellent food and service. Very authentic Thai food. Nice decor also.

Ahhh I can't say how many stars I would give this place because I have such mixed feelings. They are really welcoming and the water here must be extra filtered because it tastes just like bottled! My first time here, we ordered the pad thai, tom ka chicken soup, and I think it was the duck curry. The pad thai was not the best I've ever had...but it was good. The tom ka, was SO flavorful, but also really spicy. The duck curry is what hit the spot (even though my mouth was on fire) I would totally recommend this place to anyone and I would definitely return. 

Now let me tell you about my return visit, We ordered the pad thai again as well as the curry, but were craving dessert. We ordered the mango sticky rice and I think they had mistaken the mango sticky rice for regular sticky rice. Since this order was to go, I assumed they had it right because most to-go orders are pretty simple. I didn't bother checking once I got it since I was in kind of a hurry. Unfortunately, I didn't trust my gut when I went in and told them what I ordered, because when I told them what I had gotten, the employees looked at each other and said "uhh three items right." For that reason I'm a little grumpy with this place which is why I am only giving them three stars.

Every time I come to las Vegas, I can't wait to get my Weera Thai! I always get the Massuman Curry with tofu and pineapple or Panang Curry with pineapple. So addicting!  Oh.....and don't ever forget the crab Rangoon! :)

Was in town for the weekend with my husband and kids. My husband and I decided we wanted Thai food so I hopped on Yelp and ordered from Weera Thai for delivery to our hotel on a Saturday evening. Delivery took a bit long but it's Vegas so I expected that. The food was great. We both had the Pad Thai and I ordered egg rolls and veggie fried rice on the side. I had the Thai Iced Tea; good balance. Overall we were both happy with our decision to order in!

Best thai beef noodle soup!! Okay, I've really only tried the one here and then at thai style noodle house...but this one wins hands down!  Small hole in the wall restaurant with very friendly service staff.  The thai beef noodle soup has a richer beef broth with a more savory flavor than the thai style noodle house version.  It also comes with a generous portion of beef balls/beef slices/tendon/tripe.  There is also the option of different noodles (egg/wide noodle/etc).  If you are a pho lover...try this thai style version...you will not be disappointed!

I am a self professed noodle freak! Not to mention my burning desire to have my nose run, and lips sting. Bingo...Thai food is the answer to my burning question...whats for lunch?  The restaurant is small and quaint. The staff  is friendly. Thai Crab Rangoon are fabulous, small packages bulging with cream cheese, crispy and delicate, served with a lightly sweet sauce. Chicken pot stickers were meaty, yet tender. I chose the Pad Kee Mao to satisfy my noodle need. Add a heaping helping of the table condiments to assist in clearing out my sinuses and I'm a very happy girl, runny nose, stinging lips, and full tummy...mission accomplished!

Santi and I came to this Northern Thai restaurant after an extended search on Yelp. I wanted to find an authentic fare, and became intrigued after reading several reviews about their Issan cuisine. The squared-shaped interior started with center tables vertically arranged, followed by booths, wall-to-wall cultural artifacts, TV, and a small bar in the back. The atmosphere was casual with lots of foot traffic throughout the day.

The Khor Mee Yang ($9.95) arrived with strips and pieces of marinated charbroiled pork nicely blackened on the ends. The mix of tender charred, lean, and fatty textures was highly addictive, but the marinade and spicy tamarind sauce could have been better, as the level of spiciness was not as robust as I like it to be.

The Khao Pad Pla Salid ($9.50) included a huge portion of fried rice filled with deep fried salid fish, basil, and peppers. The fried rice carried a decent airy texture. Too much fish sauce made it too salty to my liking, but the fried fish was crispy, moist, plentiful, and nicely flavored. The server initially described this dish as "spicy fried rice." However, we didn't find a hint of heat even after we had requested these dishes to arrive Thai spicy.

Overall, portions were excellent with discernible authentic flavors. However, the level of spiciness was the absent element that could have advanced the flavors further. Contrary to other reviewers' account, our service was timely, attentive, and friendly. I would be interested in returning to give them another chance.

Great food and even better service. 

The portion size is huge! And the flavor stands up to the best thai places in town. 


Enjoyed a nice glass of Riesling with our meal the sweetness balanced out the spiciness of the curry nicely. 


Me and my wife will defiantly be back again.

It's authentic but ask for medium spicy and you'll get mild.  They were Thai customers in there, which was comforting and the food is pretty authentic.  The pilot fish dish was a fried rice concoction with small dried, fried fish (kind of like pork crackings and the dried fish snacks at 99 Ranch).  The duck soup noodle was good.
Delicious Thai food, the restaurant is nicely decorated, service is fine. We come for the food and leave happy, great lunch specials as well!
Phenomenal thai food and one of the few places that delivers downtown. I think Lotus of Siam is best thai in town but Weera is a close second and delivers!

I have heard such great things from friends and co-workers about this place for a while. Saw all the glowing reviews on Yelp! and decided to check this place out.

Just not impressed at all. Sorry, not sorry.

Positives:
(+) Love the decor! Place was very clean and beautifully decorated. Love all the gold gilding in the wall art and sculptures. Very, very Thai atmosphere.
(+) Pad See Ew was pretty good. Probably in the top 5 I've had in the city, but nothing to lose it over.

Not so positives:
(-) Service was alright, but quite slow, especially considering that the place was nearly empty on a Monday afternoon. 
(-) Kao Moo Dang tasted good, but portion size was pretty underwhelming. Very unsatisfying and disappointing. 
(-) Ordered Pad See Ew with no veggies and still got plenty of veggies. After the long wait I certainly was not going to send it back. 

This wasn't a terrible experience. I guess underwhelming and disappointing would probably be more accurate. There are just too many good Thai places in the city to even entertain a repeat visit.

2 stars.

Oh, I have definitely experienced better.
Love it. So good and quick delivery if you're in the area. Green curry chicken and pad Thai are awesome. Also the fresh rolls with shrimp.
I have eaten Thai food for many years and this is the best Thai food in Las Vegas and they deliver I'm in trouble

Nice decoration and severs so friendly. I had many thai food in Los Angeles so when i came here i didn't expect much about the taste. After i orderd some menus that was awsome Larb ped is nice and many dishes that is better than in thai town in LA. The food is too slow to serve but is worth to wait. The food too slow but dessert was slower that is dissapoint me but  I'll be back again for sure next time for nice thai food!!

So...I had ordered delivery last week and fell in love with everything I ordered (panang curry, fresh spring rolls, and Tom Kah Kai). I ordered the fresh spring rolls and the Dynamite Appetizer (deep fried chicken wings with hot spicy sauce). Not good at all. The hot spicy sauce was not spicy and had a fishy taste...as if someone accidentally spilled fish sauce into the sauce. I ate the chicken wings by themselves. Then, the fresh spring rolls that I was so looking forward to eat, was not anywhere near the taste I had enjoyed last week. Brown/old bean sprouts, not as much shrimp, too many noodles and they were dried out. I'm so disappointed. And the price of delivery just added more negative to my experience.

I went for their lunch special, but they ran out of soup. They also ran out of eggrolls. They also ran out of curry. It took forty-five minutes for them to make new curry. 

The extra star is for the service. Our waitress was very nice and apologetic about things which she couldn't control. 

After I ate, I also ran out. I'm not running back in either.

Top thai places to eat in town. We eat here often because it caters to the thai's and Americans. All the food here's is good and always consistent .our favorite dish is sum tum. Nobody in town makes it better.

We ordered the tom yum goon, larb (duck), Orange chicken, and pad thai, 1-2 spicy on a 5 scale.  Very fresh shrimp in the soup, large tomato chunks, onions, mushroom, and great spices.  The Orange chicken was cooked to perfection, most places make it too soggy.  Not here!  The pad thai (pork) made me cry tears of spicy joy.  A great meal!  We could have bumped up the spice on the larb, and added some more spice to tone down the rich duck flavor.
Immediately after my review I was messaged by the manager and I was extremely please. I came back to give it another try and I couldn't be happier. The food was fantastic and the service was superb!

We come here all the time. My husband and I use to come here even 3 times a week sometimes. Things have definitely changed in their service and their food as well. We always order the duck spring rolls and my husband is very forgetful and forgets to ask for the peanut sauce instead with the spring rolls and this time we were told it would be $2 extra. They exchanged it for free this time, but it's weird to be told that when we've been coming here for so long. I understand though. Another thing about their food quality was their Thai fried rice was mushy.... first time this has ever happened to us. Also there was a lady on November 17th at around 10pm that was standing behind the counter that kept giving my husband a dirty look when we tried to redeem codes we had gotten from their reward program... why have a program for loyal customers if you're going to give attitude about people trying to use it. Like I said before, we've come here a lot and a lot of the staff knows us. Sadly none of them were working tonight ..

I came here only for Khao Soi soup and they did not disappoint me. I was told the owner is from Chiang mai and Khao Soi is probably the most popular dish over there. I was literally transferred to the streets of CHM. The only thing what i could object is that the noodles stick together otherwise perfect.

A really good secret....Hands down they have some really great food! It is inconspicuously located in a strip mall on Sahara, so you can easily pass right by it.  Anything you get on this menu is guaranteed to be delicious you can't go wrong....the staff is also very humbled and gracious to be of service.  Pricing is reasonable, I just wish the portions were a little bigger.

Ok so the reason why I give it 5 stars because they have a particular dish that they make better than anyone else..in Thai it's called kao moo dang and moo grob.. basically it's bbq pork and deep fried pork belly over rice and Thai sweet tamarind sauce that goes over it.. if you want to try something besides tom yum or tom kha or pad see ew or pad Thai then come here and try this dish..it's awesome
Ive ordered food to go and i dont know if they intentionally forgot the panang beef!!! Im soooo pisssed!!! Never come back here!!

Great food quality.  First off, parking can be a pain if you're there during peak meal times, as it's right off of Sahara in a mini strip building.
We ordered to eat family style and got:  Calamari, Yellow Chicken Curry, Duck Pad Thai, Seafood Pad Thai, Fresh Spring Rolls, Spicy Eggplant and the Mango with Sweet Rice for dessert.  Everything was delicious.  The Seafood PT had calamari w/o the batter and even had muscles.  Something out of the ordinary for me, a seafood lover.  The Eggplant had a good kick to it, but delicious and is great to have as a veggie dish.
The Crabstick appetizer is very popular because we originally ordered it to start with, but they were out.  So probably a must try!
The 3 stars is only because of it's location, parking, and distance from my house.  I feel as though with all the competing restaurants in Las Vegas, I'm sure to find one just as good closer to me.

Pink Thai Tea with milk ( Thai Iced Tea Pink Milk??? ) hands down the best Thai Tea that I have ever tasted!! It tasted like... Cotton candy Frap from Starbucks but.. So much yummier lol! The shrimp pad thai is good..especially the shrimp (big and juicy) And we also ordered the Weera Sampler plate... Yum yum yum !!!

I arrived here at 3:25 pm. When the waiter approached 5 minutes later, I ordered the crispy duck salad (about $16.95) and asked if I could see the happy hour appetizer list.  I was informed that the happy hour didn't start until 4.  I then said, ok, I will have still have the duck salad, but its not enough, so bring me the lunch special pad thai.  He then told me the lunch special is only good until 3:30.  I said, it is 3:30.  He said its only UNTIL 3:30.  I asked to speak to a manager. He said there isn't one. I asked if there was anyone else I could speak to.  He went to the register and spoke in Thai to a woman there, then came back and said, we can't give you the lunch special or the happy hour menu, but we will give you a free house salad with my order.  I said, so, you are going to give me a free salad with my duck salad?  and he said yes, as if its the most common thing in the world to have a salad with your salad. Unnacceptable.
Small cozy place. Service is decent. I come here specifically for the crispy pork with Chinese broccoli. It's heaven. I wish San Diego makes it as good as they do! I nice hidden gem of Vegas.

This restaurant was recommended by a local bartender, and it was outstanding all around. The food, service, and prices were all outstanding. The atmosphere is a step up from casual, but the place was hopping with parties both large and small. This is clearly a neighborhood favorite!

The waitress was careful to ask how spicy I preferred each dish--suggesting that each plate was made to order. I always first order Pad Thai and Tom Kha Gai from a new Thai restaurant in order to establish a comparative baseline. Both here were outstanding, and I can't wait to get back to explore more of their offerings--and will update this review accordingly.

The restaurant was located close to downtown where I work.  I took a coworker there for lunch  We ordered 3 dishes to share.  I ordered from the back of the menu where they listed their specialties, duck salad and spicy clams.  I also ordered one of the noodle dishes that started with an "r."  The noodles were in a brown sauce and pretty good.  The duck was savory but you're caught unexpected with the sourness of the initial flavor.  The yummiest dish was the clams. It was awesome and had I known, I would've ordered two orders of the clams.  I ordered the spice level at a 2 for my coworker but the dishes would've been better at a 3.  The service was excellent and the prices were very reasonable. I had paid $10 for a $20 groupon so the value of the meal was awesome for what I paid.

First timer.

We ordered chicken satay , beef larb, pad see ew  and sea bass. Oh and chicken curry fried rice. 

It's really not that hard to mess up chicken satay , but I'm really picky with my peanut sauce since I've tasted some horrible stuff before. Thank God this place got it right.

All the other entrees are good. Not too little , not too much in size. 

I like this place so far. I've got nothing to complain about this place yet.
Food is pretty good but I think the portion sizes are a little small....they would be okay for a party of 2 but 3 or more isn't enough. The crispy pork with Chinese broccoli is good!

After my most recent visit, I have decided it's a 5 starrer. Actually, it's mostly because of the Mango Salad. It is prepared like a traditional papaya salad, but in the place of the thinly sliced papaya, you get to devour mango. And, I think it is far superior to papaya. The thoughtfulness, creativity and cravability of this dish is a perfect representation of Weera. I have had numerous notable Thai standards, like the green curry, but they really stand out by always having a little twist on the standards that are equally, if not more, delicious.
Had a great time. Customer service spot on price was fair I'm glad I went here. Will definitely try them again looking forward to the next visit

Love this place! Incredible service, great food and awesome atmosphere.
The cost is great too for a budget! 
May be my favorite in Vegas!

I was in the mood for Thai food so I hopped on Yelp to see what was near by and found Weera Thai.  Whenever I'm looking for a new Thai restaurant I always look for Misty Y and Dan P's reviews, once I see that they give it a good rating I am ready to try it out.  

I had the Spicy Basil with Chicken lunch special, spicy level 3 out of 5 and thought it was spiced perfectly for my taste.  Usually some restaurants will either under spice or over spice when asking for a middle of the range level, but this was perfectly spicy will not making me reach for water after every bite.  The flavors on the dish were also spot on.  You dont get too much but for $6 I couldnt complain.  

I cant wait to come back and try their duck dishes.  Writing this review has me craving Thai food again! haha.

I like to judge Thai Restaurants based on how well they make Pad Thai. I mean, that's basic enough, right? I mean, if a restaurant can't make a good pad thai what makes you think their other food is going to be up to par? So... I did just that. 

First time I tried their pad thai, and I thought "Wow... This is better than most restaurants in Vegas." It was saucy, tangy, sweet, with the right amount of noodles with the condiments provided. So, I thought, "I want to try this place again!" 

The second time around wasn't the same as the first, or the third, fourth, or even fifth. Is it just me or most Thai restaurants just can't get Pad Thai right? Overall, it had a hint of tang, but in terms of a good balance between, salty, spice and sweet, they just couldn't get. And in most cases, the noodles are a bit over boiled, that they tend to stick together as if adhered by dull glue. So,sometimes when I'm in the mood for Pad Thai, I would cross my fingers and hope that they make it good this time around. Why would a customer even have to do that? 

But of course, I'm not going to base my review with just one entree. I thought that maybe, pad thai isn't their forte. So, I tried the next best thing which is pad see ew. This was just worse than the pad thai. While I thought that the latter lacked flavor, the pad see ew, I ALWAYS shoo away from because the first time I got it, it was a blob of salted noodles colors light brown. I could pick up the noodle and I swear they would probably stick together shaped like a brick. Not only that, it was also over boiled, and was left sitting for a while (because we ordered for delivery), and tasted a bit dry. It was so bad, that I traded this nasty dish for a mediocre pad thai. 

I've also tried their yellow curry, and I have to say that it's not something that you'll remember.  It's a pretty basic curry with a pretty good kick of spice, but the chicken, potatoes, carrots, and other veges looked like it was just thrown in with the base that it hardly caught it's flavor. Did prepared the veges and meat separately and have a base for curry somewhere else and put it together? I really would like to think that they didn't. I'm not saying that the curry is bad. I think it's pretty average compared to other restaurants in Vegas. 

Once of the latest entree that I tried from there was the Spicy Chicken Basil. I ordered it because it was in their lunch special, and from other restaurants, I've had a pretty good experience with many. Chicken was bland, but the sauce was flavorful. Again, the part about the chicken and veges... Did they boil that separately in a big batch and just put together with many of their orders? I was a bit disappointing with the portion considering that it wasn't an entree that made me say "wow". 

Then, the last thing I got their was their pineapple fried rice. Okay, I gotta give it to them on this one. This was pretty damn delicious and a huge portion. I think next time I go there (in the circumstances that my friends would want to go here again), I would order this as the safest thing that I can eat and actually like. 

It would be horrible of me to say that this is a two out of five because this place is a hit and miss for me. I've had good days in which the entrees I've ordered was good enough for me to enjoy, but I also had days when I was left disappointed. So, overall I want to say... It's not bad, but it's not great either.

Not sure what happened when they reopened after their remodeling... I would always eat here and it never made me sick but since it has reopened I have ate here 3 times and got sick every single time. This last time it gave me food poisoning and I'm currently dealing with that now, up all night throwing up. Also this place made 4 other people I know sick with food poisoning as well. Usually places will give you a bad meal once and it's over with but now there has been MULTIPLE different cases of actual food poisoning ever since Weera opened back up. I'm not sure if they had their health inspection or not but someone needs to get in there and see what the hell is going on. I'm extremely upset with this place and will never go back or eat Thai food again. I have never been so sick in my entire life or had food poisoning. All I ordered was pad Thai which I get at any Thai restaurant and it's always fine, but there's clearly something wrong going on in the kitchen. My friends ordered the sweet chili basil and different curries and got food poisoning too. We all had to go to the doctor because it was that severe. I do not recommend this place,  unless you want to be sicker than you've ever been before. Disgusting, unsanitary and the kitchen needs to be inspected. This is not cool. Be careful if you do decide to go here.

I really liked this place!  The food was fresh, portions generous, and service was shockingly friendly.  We ordered pineapple fried rice and Pad See Ewe.  Both were delicious and left no room for complaints.  Will return the next time I'm sick of eating at buffets.

Very good Thai food, nice and clean 
Great test I go this restaurant a lot when I go Vegas ,

My first time here and the food was awesome. The food reminds me of when i am in Thailand. Besides the food being so great the waitresses were really nice and very friendly. Will definitely make this my regular stop when i visit las vegas again.

Great Thai food! We made a spontaneous decision to stop in here for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon. The place is nice and clean and the service is friendly. The best part is the food, though! I had the sweet basil with chicken and my hubby had the duck ka pow. Both were excellent! My only complaint is that we like really spicy, so we ordered ours as a 4 (out of 5.) Both were very flavorful but not spicy, so next time we'll order 5s. But there will certainly be a next time, because we'll be back! This place kills Archi's, King & I, and other local Thai restaurants.

Great food. In many Thai restaurants the food is too salty, too spicy, too much. Everything was excellent here and tasted special.
The spring rolls were wonderful, the soup was delicious, and Kung pau was perfect.

We will come back when in Vegas.

Came here with a group of friends for lunch. The outside looks like a scary shack but the inside is nicely decorated with a lot of red and gold. It's very comfortable and clean on the inside.  

We all got the lunch special and ordered thai ice tea which was a 1.50 more with the special. We all agreed that the thai ice tea was too sweet and needed to be watered down. I think I poured half my water into the tea. All I can think about was... Man me running uphill for a mile this morning is the equivalent of 1/3rd the calories in this tea. 

I ordered the pad Thai and my friends had a variety of stuff... The pad ke pow, curries etc. I liked my pad Thai. It's on the sweeter side but it's saucy and hits the spot. I also liked my friends dishes as well. The curry was rich with heavy coconut hints. Everything  was very flavorful. The lunch special also gives you a general portion of leafy green salad... Not that iceberg lettuce situation some other restaurants give, and a bowl of delicious Tom yum soup.  

You can pick the spicyness levels of the food from 1 to 5. My friends got a level 5 for their curry but it wasn't too bad. You can definitely taste it in the end and it stays with you for a bit but I can handle it and I usually go for a medium or mild. 

I was very satisfied with the meal and will definitely be back.

Food was pretty good. We enjoy spicy Thai food so it was great that they were able to accommodate our taste buds. They have the traditional Thai dishes, but they they also had the Isaan section. We decided to order from the Isaan section because there aren't many restaurants that offer those types of dishes. The papaya salad with crab was very good and spicy. The portions are pretty large too. Prices are a bit higher than other places, but then again the portions make up for it. We would return to Weera and recommend others try it out.

I went there last night and for some reason I don't feel like the food is as good as it used to be. Could it be that maybe the chef has changed? The one thing that I do get that I always like there are the crab Rangoon's and the green curry. Still the best Thai food around though!
Had the red curry and it was really good. The Thai iced coffee was delicious as well. The staff was very nice and the service was fast. Everyone left very satisfied. Five stars all day.

Easily one of the TOP 3 Thai restaurants in town
Beautiful decor and very good authentic Thai food.

This place is AMAZING!!!!! Its so hard to find authentic thai restaurant. The portions are huge and the prices are reasonable. Service was great!! The waitress was very cute and nice. I'd recommend this place to everyone :)

I love Weera Thai! It's about time I write a review after eating here so many times. The recent expansion is great. I hear they now have boba thai tea!

I mainly visit here for the lunch specials. There are many options to choose from; you basically choose your flavor, meat, and spice level. Thai tea (without boba) can also be included in the lunch special for a dollar.

The best thing I had from here is the soft shell crab. It is definitely worth that hefty price tag! If you come here often, you should at least try it once. My favorite lunch special is the Fresh Ginger. It is not overwhelmingly ginger-y at all - they add some other vegetables in it. I usually get it with *crispy* chicken (extra charge) and it always comes out delicious.

If you're wondering what the spice levels are, it's from 1 to 5... or 0 if you're weak like me.

This has now taken the place as my fav Thai restuarant. I first went here because of Groupon. They were extremely polite and happy that I had the Groupon. It seems most places that sell them get mad about having to redeem them. 

I love the Panang. They also make it as spicy as I order it. Most Thai places take a look at my blonde hair and green eyes and I get a 1 on the spicy scale. I work with Thai people and I can eat hotter than hot. My husband always orders sweet and sour and it is delightful. It's not that sticky, sweet stuff. It has a light thin sauce. Delish. I haven't ordered the wine yet as we always go for lunch. I think I'll buy the deal and take my sister and family tomorrow.

24hr location amazing!!! Really nice and clean restaurant. Bar area is completely in closed separate from the family dining area which is really cool! Lots and lots of T.v.'s to watch the games. Service and food was great! Thanks Xenia our waitress.  It was a Sunday and im sure people were at the sports betting areas in the big casinos getting second hand smoke but definitely come here to get away from the crowd and enjoy great drinks and hot fresh wings amazing place.
Chicken penang curry was on point. Took to go on a Saturday night. It looked super busy but it was good.

Went back to Weera Thai- glad to say they are back to their stellar ways.
Had Jungle Curry- which was amazing.
Took friends with me and they also loved it.
They are the best

Not good. Red curry had lots of spice and no flavor. Chow mein was a thin ramen looking noodle. Tons of MSG! Made us sick. Very overpriced! Cloth table cloths were covered in glass, but the part that hangs over my lap was VERY dirty!

This is a hidden gem on the busy side of Sahara.  Decided to go for lunch with some of the coworkers. You wouldn't expect this restaurant to look so nice based on the location. Service was amazing, the owner was great and the food was delicious!!! 

We had the soft shell crab salad. I didn't even have time to take a picture because we were like scavengers who hadn't eaten in a week. It was gone in an instant. The mangoes were so yummy in it and the crisp of the deep fried crab made it even better.  I really don't like to order salads because I'm just not a salad person but would order this salad again and even try some of the others.  

We also had some of the norms; yellow curry, panang, spicy basil, and some orange chicken. We tried something different on the yellow chicken and opted for fried chicken instead of the regular. 

They have a pretty extensive menu which I also noticed other items such as crispy duck. How can you not go back to try that? Definitely a place I'd like to revisit and try some of the other not so popular dishes.

I fall in love with this place, most of the food is very delicious, authentic and amazing!! Every time I came here, there's no regrets. I always ordered lot of food here. Last time I took my family from SFO here, we decided only to get some appetizer and go to buffets later. But we ended up ordered so many things crispy rice salad, catfish with salad, papaya salad, shrimp roll, spring roll, grilled pork, basil pork, fish fried rice, sticky rice and ETC (and 3 desserts). And my family ordered lots of food home at the same day. I would recommend this place:)
Great delivery service and great thai food. I've had the beef noodle soup, crab rangoons and pad thai many times. All are great

This is a nice little clean Thai food place. I have eaten there about 9 times and I have never been disappointed. The service is great the servers know me so they always to take a seat any place they are very nice my food is fresh tasty and prepared in a timely fashion. And they never rush you to hurry up I want to give this place four and a half stars but I didn't know how to make that  star half so they got 4 stars good place to try it out.

Yummy food and very fresh even when delivered. We had the pot stickers and they honestly saved my life. We had the drunken noodle and chicken fried rice. They both were fresh and delic. Only wish they had cut the basil more.

For the last two years my fiancé and I have been coming here at least once every other week, and we've never left disappointed. Their food is always delicious and hits the spot, their servers are always nice and recognize regulars, which makes you feel welcomed and at home.

I heard about this place because one of my patients told me that they have the best thai food! She brags about how good it is and not even other thai place could ever compare to it.

I see how a lot of people like this place and gave such a great ratings but for me its good but its not the best thai restaurant here in Vegas. 

I didnt like how the noodles for the pad thai is overcooked!!!! It also lack of flavor!

We also ordered this shrimp that is wrap in crispy noodle which is really great and the papaya salad. They also have happy hour!!!! I also liked the crab fried rice!! I cant say much about the food because it didnt really surprised me on how good it was. 

The service...well theres this one guy who is very attentive!! He's the only guy I saw checking up on everyone. Our other server (wearing glasses) shes also pretty nice...but I think they could do better especially how if we mentioned their names on survey they get a trip to Disney!! They also need to smile a lil more often!!!

Absolutely amazing! Tasty, home-made noodles with spices to your desired level of heat. The lychee nut saki was delightful. We had the curry and noodle dishes. Worth driving off the Las Vegas  Strip to have food Nirvana experience!

A lot of Thai customers in this restaurant - A first good sign.
Friendly staff and service - a second good sign
The Menu has wide variety kinds of food to offer
Delicious authentic Thai food especially Issan sausages, Somtum with fried catfish.  Curry dish was very authentic and tasted great, Fried kale with Crispy pork was OK.  ChiangMai sausage was OK.  As every restaurant has its own specialty -  This one is very good on Issan Menu, all spicy salad and curry.
Price is a little bit more expensive than in my city.  However, it is still affordable and worth the money you pay.
Overall, this is a good place to have Authentic Thai food in Las Vegas.

This place is seriously legit. We were impressed with the food (green curry, pineapple fried rice and pad thai), all were delicious beyond your normal everyday Thai place. However, the ambience in the restaurant was very nice! The decor isn't cheesy like most Asian places (you know, with hodge podge Oriental style decor picked up from discount stores), but with beautiful eye catching Thai style pieces. Adds to the deliciousness of the meal to be surrounded by such glittery beauty!
